tropeNotes: [Badass Crew](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassCrew): It wouldn't be a *Final Fantasy* game without one, now would it? All four are powerful fighters and willing to stick together through thick and thin.
[Cool Car](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolCar): The group rides in Noctis's *Regalia*, a memento from his father Regis.

[Demoted to Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemotedToExtra): In *[Kingsglaive: Final Fantasy XV](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/KingsglaiveFinalFantasyXV)*, Noctis and his friends only appear in the opening scenes/prologue and [The Stinger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStinger).
    - In *Dawn of the Future*, (SPOILER) Noctis leaves Ignis, Gladio and Prompto behind at Hammerhead when he hears about Luna's resurrection; they are not mentioned again until the end of the novel .

[Fighter, Mage, Thief](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FighterMageThief): Noctis is a [Jack of All Stats](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JackOfAllStats), but his crew consists of Gladiolus (the Fighter who specializes in close combat and brute strength), Ignis (the Mage who's very skilled in elemental attacks), and Prompto (the Thief who specializes in ranged, quick attacks). Interestingly, Ignis and Prompto can also switch the roles depending on their playstyle, as Ignis can also wield knives and focus on zippy, [Flash Step](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlashStep)-style knife attacks and Prompto has access to status-causing and elemental firearms.

[Heterosexual Life-Partners](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeterosexualLifePartners): Noctis, Prompto, Ignis, and Gladiolus are best friends who stick with each other through thick and thin. However, three of them have female love interests, making their bond as friends 100% heterosexual ([Ignis, on the other hand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguouslyGay)...)

[Men Don't Cry](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MenDontCry): Thoroughly averted.  (SPOILER) During the mid-credits stinger, set during the gang's final campfire dinner before returning to Insomnia for the final battle, the guys are clearly mourning the fact that Noctis would have to die to purge Eos of both the Starscourge and Ardyn's madness, and so could the other three defending him.

[Nice, Mean, and In-Between](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceMeanAndInbetween): Among Noctis’ friends: Prompto is the cheerful and optimistic one (Nice), Gladio is gruff and brutally honest with everyone (Mean), and Ignis is the strategist who often keeps things in the middle (In-Between).
[Optional Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalBoss): In *Episode Ardyn*, you can fight Noctis and his retinue in an optional battle.
[Promoted to Playable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PromotedToPlayable): At first only Noctis was playable, but an update saw that all four became full-fledged player characters.
[Secret A.I. Moves](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SecretAIMoves): Ignis, Gladio and Prompto all have abilities they can only use as AI controlled allies and abilities they can only use when playable.

[The Team](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheTeam): A [Band of Brothers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BandOfBrothers) foursome with odd parallels to another famous [four-brother team:](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/TeenageMutantNinjaTurtles) Noctis is the serious but kind [Leader](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Leader) and prince. Gladiolus is both [The Lancer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLancer) and [The Big Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBigGuy) as his body guard and most experienced fighter. Ignis is [The Smart Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheSmartGuy) as his attendant who has received rare special education. Prompto is [The Baby of the Bunch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBabyOfTheBunch) [Plucky Comic Relief](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PluckyComicRelief).

[Trademark Favorite Food](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrademarkFavoriteFood): Each member has preferred dishes among those Ignis can cook. This is actually a gameplay mechanic, as eating a character's favorite dish increases how fast their skills level up (or, in the case of Noct, increases the speed the Tech Gauge increases).

[True Companions](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueCompanions): No matter whether time, distance or even heated arguments come between them, the boys always have each other's backs.
QUOTE  **Cid**: Remember, those ain't your bodyguards. They're your brothers. Trust in 'em. Always.

[Watching Troy Burn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WatchingTroyBurn): At the beginning of the game, the four can only watch helplessly when their hometown, Insomnia, gets burned to the ground by Niflheim and their daemons.
[11th-Hour Superpower](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EleventhHourSuperpower): In *Episode Ignis*,  (SPOILER) he puts on the Ring of the Lucii to fight Ardyn. In the initial ending, it's how he goes blind .

[Act of True Love](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActOfTrueLove): Whatever the nature of that love may be, his decision to  (SPOILER) wear the Ring of the Lucii and offer his eyesight and even his entire life in order to protect Noctis  is motivated by his love for Noctis.

[A Day in the Limelight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ADayInTheLimelight): Like Gladio and Prompto before, Ignis has his own DLC scenario in the form of *Episode Ignis*, however, unlike those two, *Ignis* contains a "[Verse 2](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StoryBranching)" option, selecting it will result in a [Alternate Timeline](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AlternateTimeline), one where Ignis becomes the [Deuteragonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Deuteragonist) for the main story alongside Noctis.

[Always Save the Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AlwaysSaveTheGirl): Noctis's safety and wellbeing is the most important thing in the world to him, to the point that he's willing to allow all of humanity to be sacrificed just to protect Noctis.  (SPOILER) Losing his eyesight  isn't enough to deter him from this. Even his [in-game programming](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStoryIntegration) reflects this, as his AI tends to position himself close to wherever Noctis is.

[Ambiguously Gay](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguouslyGay): [Occasional teasing with Aranea aside](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShipTease), he's the only one of the four party members to never show any overt romantic interest in women, and Prompto's remarks about Ardyn not being Ignis's type suggests that he doesn't think [Incompatible Orientation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IncompatibleOrientation) is the issue here, and likewise Ardyn makes some insulting comments towards him in *Episode Ignis* that suggest his intense attachment to Noctis might be more than just duty or platonic friendship.

[Artificial Stupidity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArtificialStupidity): Invoked due to [Gameplay and Story Integration](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStoryIntegration). After Ignis  (SPOILER) is blinded , his competence in the field drops like a stone — he can't keep up with the party as they move about, he can't use his Techniques, and he ineffectually flails his weapons at where he *thinks* the enemy is, possibly hitting party members in his efforts.

[Badass Bookworm](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBookworm): Received a rare classical education and is a capable combatant in the group. Amusingly however he is not one to read for pleasure and scoffs at the idea when Gladio tells him to read a book sometime.
[Badass in a Nice Suit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassInANiceSuit): He dresses the most formally of the buddies, complete with [High-Class Gloves](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HighClassGloves).
[Battle Butler](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BattleButler): Maybe not his actual profession, but fits the archetype perfectly. He's also the group's driver and chef.

[Beneath the Mask](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeneathTheMask): For much of the game Ignis comes off as the most mature and professional member of the party. When we actually get to see the story from his side, we see that beneath that facade of stoicism lies a very emotional and impulsive youth. This appears to be a conscious decision on his part, as he goes back to his more serious demeanor once he's back at Noctis's side, although it's shown to the player that he's deeply troubled inside.

[Big Brother Instinct](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBrotherInstinct): As Regis asked Ignis to be Noctis’s brother figure from a young age, Ignis takes looking after Noctis very seriously; he’s even deliberately partnered with Ravus in episode Ignis to showcase how similar the two’s protectiveness towards Noctis and Luna are. This instinct is one of his driving characteristics, and he puts it over all else, including  (SPOILER)  saving the world,  if necessary.
QUOTE **Ignis:** This world means nothing to me. Do with it as you wish. But I refuse to let Noct  (SPOILER) sacrifice his life to save ours. I won't let you take him away!

[Big Brother Mentor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBrotherMentor): Essentially how his job position as advisor, tutor, and strategist to Noctis plays out. Actually literally, since he started when he was in grade school and *Episode Ignis* reveals that Regis specifically asked him to serve as a brother to Noctis in his youth.
[Black Comedy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackComedy): Often enjoys making grim jokes at Prompto's expense.

[Blind Weaponmaster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlindWeaponmaster): After the [Time Skip](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeSkip), when Noctis  (SPOILER) gets out of the Crystal,  Ignis has become this, having taken to hunting daemons at night without breaking a sweat.

[Blind Without Them](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlindWithoutThem): [Averted](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AvertedTrope), Ignis eyes are passable, he just prefers to not have any sort of blurriness.  (SPOILER) Also averted after Altissia since he's blind whether or not he's wearing them.
[Blue Blood](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlueBlood): According to a comment from Noctis during gameplay, Ignis is a Count. His uncle served on Regis's royal council.

[Brains and Brawn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrainsAndBrawn): The Brains to Gladiolus's Brawn. Ignis received a special education for gifted children to work as a staff officer for Noctis and uses shrewd logic. Gladiolus comes from a long line of protectors to the royal family, and is instead trained to use his fighting abilities to serve Noctis. Their names even lampshade this (see their respective [Meaningful Names](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName)).

[Break the Cutie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreakTheCutie):  (SPOILER) *Episode Ignis* reveals that Pryna showed him a vision of the future, and that Ignis has known about Noctis's fate all along, being absolutely crushed about it ever since he came to discover it. It however allows him to change the events and the future in the changed timeline, saving Noctis in the process.
[Character Catchphrase](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterCatchphrase): "Indeed" and "[That's it! I've come up with a new recipe!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MemeticMutation)"

[Chef of Iron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChefOfIron): Is the party's main cook who can cook up meals at camp that give the party buffs and can come up with new recipes on the fly even while in the midst of battle (killing creatures serves as one of his main sources of inspiration) on top of being one of Noctis' closest friends and personal bodyguard since they were kids.
[Childhood Friend](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildhoodFriend): Of Noctis, having met him when they were kids and have been close ever since.
[Child Prodigy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildProdigy): As a gifted child, he was given special education to make him the ideal consultant for Noctis.
[Choice of Two Weapons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChoiceOfTwoWeapons): Iggy uses dual daggers along with a spear for a sub weapon.
[Classy Cane](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ClassyCane): Uses one after  (SPOILER) he goes blind, though he ditches it in the timeskip.

[Combat Medic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatMedic): Many of Ignis's abilities are to support and heal allies, such as "Regroup," which calls the party to him while rapidly restoring everyone's health, Regenerate allows him to to regularly heal party members and his exclusive accessories the Good and Grand Chamberlain allow him to automatically use items to heal Noctis when his HP drops beyond a certain threshold.
[The Comically Serious](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheComicallySerious): Quite funny without meaning to be, a highlight of this being when his glasses are stolen by a chocobo.
[The Confidant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheConfidant): He acts like this for Noctis, who he understands better than anyone.
[The Consigliere](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheConsigliere): As Noct's unofficial [Number Two](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NumberTwo) and advisor.

[Counter-Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CounterAttack): When playable Ignis has a unique counter attack system requiring a bit more precision then Noctis, allowing him to return dodged attacks or heavy blows with a powerful spear attack.

[Cultured Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CulturedBadass): As expected of a noble and consultant to the future King, Ignis is highly intellectual, and much more formal than his companions. He's also very good at attacking enemies with knives and magic.
[Cuteness Proximity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CutenessProximity): While every single one of them gushes over the newly hatched black chocobo chick, Ignis utterly *melts* at the sight of it.

[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): While he's the most serious of the four Ignis isn't without a hefty sense of humor, and absolutely excels with his sarcastic zingers. QUOTE **Prompto**: *(when the party has to cross a steep unsteady ledge)* Can I just— QUOTE **Noctis**: It'll hold you. QUOTE **Ignis**: Famous last words.

QUOTE **Aranea**: Daemons. Till death do us part. QUOTE **Ignis**: Practicing your vows?

[Declaration of Protection](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeclarationOfProtection): Of the "protecting a badass" variant. At multiple points in the story Ignis declares his desire to protect Noctis, to the very end. He even gets a theme dedicated to him and Ravus called "The Two Protectors".

[Designated Parents](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DesignatedParents): Fits the role of [Team Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamMom) towards Noctis, being his [primary caretaker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HouseHusband), whereas Gladio is more of a [Team Dad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamDad), even telling Ignis to stop coddling Noctis. Since Noctis couldn’t take care of himself when he started living at his own apartment, [Ignis took up the role of homemaker, doing the laundry, household cleaning, chauffeuring, grocery shopping, cooking, etc](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PromotionToParent). Especially cooking though, where the images are [Food Porn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FoodPorn).

[The Determinator](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDeterminator): Stops at nothing to keep Noctis out of harm's way, even giving up  (SPOILER) his vision, and in one continuity, choosing to offer up his own life in exchange for keeping Noctis out of Ardyn's hands . He also spends the entirety of  (SPOILER) the 10-year timeskip researching the history of Eos in an attempt to save Noctis from his fate. In the Extra Verse, he succeeds.

[Deuteragonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Deuteragonist): *Episode Ignis* reveals he's this,  (SPOILER) as not only did he know about Noctis' ultimate fate, he's given a chance to change the events to come, and manages to do so, resulting in another ending for the whole story.  *Royal Edition* furthers this by portraying him as the central and most devoted of Noctis's three friends, and while the other two have their own dedicated finishers during the boss fights with the Lucii, Ignis's has him set up a two-parter with Noctis.

[Driven to Suicide](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DrivenToSuicide): Ultimately averted, but heavily implied (and confirmed by [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod)) that (SPOILER) he planned on dying along with Noctis in the throne room, until Noctis cuts him off to dissuade him. In a conversation during the journey through Insomnia Noctis can ask Ignis to see the dawn for him, as if to talk him out of thoughts of suicide.

[Dual Wielding](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DualWielding): Ignis's main weapon type are pairs of knives that he can switch to [Reverse Grip](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReverseGrip) during combos, as well as hurl at enemies.

[Dub Personality Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DubPersonalityChange): Ignis has a different personality in the original Japanese script as he is presented as gentle (especially to Noctis), well-mannered even to enemies, humble, and a straightforward young man who rarely jokes around and takes his duties seriously. The English localization went in the opposite direction and did the [British Stuffiness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BritishStuffiness) route instead, being a [Comically Serious](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ComicallySerious) [Quintessential British Gentleman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/QuintessentialBritishGentleman) and a [Pungeon Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PungeonMaster) who dishes out [snark](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker) like it's candy, even to his charge.

[Earn Your Happy Ending](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EarnYourHappyEnding): Big time.  (SPOILER) After completing his episode a first time, he's given a chance to change the events of the whole game, resulting in a much happier ending, which can be considered as another one for the whole story.

[Elemental Rock-Paper-Scissors](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ElementalRockPaperScissors): Libra Elementia targets an enemy with a spell of the element they are weakest against, while Enhancement grants Noctis a buff enhancing his attacks with the element enemies are weakest against. Ignis can also easily take advantage of this when playable with his [Spell Blade](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpellBlade) attacks but falters when enemies resist all elements because he lacks a way to deal [Non-Elemental](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonElemental) damage.
["Eureka!" Moment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EurekaMoment): *"That's it! I've come up with a new recipe!"* You'll be hearing that *a lot* as you play through the game.

[Eye Scream](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EyeScream): During the battle with Leviathan,  (SPOILER) he claims he was blinded by Imperial forces and the tsunami. Though *Episode Ignis* reveals he was fibbing a bit there, and that he lost his sight by putting on the Ring of the Lucii while trying to protect Noctis.

[Eyes Always Shut](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EyesAlwaysShut): After  (SPOILER) being blinded  in Episode 9, Ignis keeps his eyes shut for the remainder of the game. On the rare occasion he opens them again, they are [pure white](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProphetEyes).

[First-Name Basis](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FirstNameBasis): In the English dub of *Episode Duscae* he only refers to Noctis as "Highness", but in the Japanese version, he actually calls Noctis by his nickname. This seems to have been noticed; in the Master Version footage he does call Noctis "Noct" in the English version.

[Flechette Storm](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlechetteStorm): He can pull this off thanks to the [Summon to Hand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SummonToHand) nature of weapons in the game. His Mark technique even works on the principle of throwing as many knives in as many enemies as he can so Noctis can use them as beacons for his Warp Strike.
[Glad I Thought of It](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GladIThoughtOfIt): If you buy a cookbook, he will state that he has "come up with a new recipe" like he didn't just read it from said cookbook.

[Grappling-Hook Pistol](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GrapplingHookPistol): As a playable character, Ignis comes equipped with a [Super Wrist-Gadget](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperWristGadget) with a retractable grapnel attached to it to get him around Atissia.

[Handicapped Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HandicappedBadass):  (SPOILER) He gets blinded after putting on the Ring of the Lucii. At first, this significantly slows Ignis down, to the point that he becomes [The Load](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLoad). After ten years of practice, Ignis regains almost all of the skill he had before.

[He's Back!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HesBack): The game even lampshades it when he  (SPOILER) kills the Malboro while being blind  saying that you can now use his command technique and no longer  (SPOILER) slows the pace due to his blindness. It still takes a while for him to be as useful as before though.

[Honor Before Reason](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HonorBeforeReason): When a black chocobo steals his glasses, Noctis reminds him he has a spare pair, but Ignis refuses to let his perfectly fine glasses serve as a chocobo's trinket.

[Improbable Hairstyle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImprobableHairstyle): Ignis, at first, seems to have the most realistic (that is to say [non-anime](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimeHair)) hairstyle of the main party, with a quiff that looks quite attainable with about half a tub of gel, except we see his hair down for the first time in *Episode Ignis* and it's short, far too short to be styled into a quiff.
[Improbable Use of a Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImprobableUseOfAWeapon): One of his attack animations is to toss one of his knives in the air and spin-kick it into an enemy.
[In a Single Bound](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InASingleBound): Like Aranea, he has the Dragoon signature (High) Jump in his repertoire when he is a playable character.

[In-Series Nickname](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InSeriesNickname): Noctis occasionally calls him "Specs", while the rest of the group tends to call him "Iggy". Sometimes Prompto will also call him "Igster".

[Invulnerable Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InvulnerableAttack): Parodied with Ignis's Quick Recipeh skill which he will do in mid-battle, stop to prepare himself a meal becoming entirely immune to any attack while he is cooking.

[Katanas Are Just Better](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KatanasAreJustBetter): In earlier builds for *Versus XIII* his main weapon was a katana, representative of his sense of duty toward Noctis. Retained in the final game's Armiger Chain, where he wields the Katana of the Warrior.

[Knight Templar Big Brother](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KnightTemplarBigBrother): Regis told him to serve as a brother to Noctis, and he's willing to trade  (SPOILER) the future of the entire world for his continued safety , something which Noctis chafes against at times.

[Large Ham](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeHam): Can veer into this territory with his almost Shakespearean manner of speaking, especially when [he comes up with a new recipe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterCatchphrase).
[Life Drain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LifeDrain): Ignis can drain the life of enemies with the Lancet ability.
[Living Emotional Crutch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LivingEmotionalCrutch): It's implied Noctis is this to Ignis, given the lengths to which he is willing to sacrifice everything for him.

[The Load](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLoad): Becomes this for a while after  (SPOILER)  he's blinded in Altissia . In one mission, you have to stay near to him or face a game over screen and when being attacked by mobs he's pretty much a sitting duck and can only use one technique. He gets over it after the time skip.

[Magic Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicKnight): Ignis is the party member most focused on spellcasting besides Noctis himself, having higher magic power and several attacks that make use of magic flasks to support allies or attack enemies. As a playable character his ability to use magic is greatly expanded even compared to Noctis himself with his [Spell Blade](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpellBlade) mechanic and his Total Clarity spells.

[The Medic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheMedic): Ignis can heal allies with the Regenerate and Regroup abilities and his Good and Grand Chamberlain accessories let him automatically heal Noct with potions when his HP drops below a certain threshold.
[Meaningful Echo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulEcho): *Episode Ignis* reveals the above quote to be this in-universe, as it was what Regis had said when he first introduced Ignis to Noctis.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): "Ignis" means fire, which is the element of his ultimate attack, and "scientia" means knowledge, befitting his status as [The Smart Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheSmartGuy). And as we find out in *Episode Ignis*, he can actually be quite the [Hot-Blooded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotBlooded) young man.

[The Mourning After](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheMourningAfter): While the person in question wasn't dead yet,  (SPOILER) comments made about Ignis over the course of the ten years of darkness indicate that Ignis took Noctis's disappearance particularly hard compared to Gladio and Prompto, and while the other two tried to move on with their lives, he would do things like take up Noctis's favorite hobby of fishing and station himself close to where Noctis would eventually emerge. In hindsight, it may have to do with the fact that he knew exactly what caused Noctis's disappearance, thanks to Pryna's vision .

[Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy): He's unfailingly polite and courteous to everyone even when clearly upset, is shown to be an idealized gentleman and is a very patient, kind, gentle and loyal friend to those he cares about.
[Noodle Incident](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoodleIncident): According to Noctis at a certain point in *Episode Duscae 2.0*, he once ran over Gladio's foot with the Regalia.

[Not So Above It All](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotSoAboveItAll): He makes horrible puns like the others, will declare "That's it!" after defeating monsters since he figured out a new recipe and when the Regalia is stolen, he refuses a courtesy car since it wouldn't be a match to the Regalia.
    - He completely *melts* at the sight of the [black chocobo chick](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ufUh9VIYKI8). - And nope, not even he can maintain his stoicism and composure when the gang gets a "portrait" of them drawn in Altissia. - He's also not above a bit of self-mockery:
QUOTE **Gladio:** Well Iggy? Don't you got something to say? QUOTE **Ignis:** I hate to disappoint, but I already had a [recipe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedMeme)*[h](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedMeme)* in mind: there's no tuna dish superior to sushi.

[Not So Stoic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotSoStoic): He's one of the most vocal to freak out if an enemy pins or bashes Noctis around, and as the story wears down on the party  (SPOILER)  and Ignis himself is blinded , it definitely pressures him the most. *Episode Ignis* also rather violently deconstructs and breaks apart his standard stoicism as he spends the course of the story trying to assure Noctis is safe, borderline diving into a [Hot-Blooded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotBlooded) and brash equivalent of anxiety. Enough so that [Gladio](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths) has to try to calm him down.

[Only a Flesh Wound](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyAFleshWound):  (SPOILER) He brushes off the injury leading to his blindness as this. It quickly becomes apparent that it's anything but a flesh wound when he's revealed to be permanently blind.
[Only Sane Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlySaneMan): Tries to keep Noctis and the lads out of trouble, with varying degrees of success.

[Overzealous Underling](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OverzealousUnderling): Extremely devoted to Noctis, yet can be very ruthless and singleminded in his moral outlook compared to the more [all-loving](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MessianicArchetype) Noctis, although he never does anything particularly cruel onscreen out of respect for [Noctis's](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoralityChain) wishes.
    - An early draft for his *Brotherhood* [Character Focus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterFocus) episode also indicates that he's willing to engage in brutal violence to protect Noctis, only holding back to [avoid scaring him](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellHero) while he's present. - In *Episode Ignis* he openly admits that he is perfectly willing to (SPOILER) abandon the rest of the world to ruination if it means keeping Noctis alive, and in the "canon" storyline, attempts to dissuade Noctis from fulfilling the prophecy that will save the world, only conceding reluctantly when Noctis presses the situation .

[Power at a Price](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerAtAPrice):  (SPOILER) In *Episode Ignis*, Ignis puts on the Ring of the Lucii to save Noct from Ardyn and fight him off, but since the ring can only be worn by the royal bloodline, Ignis pays the price by losing his eyesight.
[Promoted to Playable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PromotedToPlayable): In the DLC *Episode Ignis*. Carried over to the main game as of the December 2017 update.

[Pungeon Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PungeonMaster): Betraying his stoic demeanor, he'll gladly slip a pun or two into his snarky dialogue whenever the opportunity arises. For example, before his [Optional Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalBoss) fight against Noctis, he starts spouting off multiple puns related to his passion for cooking while trying to get Noctis to eat his vegetables.
QUOTE **Ignis:** I may not be Gladio, but underestimating me is a *recipe* for failure. 
**Noctis:** [Ugh… you're gonna make a meal out of this.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LampshadeHanging) 
**Ignis:** *[if he wins]* That satisfied my appetite for knowledge. Yet alas, our king suffers the bitter taste of defeat. Nothing a healthy helping of greens couldn't fix, of course. 
**Noctis:** *[groaning]*

[Quintessential British Gentleman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/QuintessentialBritishGentleman): In the English dub. Technically Ignis is a Lucian rather than a Brit, but he has the accent, is very sophisticated and well-mannered, and his outfit looks somewhat formal, to reflect his aristocratic upbringing.

[Real Men Cook](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RealMenCook): Despite not being in his job description, Ignis apparently enjoys cooking and assumes the role as the party's cook whenever they make camp (and tracked by level). As long as you provide him with ingredients bought from shops or gathered from the area, he can make some fabulous dishes. But if you run out of ingredients, be prepared to eat flame-roasted toast, basic onigiri or cheese pizza.

["The Reason You Suck" Speech](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheReasonYouSuckSpeech):  (SPOILER)  He gives a subdued one to both Noctis and Gladio when the huge rift amongst themselves created by Luna's death and his own blindness starts getting on his nerves. He tells Noctis that as king, he must be prepared to move forward and accept any consequences that may occur, and he indirectly calls Gladio out on his excessively cruel and insensitive treatment of Noctis, telling him that Noctis *will* take his rightful place, but only once he is ready. Heartwarmingly, his words do go through, and the rift is patched up.
[The Red Mage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheRedMage): The party member with the most mastery of magic after Noctis, though not nearly to the same degree.

[The Reliable One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheReliableOne): Almost any time Noctis takes a hit or is overwhelmed by the enemy, Ignis will rush over to guard him. If your HP is low, he'll also cure you as long as he's nearby. Battles aside, he seems like the one Noctis relies on for just about everything else as well.
[Ride the Lightning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RideTheLightning): With his stormbound daggers activated, Ignis is able to quickly zip around the battlefield as a flash of lightning.

[Satellite Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SatelliteCharacter): [Played for Drama](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayedForDrama), Iggy struggles to find a purpose beyond being Noct's [Number Two](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NumberTwo).

[Scars are Forever](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScarsAreForever): He gains a prominent scar on the left side of his face after the fight with Leviathan ( (SPOILER) actually gained after putting on the Ring ),  (SPOILER) and still has it after the timeskip.

[Seers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Seers): In *Episode Ignis*,  (SPOILER) a dying Pryna shows Ignis a vision of the future, specifically, a vision of Noctis' death. Following that, Ignis tries his damnedest to stop that from happening.

[Senseless Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SenselessSacrifice): In *Episode Ignis*, which takes place shortly after Chapter 9, Ardyn is hovering above a downed Noctis and a dead Lunafreya. In desperation, Ignis decides to  (SPOILER) put on the Ring of Lucii at the expense of his eyesight  to stop him. The tragic thing is that Ignis couldn't have known that  (SPOILER) Ardyn was just [Trolling](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Troll) him; he had no intention of actually killing Noctis at that point, not until he'd taken in the power of the Crystal.
[Sesquipedalian Loquaciousness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SesquipedalianLoquaciousness): He really wants you to replenish your supply of curatives.
[Sharp-Dressed Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SharpDressedMan): The only one of Noctis's gang who wears a suit.

[Slice-and-Dice Swordsmanship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SliceAndDiceSwordsmanship): More often then not Ignis will slash people with his polearm rather then thrusting it, this of course is justified, all the polearm weapons in the game have a long head or otherwise a halberd like blade to facilitate both stabbing and slashing attacks.
[The Smart Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheSmartGuy): He was gifted enough to receive special education growing up, and Noctis apparently relies on him for strategies.

tropeName: Smart People Speak the Queen's English
tropeNotes: [Smart People Speak the Queen's English](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmartPeopleSpeakTheQueensEnglish): Has a British accent in the English dub, and is the designated tactician of the party.

[Spellblade](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Spellblade):
    - Comes with the [Venom Fang](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PoisonedWeapons) ability as well as a [Sagefire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlamingSword) attack and can give Noctis a buff with the Enhancement technique that gives his attacks the element of the current target's weakness. - As a playable character, he's a [Spell Fencer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/FinalFantasy) in all but name and is the main focus of his fighting style, with the ability to switch between [Fire, Ice, Lightning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FireIceLightning) to change the properties of his attacks. Fire for single target damage, Ice for AoE damage and Lightning for speedy attacks.

[The Stoic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStoic): Tends to speak in a more serious and aloof tone, especially in the Japanese dub. Subverted in *Episode Ignis*, where we find out he can actually be quite expressive.
[Stoic Spectacles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StoicSpectacles): He's a tall, thin, handsome, and aloof intellectual.

[Super-Senses](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperSenses): A downplayed example. The updated version of Chapter 13 reveals that,  (SPOILER)  he and Gladio are able to reunite with Noctis at Zegnautus Keep because of his sharpened sense of hearing, being able to hear Noctis through the walls and following the direction of his voice .
[Support Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SupportPartyMember): Ignis's special abilities are geared for supporting the party with healing and buffs.

[The Strategist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStrategist): He's the one crafting the plans for the group as proven in the Duscae Demo. Gameplay-wise, his moveset is to either use an elemental weakness on the enemy or tell the group where to strike and where to regroup. One of the nicknames the party frequently calls him in the JP version is "Tactician/Military Advisor" (something the English translation ignores most of the time).
[Tall, Dark, and Handsome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TallDarkAndHandsome): While not as towering as Gladiolus, Ignis is still tall at 183cm (6'), handsome and sophisticated.

[Team Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamMom): As kids, how many of you picked food you didn’t like off your plate and put it on your mother’s? Noctis does this with Ignis *as grown men in their early twenties*. He may play caretaker to everyone in the group, but the extent he takes it to with Noctis is astonishing — he was made responsible for Noctis when they were barely out of diapers, and he’s been willingly acting as Noctis’s personal chef, maid, chauffeur, and *de facto* parent for at least five years before the events of the game, attending to everything from torn shirts to recreating a Tenebraen pastry Noct tried when he was eight.
QUOTE **Noctis**: What are you, my mother or something?

QUOTE **Ignis**: Mum's the word.

[Trademark Favorite Food](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrademarkFavoriteFood): Being the team cook and a man of taste, he has the more developed palate for food, especially for off kilter culinary acquired tastes. Some of his favorites come to also reflect his adept aptitude for cooking, including being able to bake cakes while they rough it on the road. For the most part however, he is not restricted to the high class, loving even street food and fast food. Ignis is also really fond of Ebony [Coffee.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MustHaveCaffeine)
QUOTE **Noctis:** I might have asked before, but is Ebony really all that good? 
**Ignis:** I might have answered before, but yes, it is.

[Undying Loyalty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UndyingLoyalty): Dedicated his entire being to protecting and serving Noctis since childhood, and is willing to sacrifice everything to make sure Noctis is safe.
QUOTE **Ignis**: I swore an oath to stand with Noct and keep him safe. Whatever it takes, I *will* protect him!

[Unkempt Beauty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnkemptBeauty): In the alternative ending of *Episode Ignis*, he loses his glasses and his bangs fall and gets messed up, [and is still pretty looking, if not arguably more.](https://imgur.com/a/UgG4y)

[Weak, but Skilled](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeakButSkilled): He's not as physically strong as Gladio, nor does he have Noct's royal arms, but he still ends up successful through pure skill, and good use of magic. In the obligatory post-completion [Optional Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalBoss) for *Episode Ignis*,  (SPOILER) he fights a duel against Noctis of all people, and, not only does he win despite Noct having multiple Royal Arms, and the Ring of the Lucii, there's an achievement for getting a high rank doing so .

[Younger Than They Look](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YoungerThanTheyLook): A lot of players were under the impression he was a lot older than the group due to his mature demeanor, but he's actually only 22. This is partially due to the dub; in the Japanese version, Ignis sounds like your average well-mannered adult male, while in the English version, he sounds like a far older [Quintessential British Gentleman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/QuintessentialBritishGentleman).
    - In *Episode Ignis*, we see him without his glasses and his hair down for the first time and he shockingly looks quite young.
[11th-Hour Superpower](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EleventhHourSuperpower): The final blessing he gains before he fights Gilgamesh is the power to harm Gilgamesh.
['80s Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EightiesHair): Wears his hair in a long mullet.

[Amazon Chaser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmazonChaser): Implied. See [Eating the Eye Candy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EatingTheEyeCandy) below. Also, if players exploit a glitch that allows them to keep Aranea in their party, they might get a photo with some commentary implying Gladio is attracted to her (and his bros of course giving him a hard time over it).
[The Berserker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBerserker): In *Episode Gladiolus*, he has a special Rage meter that acts as a damage multiplier based on the damage he takes.

[BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS): His weapon is a greatsword. And while most greatswords in the FF-verse are large, his appears to be longer than he is tall (and he's a *big* dude) as well as being nearly as wide as a human being. And then there's when he can help grab the ones wielded by Iron Giants.

[Big Brother Instinct](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBrotherInstinct): He asks Noctis to bring Iris with them since she might be in danger, refuses anyone but Ignis to drive while she is there because he doesn't trust anyone else's driving and drops Iris when they go busting an imperial base. He also has some shade of this with Noctis saying that when the prince isn't thinking straight he has to think for both. He also has this towards Noctis, with [the developers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) stating that his relationship with Noctis was written to be like that of a big brother to his little brother.
    - In a lovely bit of [Gameplay and Story Integration](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStoryIntegration), should you bring Iris into combat with you, he'll sometimes hang back and take up a protective stance in front of her instead of rushing right into the fray.

[Big Brother Mentor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBrotherMentor): He provides the combat tutorial in both *Episode Duscae* and *XV*, and is in fact the one who taught Noctis how to fight in the first place. He's also an *actual* big brother, having a younger sister named Iris, as Episode 3 of *Brotherhood* shows.
[The Big Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBigGuy): Noticeably older and more muscular than the others, as well as the most experienced combatant.
[Blue Blood](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlueBlood): He's the eldest son of the noble House of Amicitia.

[Brutal Honesty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrutalHonesty): Takes this stance with Noctis, considering it part of his duties to keep Noctis's head on straight via [Tough Love](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ToughLove). First demonstrated when Noctis is starting to waver while facing a berserk Titan, when he forces Noctis to look beyond his own hangups and focus on his duties and responsibilities instead. (SPOILER) It ends up later causing a rift that nearly costs them their friendship after the events in Altissia; though Noctis is [dealing with Luna's death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Mangst) in the best way he can, Gladio interprets it as [Wangst](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Wangst) and repeatedly calls him out on it, even going so far as to call him a coward and blame him for Luna's death, along with calling him out for being too focused on mourning Luna to acknowledge Ignis's life-changing injury made for his sake. It takes Ignis getting over his handicap and taking his first steps to [Handicapped Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HandicappedBadass) status and speaking up to both of them for them to start to patch things up.
[Character Catchphrase](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterCatchphrase): Could double as a [Badass Boast](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBoast). "Stop bitching, start killing."

[Charles Atlas Superpower](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharlesAtlasSuperpower): Those bulging muscles aren't just for show. On top of him wielding that giant BFS that would make Cloud Strife nod in respect, in *Episode Gladiolus*, he can wield giant stone pillars the size of tree trunks as makeshift weapons.

[Chick Magnet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChickMagnet): While not seen directly, he's strongly implied by the rest of the group to be the most successful at chatting up the ladies. After the [Time Skip](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeSkip), he's apparently in a fairly serious relationship with an unnamed (and unseen) woman.

[Cowardice Callout](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CowardiceCallout): He calls Noctis a coward when telling the latter off for doing nothing but mope in self-pity after  (SPOILER) Lunafreya gave her life  so he could do his duty — it's at this point that Noctis fully loses his temper.

[Defeating the Undefeatable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefeatingTheUndefeatable): Managed to do it twice; first one is the Gilgamesh and Cor Leonis who is considered to be one strongest people in Lucian.

[Difficult, but Awesome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DifficultButAwesome): Gladio requires a bit more skill to use effectively then other characters because his damage booster only gets large boosts when precision guarding. But when you have mastered the ability to precision guard, he can practically become invincible while dealing the damage cap with every swing of his sword.
[Disappeared Dad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisappearedDad): His father was killed during Niflheim's invasion of Lucis.

[Dual Wielding](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DualWielding): Normally dual swords isn't Gladio's forte, but his most powerful Glaive Art Dual Master has him summon his Genji Blade to wield in tandem with his greatsword for a powerful [Blade Spam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BladeSpam) combo.
[Eating the Eye Candy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EatingTheEyeCandy): He comments on the physical fitness of the women of Lestallum with a very approving tone (at least in the English dub).
[Fastball Special](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FastballSpecial): Performs this with Noctis in Episode 5 of *Brotherhood* and can do it in gameplay for both Noctis and Iris.
[Female Gaze](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FemaleGaze): His "Rugged Attire" outfit has him entirely shirtless (save for an armband and a pendant) and given that the game has a camera feature…

[Genius Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GeniusBruiser): Despite his appearance, he's anything but dumb, and is in fact one of the smarter members of the group. While Ignis is [The Smart Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheSmartGuy), Gladio is no slouch in this department either, giving tactical advice just as much as Ignis does even though Ignis' combat role is as strategist, guides the party even beyond that when they're doing things such as camping or giving Noctis advice on fishing, has a lot of knowledge of flora and fauna befitting his role as The Survivalist, and is shown to be an avid bookreader, taking out a book to read almost every time the group gets in the car. He even tries to tell Ignis to read a book, who astonishingly refuses. He also recognizes Sania and chats her up immediately, dragging the group into a biology expedition to catch frogs, and then scoffs at Ignis taking until the end of the quest to realize they were questing for a world class biologist despite knowing her name. After all, being raised and trained to protect the next king means you must be educated as well, and he even tells Noctis that it's his job to think for both of them; a job he does well.

[Good Scars, Evil Scars](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodScarsEvilScars): Has a hero-style scar over his eye. He also has a second one on his forehead and a large one across his chest when he rejoins the party after their mythril hunt,  (SPOILER) that were given to him by Gilgamesh .

[Go Through Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoThroughMe): When Ravus accosts Noctis, Gladio quickly puts himself between them in an attempt to defend Noctis, but gets ragdolled by Ravus with a single punch.
[Ground Punch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GroundPunch): Gladio's Cyclone attack works on this principle using a Shield as a [Power Fist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerFist) to do it.
[Heroic Build](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicBuild): He's the [BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS) wielder, and has the type of build needed for it.
[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): He can often be seen reading novels while camping or riding in the Regalia.
[Hunk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Hunk): The most masculinely handsome and [well built](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicBuild) [member of the group.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBigGuy)

[Hypocrite](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Hypocrite): He calls Noctis out for not stepping up and fulfilling his duty as king over personal grief, while conveniently forgetting that he himself left the party for a while after he got [Worfed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheWorfEffect) by Ravus. Slightly [downplayed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownplayedTrope) in that making sure the King doesn't fall into funks, alongside keeping him safe and focusing for him when he can't, is part of his *job*.
[In-Series Nickname](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InSeriesNickname): He's "Gladio" to his friends. His sister Iris calls him "Gladdy".

tropeName: Jerk with a Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Jerk with a Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold): While he has a very gruff demeanor and tends to get in Noctis' face on more than one occasion over the course of the game, particularly after the events of Chapter 9, it's clear that he's a man of honor and that he really cares deeply about his friends. He just takes his duties very seriously, and wants to make sure that Noctis does the same.

[Lack of Empathy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LackOfEmpathy): Gladio's behavior in Chapter 10 could be interpreted as such, given his misinterpretation of how Noctis is [reeling from the collateral damage of Leviathan's trial](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Mangst) and harsh practicality towards the bigger picture, prioritizing the need to press on to complete their mission over actually allowing the other three time to grieve and recover from the turmoil first. While it's not hard to understand his position, as he too is grieving in his own way, it's undeniable that he comes off as a bit insensitive to Noctis and, to some extent,  (SPOILER) Ignis .
[Lame Pun Reaction](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LamePunReaction): Despite everyone throwing puns around, Prompto's pun about Andamantoise "moving" mountain was just that bad and he should feel bad.

[The Lancer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLancer): His bullheaded sense of duty and focus on the big picture clashes with Noctis, who's still in his fledgling stage as a leader and king. Regardless, Gladiolus always has the latter's back and the two make a formidable duo.
[Legacy of Service](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LegacyOfService): His family has served as protectors of Lucis's royalty for generations.

[Little Guy, Big Buddy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LittleGuyBigBuddy): The Big Buddy to Noct's Little Guy. [Gladiolus is 198cm (just under 6'6) and very brawny](http://www.siliconera.com/2016/06/01/final-fantasy-xvs-character-profiles-tell-us-noctis-bros/) while Noctis is 176cm (just over 5'9) with a slender physique.

tropeName: Luckily, My Shield Will Protect Me
tropeNotes: [Luckily, My Shield Will Protect Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LuckilyMyShieldWillProtectMe): Gladio can use shields as a sub weapon, and when he does he just takes to using his [BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS) [like an arming sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHandedZweihander) with it.

[Manly Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManlyMan): With the other three being fashionable pretty boys, you can smell Gladiolus' testosterone from a mile away. He's big, tall and brawny, and most outfits flaunt his impressive physique. He has high strength and health, wields the biggest weapons and is the most experienced fighter of the group. He's an avid and rugged outdoorsman who never turns down a challenge or runs from a fight. He's no mere meathead, however, as he encapsulates many nobler masculine attributes as well. He is fearless in the face of adversity, unwaveringly diligent in his duties and stoic in hardship and strife.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): His first name is a pun on a type of sword, and his last name means "friendship". "Gladiolus" is also [a type of flower](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gladiolus) known as the sword lily.

[Mighty Glacier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MightyGlacier): Because he has the party's highest HP, Strength and Vitality, as well as access to Shields, he'll likely be the last to go down. As a playable character he also attacks the slowest but rewards weathering attacks with his shield, empowering his attacks every time you do so.
    - He gets called out on this fighting style by Gilgamesh, who initially sees him as an unrefined brute unworthy of being the Shield of the Chosen King. Gladio changes his mind with a display of, uh, [brute force](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IResembleThatRemark).

[Mr. Fanservice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrFanservice): The man is a [Hunk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Hunk) with a constant (literally if you have the Rugged Attire) [Walking Shirtless Scene](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingShirtlessScene). It's bound to happen.

[Mountain Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MountainMan): He's quite an outdoorsman and a survivalist (it's his particular skill), being the one who assembles the tent and directs the party when they make camp.

[My Greatest Failure](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyGreatestFailure): While protecting Noctis, being so easily pushed back by one blow from Ravus makes Gladio question if he can be the shield of the king, which convinces him to leave the group for a while to search for a way to get stronger, kick-starting *Episode Gladiolus*.

[My Sister Is Off-Limits](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MySisterIsOffLimits): Defied, actually. One of the optional tours you can trigger for him has him basically trick Noctis into getting a bouquet of flowers from a volcanic region for Iris, and Gladio then asks Noct to give it to her instead of him; when Noct doesn't get why it matters which of them gives it to her, Gladio [comments about how clueless Noct is sometimes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObliviousToLove). When picking your photograph at the end of the game, if you choose one of Iris, his comment is that he'll have to turn a blind eye.
[Noodle Incident](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoodleIncident): According to Noctis's comeback during Gladio's second Tour in *Episode Duscae 2.0*, Ignis once ran over his foot with the Regalia.
[Practical Taunt](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PracticalTaunt): Gladio has a taunt ability allowing him to take the focus off of Noctis and onto himself.

[Promoted to Playable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PromotedToPlayable): In the DLC *Episode Gladiolus*, as well as Chapter 13 Verse 2. Carried over to the rest of the main game as of the December 2017 update.

[Put on a Bus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PutOnABus): At the beginning of Chapter 7 he leaves the group to partake in the business that takes place in the *Episode Gladiolus* DLC. When he comes back, he has another scar.
[Quit Your Whining](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/QuitYourWhining): His catchphrase is "stop bitching, start killing".
[Shield Bash](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShieldBash): Gladio can use his shield as a [Power Fist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerFist) for many of his attacks, especially right after counter attacking.

[Sensitive Guy and Manly Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SensitiveGuyAndManlyMan): Manly man to Prompto's sensitive guy. Gladio is rough, aggressive, physically strong, very outdoorsy, [has enormous amounts of mental and emotional fortitude being able to cope with and adapt to difficult and stressful situations no matter the adversity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RealMenDontCry), he loves general physical activity and is very athletic, he's also a very large, muscular man towering over nearly everyone in the game. In-game, Gladio's dialogue can be abrasive at times, mocking Prompto if he hears him complaining by calling him a wuss.
    - (SPOILER) All of this of course makes it absolutely heartwrenching when he sheds a virtual torrent of [manly tears](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManlyTears) during the final "campfire" scene.

[Serious Business](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SeriousBusiness): The man takes his [Cup Noodles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProductPlacement) *very* seriously. Even going so far as initiating his own Quest to have the group *climb a freaking volcano* to steal a *giant egg from a **very** giant bird* just to flavor his noodles. Other possibilities include killing a giant prawn for shrimp, as well as killing a freaking **BEHEMOTH** for some good meat.

[Something We Forgot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SomethingWeForgot): King Regis explicitly requested that Prompto, Ignis and Gladio not to try and guide his wayward son, instead simply to remain by his side through whatever hardship and to lend him support when he needed it. Gladio spends a good amount of time in the story harshly lecturing Noctis on his attitude and actions, the most notable scene being the one in the train where he pushes Prompto out of the way and tells Noctis to get over  (SPOILER) Luna's death , despite their not being much else to do on it. The main reason he seems angry is that he believes Noctis wallowing in self-misery is an insult to the sacrifices of  (SPOILER) Ignis  and  (SPOILER) Luna . He does seem to mellow out somewhat after Ignis tells him that Noctis will take his rightful place, but only once he's ready.
[Spin Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpinAttack): The Tempest technique is great for attacking clustered groups of enemies.
[Sprint Meter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SprintMeter): A unique perk of Gladio's is that he *lacks* this. As a result, Gladio is the only character who naturally has infinite sprint.

[Superior Successor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperiorSuccessor): Cor points out that Gladio's father, Clarus Amicitia, as well as Cor himself, never completed the Trials of Gilgamesh. As of the end of *Episode Gladiolus*, however, Gladio himself completed them. Doubly so if you beat the Final Trial you gain after beating it, since Gladio ends up defeating the legendary Cor the Immortal in a one-on-one duel.
[Sword and Fist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SwordAndFist): When playable, a few of his animations are just ignoring his sword entirely in favor of a good old left-hand punch.
[Sword Beam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SwordBeam): Gladio's Impulse technique launches a very wide horizontal sword beam which deals massive damage to enemies in front of him.
[Sword Plant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SwordPlant): Gladio's Earthshatter Glaive Art has him stab his sword into the ground for an [Ao E](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AoE) shockwave attack.
[Tall, Dark, and Handsome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TallDarkAndHandsome): The tallest member of the team, and very good looking with dark hair and a tan complexion from being very physically active.

[Team Dad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamDad): Among the quartet, Gladio's the oldest. Personality wise, he's also the one who's always calm and disciplinarian, especially to Noctis. He's even a [Drill Sergeant Nasty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DrillSergeantNasty) for Noctis' combat training. Additionally, he has a military background and is the most protective among the team.

[Throwing Your Sword Always Works](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThrowingYourSwordAlwaysWorks): Gladio can hurl his greatsword at enemies for a ranged attack, when playing him this is his only long-ranged attack.

[Trademark Favorite Food](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrademarkFavoriteFood): As reflected of his outdoorsman nature, loves bare-bones game roasted with nothing but an open fire and seasoned with wild gathered herbs and spices. Also enjoys preservable goodies, especially Uncle Randall's Root Beer and Cup Noodles.

[Walking Shirtless Scene](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingShirtlessScene): Why would you button up your shirt when you're so utterly ripped? His shirt can even be blown upwards by wind or his movements, completely revealing his upper body.
    - *Episode Gladiolus* takes this a stage further with the unlockable "[Rugged Attire](http://i.imgur.com/ZEJEHg5.jpg)◊" outfit, in which Gladio removes his shirt altogether to leave his upper body entirely bare.
[Warm-Up Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WarmUpBoss): You spend the combat tutorial hacking him up.
[Wrestler in All of Us](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WrestlerInAllOfUs): In Episode Gladiolus, many of his unique context-sensitive animations involve wrestling moves.

[11th-Hour Superpower](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EleventhHourSuperpower): In *Episode Prompto*,  (SPOILER) the snowmobile gains a minigun turret, one that he uses to take down Verstael post-[One-Winged Angel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneWingedAngel) .

[Action Survivor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionSurvivor): Before the events of the game, Prompto had never been in a fight at all, only receiving a crash course in self-defense training from the Crownsguard a few days prior to Noctis's bachelor party.

[Ambiguously Bi](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguouslyBi): *Loves* girls and is very much interested in Cindy and Aranea, but occasionally shows appreciation for the male physique, as seen by some of his comments on Gladio's [attractiveness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Hunk) and one of his [Stock Phrases](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StockPhrases) when viewing photos of him is "Why you gotta be so photogenic?".

[Artificial Stupidity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArtificialStupidity): Of all of the party members, Prompto usually needs the most attention because his tendency to run into the midst of battle as the team's *firearms specialist* has him getting kicked around a lot. It doesn't help that he starts with the lowest HP in the party too.

[The Baby of the Bunch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBabyOfTheBunch): He’s the least mature of the group with youthful freckles to boot, and is visibly the smallest out of them, being a very skinny 5'8"(173cm).
[BFG](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFG): Some of the Machine type weapons function this way, producing gigantic energy blasts from short range or by.

[Bottomless Magazines](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BottomlessMagazines): Prompto's pistol will never run out of ammo but his other weapons all have limited shots and must be recharged once exhausted. Having the Sigil of the Clever equipped will make it so Prompto's [machine gun will never run out of ammunition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoreDakka)
[Butt-Monkey](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ButtMonkey): He's always the target of most jokes in the game. Gameplay-wise, his lack of experience in combat shows, with him almost stumbling in every move.

[Camera Fiend](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CameraFiend): Prompto will snaps pictures of just about anything, at *any* moment, and it's his unique skill. It's even a usable skill in *Episode Prompto* called the "Selfie Shot''.

[Casanova Wannabe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CasanovaWannabe): Hopelessly in love with [Cindy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsFanservice) and [Aranea](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl). While the entire group acknowledge that Aranea is most likely beyond *any* of them (and much older), they all love to endlessly tease him over his blatant hitting on Cindy. [She doesn't even notice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObliviousToLove).

[Chainsaw Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChainsawGood): As he can wield machinery weapons as his secondary arms, one of the weapons he can use is a chainsaw-buzzsaw-abomination! It's *hilarious* in that he just wildly flails around with it, having clearly *no idea* how to use anything except guns.

[Charles Atlas Superpower](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharlesAtlasSuperpower): Downplayed. Didn't receive nearly as much combat training as Ignis and Gladiolus, but whatever he did since he started working out to lose weight was enough to let him beat up enemies barehanded and break their necks.  (SPOILER)  This makes a lot more sense when you learn about his origins.

[Clone Angst](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CloneAngst):  (SPOILER)  Doesn't take finding out he's a clone of Verstael, and a [Designer Baby](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DesignerBaby) to be part of Niflheim's magitek army on top of that, well.

[Contrasting Sequel Protagonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ContrastingSequelProtagonist): Both his design, and the truth about his origins call to mind *[Final Fantasy VII](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII)'s* Cloud Strife. Unlike Cloud, however, Prompto is cheery and outgoing, and remains a well-adjusted individual despite his learning of his origins.

[Cowardly Lion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CowardlyLion): He's often the first one to note if the party is in over their heads, and can show some signs of claustrophobia when moving through small spaces in a cave, but Prompto sticks with his friends through thick and thin.
[Crucified Hero Shot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrucifiedHeroShot):  (SPOILER) When he is held captive at Zegnautus Keep.
[Cuteness Proximity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CutenessProximity): He adores chocobos and absolutely melts if you stop to hang out with them for a while at Wiz's ranch.
[Damage-Increasing Debuff](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DamageIncreasingDebuff): Prompto's Piercer technique has a good chance of reducing enemy defense on hit making attacking much easier.

[Dark Secret](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkSecret): He's from  (SPOILER) Niflheim . In fact, according to the *[Complete Guide](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllThereInTheManual)* and the DLC *Episode Prompto*, he's the biological son of  (SPOILER) Verstael Besithia, Niflheim's head researcher. Specifically, he was cloned from Verstael, who bred him in a laboratory specifically to be converted into a daemon and processed into an Magitek Trooper.  He was spirited away by Lucians, though at a very young age as he had no memories of this until after  (SPOILER) Ardyn captured him.
[Designer Baby](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DesignerBaby): He was actually  (SPOILER) meant to be a Magitek Trooper, created in a lab complete with a [barcode](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScannableMan).

[Distressed Dude](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DistressedDude): Twice.
    - He gets dragged away from the group by the Naga searching for her baby. He rejoins them quickly after though. - Shortly after Chapter 11, (SPOILER) after Noctis throws him off the train, he gets captured by Ardyn. Then Chapter 13 is centered mostly on rescuing him.

[Dogged Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoggedNiceGuy): During the  (SPOILER) ten years that Noctis is sealed , Prompto spent a lot of time trying to woo Cindy, who remained [Married to the Job](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MarriedToTheJob) [or so Talcott believes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MaybeEverAfter).

[Drama Queen](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DramaQueen): He can be quite dramatic at times.
QUOTE "I've already pushed myself…to the brink of death."

[Elite Mook](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EliteMook):  (SPOILER) He was actually a test tube baby who was going to become one of the nameless mooks in Nilfgard's Magitek Army. Sufficed to say, he's several steps above the average mook on the power scale .
[Embarrassing Tattoo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EmbarrassingTattoo):  (SPOILER) The bar code on his wrist is mostly hidden by arm bands as it gives away his origins.

[Emergency Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EmergencyWeapon): When playable, one of Prompto's weapons is a combat knife called the Audax Blade which he can use for CQC, but it is more of a last resort since he specializes in ranged combat.

[The Engineer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheEngineer): Prompto's subweapons are of the Machine type Imperial [Magitek](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Magitek) weapons found in various Niflheim bases, which give him surprising versatility from the [Automatic Crossbow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AutomaticCrossbow), [Circular Saw](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChainsawGood), [Bio Blaster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadlyGas), [Noiseblaster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GaleForceSound), [Gravity Well](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GravityMaster), [Drill Breaker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThisIsADrill) and [Flamebreath Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FireBreathingWeapon).

[Even the Guys Want Him](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvenTheGuysWantHim): *Assassin's Festival* has two men gushing over him.
QUOTE  **Man A**: Hey. Did you see that stylish blonde walking around town?

QUOTE  **Man B**: Did I? He's cute and has a nice camera!

QUOTE  **Man A**: I know—-I'm so jealous. I wanted to ask where he got it, but just can't work up the nerve to talk to him.
[Fanboy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Fanboy): Of the *[Assassin's Creed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/AssassinsCreed)* series, as he and Noctis were *really* enthusiastic about the Assassin's Festival.
[Formerly Fat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FormerlyFat): He was overweight when Noctis first met him.
[Genki Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GenkiGuy): Loud, energetic, and easily the most childish member of the gang.

[Glass Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GlassCannon): Prompto's abilities have a high critical hit rate and he can dish out a lot of numbers quickly, especially when you are controlling him but due to his low defense and HP, he needs to be healed more often than the others and unlike the other party members lacks a consistent method of avoiding damage.

[Friendless Background](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FriendlessBackground):  (SPOILER) Prior to meeting Noctis in high school, he had no friends at school, and often spends his free time taking photos and looking at his camera.

[Gravity Sucks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GravitySucks): Both the Gravity Well machine and the Gravity Ball technique draw enemies to a single point setting them up for [Area of Effect](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AreaOfEffect) attacks.

[The Gunslinger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGunslinger): He's the main gun-user of the party. He can use in them quick-draw manner or for precision shots, or surprising rapid fire and his Deathblow has him fan the hammer of his revolver for a rapid barrage of attacks.
[Guns Akimbo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GunsAkimbo): Although he normally only uses a single pistol at a time, Prompto can pull out a second and go full ham on enemies with the Trigger Happy technique.

[Guys Smash, Girls Shoot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuysSmashGirlsShoot): Gender flipped. Prompto supports Aranea as she does most of the heavy work in his DLC, striking enemies up close with her Stoss Spear, while most of his attacks are ranged.
[Happily Adopted](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HappilyAdopted): That is, "happy" compared to the alternative prospect of  (SPOILER) being turned into a Daemon and stuffed into a metal body.

[The Heart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeart): Prompto is the one who lifts the mood of the team, usually with nothing but his own enthusiasm, and is also the one who tries to keep the team spirit up and together to the best of his abilities after  (SPOILER) the tragedies that unfolded in Altissia .

[Heroic BSoD](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicBSOD): Spends most of the first half of *Episode Prompto* in one after  (SPOILER) learning how he is a clone of Verstael and was supposed to be an MT. He gets out of it with the help of Aranea.

[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): He feels worthless and doesn't feel like he contributes to the team. He's also  (SPOILER)  a [Designer Baby](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DesignerBaby) who would have been made into a Magitek Trooper if he hadn't been rescued to Lucis early on,  a reveal that he takes pretty badly on top of his existing self-esteem issues.

[Hopeless Suitor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HopelessSuitor): Is *painfully* in love with [Cindy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsFanservice) and [Aranea](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl), and hits on them every chance he gets. Cindy doesn't even *[register](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObliviousToLove)* anything he says as flirting, and Aranea just doesn't care.
[Impossibly Cool Clothes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpossiblyCoolClothes): Including a leather [Waistcoat of Style](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WaistcoatOfStyle) and fingerless gloves.
[In-Series Nickname](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InSeriesNickname): Subverted. Noctis calls him blondie at times, but he has trouble answering to it. Aranea, meanwhile, often calls him "shortcake".
[Innocent Blue Eyes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InnocentBlueEyes): Most noticeable in *Episode Prompto.* Prompto has piercing baby blues and he's the most pure-hearted of the group.
[The Klutz](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheKlutz): Prompto often trips over himself while fighting due to his inexperience. It's one thing that even his exercise couldn't cure.

[Leaning on the Fourth Wall](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LeaningOnTheFourthWall): One of his voice clips has him singing the *Final Fantasy* victory jingle. On the English version, he also sings at one point the Chocobo theme. He also makes frequent references to video games, such as magical keys that open all doors, or how he's "just trying to level up here".

[Leeroy Jenkins](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LeeroyJenkins): Prompto's AI is actually no different from the rest of the party's so he'll rush into the middle of the fray just as the rest do, but since he is the party's firearms guy, his decision to do so often lands him in a predicament that the others are better equipped to handle.
[Leitmotif](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Leitmotif): Was given one in *Episode Prompto*, [''Home Sweet Home''](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CXfHooTIReM).
[The Load](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLoad): He admits to Noct he often feels this way. He outright says he knows he lacks the talents of his friends and often feels inferior to them.

[Luke, I Am Your Father](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LukeIAmYourFather): In the *[Complete Guide](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllThereInTheManual)* and later *Episode Prompto*,  (SPOILER)  Prompto is revealed to be the son of Verstael .

[Masculine Girl, Feminine Boy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasculineGirlFeminineBoy): Feminine Boy to Aranea's Masculine Girl. Aranea gives him some tough love but absolutely means well, she rescues him from death and she tries to protect him during his time in Gralea until she thinks he is ready to go on his own. Prompto is rather faint-hearted and mainly acts as combat support for her when they are fighting in a group.
[Maybe Ever After](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MaybeEverAfter): In the Royal Edition, Noctis can ask if things ever worked out between him and Cindy and he replies that he doesn't kiss and tell.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Roughly translates to "quick silver", befitting a gunman. Also an [Ironic Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IronicName) in his childhood. This may also be part of his [Ship Tease](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShipTease) with Cindy, as their surnames mean "silver" and "gold" respectively.

[Meta Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MetaGuy): Realizes that his and his friends' adventure is just like a "real life RPG" and even admits that fighting [Pre-existing Encounters](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PreexistingEncounters) is just kind of a game to him; he's just trying to get some [Experience Points](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExperiencePoints) and [Character Levels](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterLevel).

[Morally Superior Copy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MorallySuperiorCopy):  (SPOILER)  Prompto is a clone of Verstael, who bred clones specifically to convert into daemons and use them to power magitek troopers.  Prompto is a loyal friend to Noctis and travels with him after the destruction and invasion of their home city by the magitek troopers.

[Multi-Ranged Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MultiRangedMaster): When playable, Prompto's equippable guns expand far beyond just a handgun, allowing him to use the Rapidus SMG, Saggita [Sniper Rifle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SniperRifle), Alea Bazooka and Lumen Flare Grenades.
[More Dakka](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoreDakka): Trigger Happy involves Prompto, a pair of pistols and a lot of bullets.

[My Future Self and Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyFutureSelfAndMe): Played with in *Episode Prompto*,  (SPOILER) after giving an MT a [Mercy Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MercyKill), he sees his younger self, although it was more likely Prompto's imagination.

[No Sense of Personal Space](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoSenseOfPersonalSpace): While Gladio will sometimes sling an arm around Noctis' shoulder, and Ignis does no more than pat him on the arm, Prompto will sometimes slap Noctis on the backside, such as in the campfire scenes prior to his Tours.

[Parental Neglect](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ParentalNeglect): Prompto's family is not very involved in his life, in the OVA they never seem to be around  (SPOILER)  and in *Episode Prompto* the loading screens mention that there is little love between Prompto and his adoptive parents .

[Plucky Comic Relief](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PluckyComicRelief): The goofiest character of the bunch, and the developers stated that he was written to serve as the Wise Guy to Noctis's [Straight Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StraightMan).
[Promoted to Playable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PromotedToPlayable): In the DLC *Episode Prompto*. Carried over to the main game as of the December 2017 update.
[Revolvers Are Just Better](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RevolversAreJustBetter): His initial weapon. Though he can also switch to other handguns in-game.
[Sad Clown](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SadClown): All of his jokes and quips are just a way to cover up his insecurities.

[Satellite Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SatelliteCharacter): [Deconstructed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeconstructedCharacterArchetype). A big part of his [Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment) in *Episode Prompto* is  (SPOILER) how he spent most of his life being one to Noctis and learning not to base his entire self-worth on what his friends think of him. It takes Aranea [telling him just how unhealthy and self-destructive this attitude is](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GetAholdOfYourselfMan) for him to realize he ought to start living for his own sake and focus on what makes himself happy instead of caring so much about trying to please other people.
[Scannable Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScannableMan):  (SPOILER) Has a bar code on his wrist — the serial number he was given as an infant — which he later uses to unlock a door in Zegnautus Keep.

[Sensitive Guy and Manly Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SensitiveGuyAndManlyMan): The Sensitive Guy to Gladio's Manly Man. Easily the most emotional one of the group, possibly the entire game. He's quick to voice his fears (met with teasing, usually from Gladio and Noctis) and feelings throughout the game.

[Ship Tease](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShipTease): Prompto is very smitten with Cindy, even planning on buying a car so he has an excuse to see her more.
    - To complete the circle, Prompto uses guns in combat, pretty much similar to Cid during his younger days with Regis. - He was also smitten with Aranea after meeting her, at one point the others teasing him whom should he pick between the two. - He was so absolutely desperate to be Noctis's friend that he engaged in a campaign of brutal physical exercise, completely transforming how he looked. He thought he had no chance as he was, and that when he re-introduced himself Noctis didn't recognize him (he did).

[Steel Ear Drums](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SteelEarDrums): He uses very big guns, with very large rounds, enough to critically injure high level opponents at times, yet is able to walk away as if it's nothing.  (SPOILER) It's possible this was deliberately engineered, since he was intended for the Magitek army.

[Stepford Smiler](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StepfordSmiler): Type A, he has a lot of insecurities about his skills in combat and  (SPOILER) the fact that he's from Niflheim  beneath all of that enthusiasm and dorkiness. *Episode Prompto* shows that he's not the same person that we see when he's separated from the others.
[Strong Family Resemblance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StrongFamilyResemblance):  (SPOILER) Due to being made using Verstael's DNA, he looks like him in his younger years.

[Technicolor Eyes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TechnicolorEyes): His eyes also have a shade of purple,  (SPOILER) possibly hinting at his origins as part of a magically enhanced [Clone Army](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CloneArmy) .
