[Throw Down the Bomblet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThrowDownTheBomblet): When playable he carries grenades which can be used for area damage, but its primary use is to induce the vulnerable status so he can use his Crackshot ability.
[Tomato in the Mirror](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TomatoInTheMirror):  (SPOILER) Learning how he is a clone of Verstael really took an emotional toll on him.

[Took a Level in Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInBadass): Zig-zagged. He went from being [overweight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FormerlyFat) and timid to the confident, friendly, skinny kid he is now all on his own after Luna gave him a little kick-start, but later on in the game it becomes clear that neither losing weight nor affecting a happy-go-lucky personality actually did much (if anything at all) to help Prompto's deep-seated insecurity and feelings of inadequacy. The game *does* address this directly, but only in a single, optional conversation that can only be had if the player chooses to spend the night at a specific motel, this of course this is explored in further detail in Episode Prompto.

[The Ugly Guy's Hot Daughter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheUglyGuysHotDaughter): Or son, in this case. Prompto's (SPOILER) father is the shriveled and disturbing Verstael , while Prompto himself is absolutely gorgeous. (SPOILER) [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) points out that though his cells have been diversified, his face at thirty is still nearly identical to Verstael's at a similar age, so even if Prompto doesn't grow to resemble him exactly, it's likely he'll fall into [I Was Quite a Looker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IWasQuiteALooker) when he gets older .

[Vocal Evolution](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VocalEvolution): More notably in the Japanese. As a young man his voice is incredibly high pitched, shrill even, but after the timeskip his voice changes to be deeper and more somber. Since his voice in the English version is deeper to begin with, only the tone changes after the timeskip.

[The Watson](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheWatson): He is the one who asks many of the questions regarding the lore and the other three's pasts since he's a commoner and a high school friend of Noctis's, and is therefore as privy to such information as the audience would be.

[Trademark Favorite Food](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrademarkFavoriteFood): Even he can't hide his origins with his appetite. Absolutely loves savory and spicy foods, and especially if they are easy to eat by the mouthful. Throughout the game, he also shows a reoccurring taste for junk food and snacks. To him, Ignis is the god of cooking, and is especially grateful that he is the team's chef.

[Weak, but Skilled](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeakButSkilled):
    - Prompto can rack up damage quickly with his machine gun and his bazooka, but is otherwise much more vulnerable to attacks than Noct's [Made of Air](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadeOfAir) powers, Ignis's agility, and Gladio's tankiness. - In *Episode Prompto*, sidequest content, including one for an achievement, can have the level 35 Prompto against level 99 enemies. Proper use of weaponry, as well as proper coordination with Aranea, allows him to beat those insurmountable odds.
[Weakened by the Light](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeakenedByTheLight): Prompto's Starshell ability fires a ball of light into the sky which weakens Daemons and stuns enemies momentarily.

[Would Hit a Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WouldHitAGirl): His fight with Aranea in *Episode Prompto* shows that despite his attitude towards a girl he likes, he also doesn't hold back when one of his animations is can be shown jumping and roundhouse kicking her if player deals enough damage when she is in the air.
[Youthful Freckles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouthfulFreckles): Fitting, since he behaves the least maturely out of the group.
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): If you choose to make your custom character female.

[The Atoner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAtoner): Seeing as nearly all of the Kingsglaive turned traitor and all of them failed to protect Regis. It's never really clarified if the protagonist was a turncoat as well—presumably so that it's left for the player to decide—but they bear the burden of the Glaives' sins nonetheless.  (SPOILER)  Claiming victory against Bahamut in his final trial formally absolves the player character of these sins in the eyes of the Astrals.
[Automatic Crossbows](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AutomaticCrossbows): A new weapon type added specifically for Comrades, filling a similar role to the guns usable in the main game.

[Barrier Warrior](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BarrierWarrior): Their standard defensive maneuver is creating protective [Beehive Barriers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeehiveBarrier) that block incoming attacks. Equipping them with the Just's Sigil will make them even more of one.

[Bag of Spilling](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BagOfSpilling): In a sense. As the Kingsglaive were some of the best fighters around under Regis, by technicality the Glaive's sustained injuries resulted in a loss of all their gear and anything beyond the Glaive-standard Warp and [Hyperspace Arsenal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HyperspaceArsenal) abilities. Crosses over with a player-focused twist on [Overrated and Underleveled](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OverratedAndUnderleveled) partially, which also carries over to AI Glaive companions since they scale to your level regardless of how strong everyone should be; by the time you can finish *Comrades*, however, [you're back in full form and probably even better than before.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInBadass)
[Black Mage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackMage): Equipping the Pious's Sigil will power up the Glaive's Black Magic.

[Carry a Big Stick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CarryABigStick): Maces are another new weapon type added specifically to Comrades, although they're more or less just [greatswords](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS), functionally.

[Character Customization](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterCustomization): The customization options for your character's appearance are quite broad, allowing you to make them a [Pint-Sized Powerhouse](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PintSizedPowerhouse), a [Statuesque Stunner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StatuesqueStunner), [Acrofatic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Acrofatic), give them a Beard, Blue Hair, [Technicolor Eyes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TechnicolorEyes), nearly any normal human skin tone you like…or take their appearance in [a different direction entirely](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGenericGuy). There are all manner of possibilities!  (SPOILER)  Subverted, as you're not customizing the true protagonist of the story (whose look is fixed), but rather a [Supporting Protagonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SupportingProtagonist) for the "Comrades" expansion who shows up only in Chapter 14 in the main game as a [Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember) and is completely irrelevant from that point onwards. The ending revolves around Noctis, not them.  For a brief time in the PC version, interacting with Avatara in the main story could allow Noctis to assume the Glaive's appearance, along with any customization options that come with it [sans his voice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VoicesAreMental).

[The Chosen One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheChosenOne): Of sorts. The player character amasses the support of the former Kings of Lucis thanks to the Royal Sigils, and then  (SPOILER)  ends up being the one handpicked by the Astrals to clear the Daemons around where Noctis would return to, also providing transportation for him to meet back up with the others. The chosen one to usher in the real chosen one, so to speak. Notably, this also makes the Glaive one of the very few chosen by the Astrals *without* some ulterior motive or despair thrown into the mix to off them - and the last currently-living pick for helping the world after the Starscourge is destroyed.

[Chuck Cunningham Syndrome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChuckCunninghamSyndrome): Just like the previous player-created avatars, in FFXI and FFXIV, the Glaive doesn't appear in [Dissidia Final Fantasy (2015)](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/DissidiaFinalFantasy2015), nor are they ever mentioned, in this case it’s Justified however as Noctis is in his Pre Timeskip appearance in Dissidia so he likely just hasn’t met the Glaive yet.

[Demoted to Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemotedToExtra):  (SPOILER) You can recruit them in Chapter 14 of the main game, but they completely stop appearing in cutscenes in Chapter 15. The ending is completely focused on Noctis, and they don't even get to play a part in the final boss fight, as Noctis fights Ardyn alone .
[Double Jump](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoubleJump): The Rogue's Sigil enables its bearers to perform a mid-air step after attacking.
[Glass Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GlassCannon): The Tall's Sigil invokes this, in a sense; greatly increasing its bearers' offensive power, but disabling their healing magic.
[Good Morning, Crono](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodMorningCrono): Their story begins with Libertus waking them up in the back of a moving truck.
[Hello, [Insert Name Here]](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HelloInsertNameHere): You can name them whatever you want  (SPOILER)  but you can't name the actual protagonist, who is Noctis .

[Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember): The Glaive can show up as a guest party member in one of Cor's side quests in the expanded Insomnia map in the Royal Pack expansion. Their appearance and loadout is the same as your custom Glaive from *Comrades*. If you don't have a Comrades save, their appearance will be randomized using the basic Kingsglaive equipment.

[Heroes Prefer Swords](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroesPreferSwords): The Glaive can wield [Katana](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KatanasAreJustBetter), specifically, replacing the standard swords and [greatswords](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS) found in the main game.

[Heroic Mime](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicMime): Barring [Voice Grunting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VoiceGrunting) and such.  (SPOILER) [Lampshaded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LampshadeHanging) by Prompto when Noct and his gang team up with them in a side mission *A Glaive out of Time*.   (SPOILER)  Or rather "[Demoted to Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemotedToExtra) [Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember) Mime" .

[Laser-Guided Amnesia](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaserGuidedAmnesia): Waking up in the back of a truck, the player character vaguely recalls being a Kingsglaive after Libertus prods them about it, but their injuries beforehand knocked the memory right out of them. They gradually regain their memories over the course of the campaign.

[Lightning Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightningBruiser): The Tall's and Warrior's Sigils both gear their bearers towards this. The Warrior's Sigil also grants its bearers the ability to [Draw Aggro](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DrawAggro).
[Magic Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicKnight): Glaives can use both weapons and a selection of magic spells, including a shield spell, a healing spell, and an offensive spell of their choice.

[Multi-Melee Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MultiMeleeMaster): As a Glaive, they share such abilities with the Lucian royal family. Much like Noctis, they can equip several different weapon types, although they have access to some weapon types that Noctis cannot use, and vice-versa.

[Remember the New Guy?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RememberTheNewGuy): The protagonist is implied to be one of the Kingsglaive whose face wasn't shown in the film, but the story mostly avoids this...at least, up until the end, where  (SPOILER)  they provide the boat that was mysteriously at the island that Noctis wakes up on post-[Time Skip](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeSkip). Considering there was no trace of this meeting in the base game and the boat was originally just sort of *there*, it could come off as [retconning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Retcon) the player character into the main story.

[Stock Ninja Weaponry](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StockNinjaWeaponry): Both shuriken and the aforementioned katana qualify, and even arguably the daggers. A [Fuuma Shuriken](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FuumaShuriken) is, of course, included.
[Support Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SupportPartyMember): The Wanderer's Sigil enables its bearers to grant their allies status buffs.
[Supporting Protagonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SupportingProtagonist):  (SPOILER)  to Noctis. See [Demoted to Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemotedToExtra) above .

[Suspiciously Similar Substitute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuspiciouslySimilarSubstitute): Not the character themselves, but a few of the various weapons that they can use:
    - The Katana is a stand-in for the sword that Noctis uses. - The Mace is clearly one to the greatsword, being a slow, but massive weapon; it even shares some of the latter's animations. - The Crossbow was made to perform the same function as the gun.

[Took a Level in Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInBadass): At the start of the DLC, your Glaive is weaker than even the starting party of the main game. By the end and post-game of *Comrades*, however, you can not only fight and defeat  (SPOILER)  Bahamut , but also can take on some other powerful bosses like  (SPOILER)  Ifrit and Ardyn  without the blessings and power that Noctis and his party have in the main game.

[True Companions](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueCompanions): Downplayed compared to Noctis and his friends, since by default you have no actual fixed mainstays that always fight alongside you, but your fellow glaives are with you through thick and thin on every mission as [comrades.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TitleDrop) Of course, seeing as *Comrades* was created to be played multiplayer, you could always play the game with your own real-life [True Companions](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueCompanions).

[What Happened to the Mouse?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatHappenedToTheMouse): A strange case.  (SPOILER)  The player character does survive the ten years of waiting for Noctis, and helps supply him with a boat he uses to get to the mainland. What happens to them afterward, however, goes unanswered, and they obviously don't appear in the main game at all, leaving their ultimate fate up in the air. That is, until the the main game's *Royal Edition* was released. In one of the new side-missions in Insomnia, Noct and the gang are send to aid one of the Glaives on a mission who turns out to be the player character from *Comrades*. The group remembers them vaguely from their previous interactions in *Comrades* and make note about how their new companion [isn't very talkative](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicMime). After finishing the mission however, the Glaive simply disappears. While they're not present in the Glaives' hideout upon Noctis's return, he's told by another Glaive that the player character had said to have been honored to fight alongside him, to which Noct responds that he likewise was honored to fight alongside one of his father's Glaives. From this, it can be assumed that they stayed with their fellow Glaives in Insomnia, at least until the end of the game.
[White Mage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhiteMage): Equipping the Oracle's Sigil will power up the Glaive's white magic.

[Alchemy Is Magic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AlchemyIsMagic): More like "magic is alchemy". In-game descriptions show that the healing items are just ordinary drinks which he uses magic to convert into potions and elixirs.

[All Your Powers Combined](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllYourPowersCombined): The Scepter of The Pious is a Royal Arm that mimics several of the other Royal Arms by generating a [Hard Light](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HardLight) copy through it, like a [light saber](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaserSword). The Royal Arms it mimics are the Blade of The Mystic, Sword of the Wise, Trident of The Oracle, Axe of The Conquerer and Sword of The Tall. Interestingly, the mimicked form of the Blade of the Mystic is used for the mimicked form of the Sword of The Wise. However, what sets it apart from those Royal Arms is that it draws on Noctis’ magic stat while all of the mimicked Royal Arms draw on Noctis’ attack stat, which makes sense, because while the Royal Arm makes a blade, it is still a blade of magic, and what sets it apart is that it’s mimicked weapons lack certain qualities of the originals. Particularly, it lacks the Sword of The Wise’s Warp Strike combo starter, the Blade of the Mystic’s long combo and stat buff, the Sword of The Fall’s body part dismemberment by getting a shorter combo, the Trident of The Oracle’s combo finisher and the Axe of The Conquerer’s stagger potential by virtue of only being regulated to air attacks, dodge attacks and combo finishers. This potentially makes this weapon a [Jack of All Trades](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JackOfAllTrades) and a [Master of None](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasterOfNone) and [Magikarp Power](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagikarpPower) if the player doesn’t prioritize the magic stat or figure out which of the mimicked weapons is the best to use because the player could potentially do little damage with the weapon by not prioritizing the magic stat and or using the less good mimicked weapons.

[Audience Surrogate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AudienceSurrogate): Noctis fulfills and acts the part while he explores  (SPOILER)  the [Pitioss Ruins](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BonusDungeon) dungeon, acting just as annoyed as the player would be at several points, once giving up he'd claim there's nothing fair about the ruins and upon succesfully exploring the dungeon Noctis would state his head hurts when he's out.

tropeName: Ascend to a Higher Plane of Existence
tropeNotes: [Ascend to a Higher Plane of Existence](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendToAHigherPlaneOfExistence): He becomes  (SPOILER) one with the spirit realm after his death  to kill Ardyn and eventually reunite with Luna.

[American Kirby Is Hardcore](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmericanKirbyIsHardcore): In *Episode Duscae*, there was a surprisingly large gap between the way his character was portrayed Ray Chase compared to Tatsuhisa Suzuki. The English dub portrays Noctis as darker, moodier, and more sarcastic in contrast to his more playful depiction in the Japanese version. The gap was narrowed on both sides; official announcements stated that the English voice work in the demo was a rush-job and he was redirected to sound more light-hearted in the full game, and *Brotherhood* <sup>note </sup>  which is as of now Japanese-only  showed Noctis to be a very troubled and withdrawn young man despite his bouts of childishness. He retains some traits of a deeper voice in battle.

[Ancestral Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AncestralWeapon): His Royal Arms, which are the weapons wielded by the previous kings and queens of Lucis as well as  (SPOILER)  Luna's trident . They also manifest as his Armiger, ghostly blades that can be used to teleport Noctis around an area, shield him from harm, and attack enemies independently. In short, there's a reason why he and his father make up the page image.

[Anime Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimeHair): Many fans have commented that it bears a striking resemblance to the hairstyle of [Sasuke Uchiha](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Manga/Naruto).  (SPOILER) He sports a much more reasonable hairstyle as a thirty year old.

[Arranged Marriage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArrangedMarriage): He is to marry Luna as part of the peace treaty between Lucis and Niflheim, which he didn't mind because [he was in love with Luna](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PerfectlyArrangedMarriage). Unfortunately, it was a ruse by Niflheim to steal Lucis's [Power Crystal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerCrystal).

[Attention Whore](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AttentionWhore): Absolutely *loves* fishing, and he's *very* proud of his skills in it. To the point where he gets very pouty if his friends aren't watching him do it. There is even a Quest revolving around this.
[Badass Adorable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassAdorable): As a child, albeit during a dream sequence.

[Badass Boast](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBoast): Has a couple of pretty good ones throughout the game, but the best goes to the end:
QUOTE **Ardyn**: I'm afraid you're out of luck. The throne brings you here? It seats only one. 
**Noctis**: Off my chair, jester. *The king sits there.*
[Badass Bookworm](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBookworm): He was the top graduate in his class and a very powerful combatant on the battlefield.

[Badass in a Nice Suit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassInANiceSuit): *Damn* Noctis [looks good in a suit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SharpDressedMan). (SPOILER) His older design sports a more casual suit, but it still counts. One [[1]](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PreOrderBonus) for the two collector's editions of the game allows you to dress him up in the suit [Regis wore before his redesign](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DevelopmentGag).

[Badass in Distress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassInDistress):
    - He is fatally injured during the Leviathan fight, but Luna heals [(and temporarily empowers)](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CameBackStrong) him. - *Episode Ignis* involves Ignis coming to defend his unconscious body after the Leviathan fight from Ardyn and his Magitek Troopers.

[Beard of Sorrow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeardOfSorrow): In the timeskip,  (SPOILER) representative of his more somber and serious demeanor after reflecting on all the hardships he's suffered along with the knowledge that he's marching towards his own death .
[Beneath the Mask](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeneathTheMask): [Tetsuya Nomura](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/TetsuyaNomura) notes that Noctis is not actually very cool but a bit shy and quirky.
[Best Served Cold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BestServedCold): He  (SPOILER) waits 10 years gathering power from the Lucian Crystal  to take his revenge on Ardyn.
[Big Brother Instinct](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBrotherInstinct): He's this to both Iris and Talcott.
[Black Mage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackMage): Closest thing this game has to one, since he's the only character with full access to offensive magical spells, as part of his royal abilities.

[Blessed with Suck](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlessedWithSuck): The fate every future ruler of Lucis faces is a [drastically shortened lifespan.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerDegeneration) Because Noctis could also meet this fate if he inherits the throne, Regis is torn on whether or not he should let Noctis become the next king.
[Broken Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrokenHero): Noctis is *not* in a good place after  (SPOILER) Lunafreya's death .

[Cast from Lifespan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CastFromLifespan): With the Ring of the Lucii, the ring-bearer is bestowed with vast power, able to cast powerful spells, construct highly elaborate Protects, and summon the “Old Wall” (statues of the old Lucian Kings that protect Insomnia, the capital of Lucis), but the caster is burdened with a rapidly depleted lifespan. In-game, using Ring Magic visibly causes his character model to show [horrible burns and other nasty effects](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BodyHorror).

[Celibate Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CelibateHero): His celibacy is involuntary as circumstances prevent him from having a meaningful romance with Luna;  (SPOILER) he never had the chance to confess his true feelings for her, and by the time he is chronologically 30 towards the end of the game, he remains a virgin for the entirety of the story.

[The Chains of Commanding](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheChainsOfCommanding): Retaking Lucis means that there is little time for Noctis to grieve the deaths of his father  (SPOILER) and fiancée  (and that he may get killed fighting various literal *gods* to prove his worthiness). He's reluctant even to put on the [ring](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyTheChosenMayWield)  (SPOILER) Luna  gave him while dying because of the bad memories associated with it.

[Character Catchphrase](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterCatchphrase): Is partial to saying ["Son of a bitch!"](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThisIsForEmphasisBitch) when things are going poorly or painfully, or both, [or if it's Ardyn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Troll). In *Episode Duscae*, he would also say "That's all she wrote." after winning a battle.

[Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment): For most of the story, Noctis is a young man first and foremost, with insecurities compounded by his role as the heir to the throne in a time of war. He is neither fit nor ready to lead a nation, having difficulty with keeping himself level-headed in times of distress and either responding to intense circumstances with anger or uncertainty for a good chunk of the game. It isn't until he's  (SPOILER) completely isolated on enemy territory, with only the Ring of the Lucii and his father's sword to defend himself  that he starts to mature. It's very understated when played straight through, but it's hard not to notice it when you compare the beginning and the end of Chapter 13 alone. Noctis has grown a sense of clarity and purpose towards his mission, assuming a role of leadership among his group of friends once he's reunited with them and standing firm even in the wake of everything that's happened up to that point. [Perhaps being taunted constantly by the man single-handedly responsible for ruining your life over the PA system](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceJobFixingItVillain) [really puts your life into perspective.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KnightInSourArmor) Then the following chapter builds on that development, with Noctis  (SPOILER) emerging from the Crystal ten years later far more seasoned than before. It's very apparent that he didn't awaken in the same state of mind that he was when he left. He has aged in both mind and body, with a sense of wisdom fit for royalty and a steeled sense of resolve towards his destiny as the True King.  This is even lampshaded by the others at a point.
[Chick Magnet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChickMagnet): Luna is his fiancee, Iris has a crush on him, and *Brotherhood* often shows him surrounded by girls at school.

[The Chosen One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheChosenOne): He is prophesied to become the True King that will  (SPOILER) purge Eos of the Starscourge. 
QUOTE *Fifteen years ago* (…) *the stars chose the son to be their light.*
[Clothing Damage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ClothingDamage): In the *Omen* trailer, he gradually goes through this until [he completely loses his shirt](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShirtlessScene).
[Combat Medic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatMedic): He's an indirect version, since it's suggested most of the healing items are actually drinks he enchants to heal the party.
[Combination Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombinationAttack): Noctis can do them with his buddies, including the classic [X-Strike](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/ChronoTrigger) with Ignis.
[Color Motif](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColorMotif): In *XV*'s universe, the color black is associated with the Lucian royal family; only those of high status are permitted to wear it.

[The Comically Serious](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheComicallySerious): In the *Brotherhood* OVA, he maintains a grim, stony expression throughout most of the first episode, including a scene where he's picking vegetables off his burger and dropping them on Ignis's plate.

[Contrasting Sequel Protagonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ContrastingSequelProtagonist):
    - Noctis has been made to be quite the departure from [Claire Farron A.K.A Lightning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyXIII). Lightning, was very [seasoned](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExperiencedProtagonist), [professional](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ConsummateProfessional), and [cold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IceQueen) at almost all times in her game while Noctis is [developing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ComingOfAgeStory), [juvenile](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrilliantButLazy), and quite [kindhearted](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy) throughout his story until the final stretch. Lightning, representing [Light Is Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightIsGood) in her entire aesthetic both in and out of battle, was a soldier whose parents died prior to *XIII*, leading to her [Promotion to Parent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PromotionToParent); Noctis, who represents [Dark Is Not Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkIsNotEvil), is nearly as experienced in combat as her despite being royalty and ending up as a [Spoiled Sweet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpoiledSweet), with his father dying during *XV*. Lastly, while both of their stories featured heavily [Because Destiny Says So](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BecauseDestinySaysSo) themes, with them as the resident [Messianic Archetype](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MessianicArchetype) of their respective settings, Lighting was able to [defy and change her fate for the better](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScrewDestiny), while Noctis ultimately (SPOILER) [had no choice but to submit to his purpose in order to save the world.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouCantFightFate) - Both [Ashe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyXII) and Noctis are [Magic Knights](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicKnight), princes/princesses who lose their fathers and homes to their respective invading empires, and whose quests to reclaim their kingdoms involve visiting ancient tombs. Like Lightning, Ashe represents [Light Is Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightIsGood) in contrast to Noctis's [Dark Is Not Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkIsNotEvil). (SPOILER) Both also lose their significant others, but while Ashe and Rasler were married, with the latter dying before the events of *XII*, Noctis and Luna are only betrothed, with the latter dying during *XV*'s events. Unlike Ashe, who defied the Occuria and managed to reclaim her throne in her story's finale, Noctis submits to Bahamut's will and — due to sacrificing his own life — never gets to truly rule his kingdom (at least, not in the main game).

[Cool Car](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolCar): Gets chauffeured around in a souped up luxury car called the Regalia (or drive it himself should the player choose to. At night, Noct drives it by default). He also owns an Audi R8 called "The Star of Lucis". In-universe the car manufacturer is said to have teamed up with the Royal Art Society of Lucis to create the car to celebrate the 20th birthday of Prince Noctis. It appears in *[Kingsglaive](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/KingsglaiveFinalFantasyXV)*; Drautos uses it to pick Nyx up in after the latter gets reassigned to the Crownsguard. The car is later "borrowed" by Libertus to get Luna out of Insomnia once Nyx uses the Ring of the Lucii. The R8 is also available to purchase in real-life, [for only a measly](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SarcasmMode) [half-million dollars](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoneyToBurn).
[Cool Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolSword): His signature Engine Blade, which can siphon magical energy from enemies. It can even be upgraded to the Ultima Blade by Cid.

[Cosmic Plaything](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CosmicPlaything):  (SPOILER) Noctis's status as the [Chosen One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChosenOne) is the result of the resident [Jerkass Gods](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkassGods) choosing him as a sacrifice to give up his life in order to save the world from a plague brought about by a previous war of theirs. Many of the misfortunes he goes through during the game are the result of people grooming him to fulfill that destiny. He overcomes it in the second ending.
[Dark Is Not Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkIsNotEvil): He's dark-haired, wears all black and talks about death. And a sweet guy.
[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): Noctis can be very sarcastic and blunt at times.

[Death Is the Only Option](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathIsTheOnlyOption): When Noctis learns from Bahamut that the only way to defeat Ardyn for good and end the starscourge  (SPOILER)  is for him to die, this deeply perturbs Noct, with his facial expressions clearly expressing his very strong desire to live.  When he comes back to Eos, he has come to terms with what he must do and is fully committed to seeing his destiny through.
[Deflector Shields](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeflectorShields): His [Flying Weapons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlyingWeapon) act this way for him with his Armiger ability.

tropeName: Did You Just Punch Out Cthulhu?
tropeNotes: [Did You Just Punch Out Cthulhu?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DidYouJustPunchOutCthulhu):  (SPOILER) In *Dawn of the Future*, he manages to kill Bahamut .

[Died Happily Ever After](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiedHappilyEverAfter): The last we see him, he is  (SPOILER)  with his beloved Luna, happily sharing a romantic kiss with her during their wedding in the afterlife.  In the alternate ending  (SPOILER) it's averted, where he survives thanks to Ignis.
[Disappeared Dad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisappearedDad): His father Regis dies during the invasion and destruction of Insomnia.

[Does Not Like Spam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoesNotLikeSpam): He's not a fan of vegetables, to the point where he went out of his way to surgically remove his vegetables from a burger in the anime. In game, there is even a few quests revolving around chefs trying to get him to eat his veggies and doesn't even want to hear the word beans. He *especially* hates carrots. They can be grown fresh in Cape Caem, but are unusable in Ignis's cooking due to Noctis's powerful aversion. Ignis's conditions when fighting him as the [Optional Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalBoss) of *Episode Ignis* are all about getting him to eat his vegetables. Likewise, a sidequest shows he's not too fond of beans. When a diner chef sends him on a quest to retrieve a missing shipment of beans, Noctis reluctantly agrees to at least try them.

[Doomed Hometown](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoomedHometown): Shortly after leaving for Altissia, his hometown of Insomnia is invaded and set aflame by the Empire. His father Regis was also killed in the invasion.

[Dressing to Die](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DressingToDie): Before the group goes out on their last mission together they swap out their outfits for suits designed for the Kingsglaive while Noctis puts on an elegant raiment fit for a King.
[Drives Like Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DrivesLikeCrazy): According to Ignis. Gameplay-wise, he's a pretty good driver, though that could just be because Ignis hates driving at night.
[Due to the Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DueToTheDead): In the epilogue of *Dawn of the Future*, he  (SPOILER) gives Ardyn a grand funeral, recognizing him as the *true* Founder King of Lucis .

[Earn Your Happy Ending](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EarnYourHappyEnding):
    - In (SPOILER) the second ending. While Luna still dies, the result is much happier for him thanks to Ignis. - Played straight in *The Dawn of the Future*, where he (SPOILER) finally marries Luna and lives happily ever after with her.

[Emotionally Tongue-Tied](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EmotionallyTongueTied): He has a very hard time expressing his feelings to others. Whenever his friends poke fun at his upcomming wedding to Luna he tries to play it off cool even though he's hopelessly enamored. This is played for drama  (SPOILER) during the last campfire he has with his friends, he does a lot of mumbling and stuttering. You can really see him trying his hardest to tell his friends how much they meant to him in his life, and how grateful he is for everything they've done for him.
[Elemental Powers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ElementalPowers): He can draw elemental energy from certain locations, which can then be refined into spells.

[Face Death with Dignity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FaceDeathWithDignity): He faces his own death with dignity and resolve, bravely and selflessly  (SPOILER) committing an honorable suicide to restore balance to the world and finish off Ardyn for good.
[Fanboy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Fanboy): Of the *[Assassin's Creed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/AssassinsCreed)* series, as he and Prompto were *really* enthusiastic about the Assassin's Festival.

[Faustian Rebellion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FaustianRebellion): He's [The Chosen One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheChosenOne) preordained to destroy the Starscourge. That said,  (SPOILER) in *Dawn of the Future*, when it's revealed Bahamut is the true evil here, he fights to destroy [The Chooser of the One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheChooserOfTheOne), Bahamut .
[Fighting Your Friend](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FightingYourFriend):  (SPOILER) Attacks Prompto in Chapter 11 after Ardyn creates an illusion that causes them to switch appearances.

[Flash Step](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlashStep): Noctis's Phase command can teleport him out of the way and thus drains MP when used; Noctis can also warp offensively to attack and strategically by teleporting to a sword thrown to a high vantage point.

[Flying Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlyingWeapon): Can control his weapons telepathically with the Armiger ability. It's said that this ability is a [Secret Art](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SecretArt) passed down by the [royal family](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoyalBlood) and the high council of Lucis.

[Foil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Foil): In comparison to [Luna](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllLovingHero)—who is essentially a diplomat between mankind and the gods—Noctis embodies a more human, pragmatic side of Eos's power. After her attempts to negotiate with Leviathan fail, Noctis is empowered to force the issue.

[Forced to Watch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForcedToWatch): The death of  (SPOILER) Luna at Ardyn's hands . All he can do is say nothing as  (SPOILER) his bride-to-be gets stabbed to death and Ardyn mocks him .
[Friendly Sniper](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FriendlySniper): Noctis can use the Cerberus [Sniper Rifle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SniperRifle) to manually aim shots instead of other pistols.

[Friend to All Living Things](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FriendToAllLivingThings): Not *all* living things, more like *most* — the only exceptions are harmful varmints, daemons, [and Ardyn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArchEnemy). He absolutely *adores* animals, especially cats and chocobos, and he's got a loving relationship with Luna's dogs, especially Umbra.

[Gentleman and a Scholar](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GentlemanAndAScholar): He graduated the head of his class and his classmates described him as a gentle, well-groomed, well-mannered young man with a love for animals and a commitment to community service.

[The Good King](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGoodKing): [Like his father before him](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LikeFatherLikeSon), Noctis fits this trope to a T, having no qualms  (SPOILER) sacrificing himself in the end for the good of everyone, becoming the hero of the masses and the savior of the world by the end of the story.

[The Gunslinger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGunslinger): A trait at the mercy of the player. Noctis has access to *a lot* of different weapons, pistols and sniper rifles included, so it ultimately depends on the play-style. In the "Omen" trailer, Noctis is seen taking up an assault rifle when he loses his powers against an enemy platoon.

[Hair Color Dissonance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HairColorDissonance): Originally Noctis's hair was rendered as having a silvery-blue tint, but it was later changed to a more natural black tint. Depending on the atmosphere of the scene, it can be rendered either way, though overall, it still seems to be black.

[Handicapped Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HandicappedBadass): Noctis suffered a leg injury as a child that left him wheelchair-bound for a long while. Even after he recovered enough to walk, he still has a noticeable limp and occasionally stops to massage or nurse a pain in his bad knee if he's been moving around a lot. His royal raiment even comes complete with a knee brace that's more compact not unlike his father's, albeit a more subtle one resembling a kneepad rather than a full leg-encompassing one.

[The Hero Dies](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeroDies):  (SPOILER) Is forced to sacrifice himself to stop Ardyn in the main ending. Averted in Episode Ignis' alternate ending and in *Dawn to the Future*, where he survives.

[Heroes Gone Fishing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroesGoneFishing): A literal case with him. Noctis is an avid angler, and gets very excited at the prospect of being able to fish whenever you approach a fishing spot.

[Heroic BSoD](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicBSOD):
    - He goes through one when (SPOILER) Luna is killed. - Seemingly goes through another after (SPOILER) being tricked into almost killing Prompto ; according to Aranea, he was so worried about him that he couldn't even speak properly.

[Heroic RRoD](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicRROD):
    - Each of the Royal Arms have their power [Cast from Lifespan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CastFromLifespan), and take off a small percentage of your health each time you attack with them. As such, it's not recommended to Warp Strike with them, or fight crowds with them (as it's percentage based, higher damage does more recoil, and attacking a crowd once is treated like attacking one multiple times). That said, plenty of health regen can mitigate it. - At the end of the game, (SPOILER) Noctis is killed due to him taking the power of the past kings.

[He's Back!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HesBack): After ten years, he reunites with his closest friends, ready to fulfill his destiny, though the welcome back party is relatively tame, for someone who had been gone for a decade.

[Humble Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumbleHero): As a student, he was basically the most powerful and important person on campus, but never acted ostentatious or shallow with his classmates. In fact he avoided people who just liked him for his regal status, and displayed absolutely no contempt with people who could be considered social outcasts like Prompto, and was instead impartial and inclusive with him.
[Hyperspace Arsenal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HyperspaceArsenal): It is a signature power of the royal family of Lucis to summon and control weapons for themselves and their allies.

[Identical Grandson](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IdenticalGrandson):  (SPOILER) As Ardyn points out in the *Dawn of the Future* novel, he's the spitting image of his ancestor, the Founder King, Somnus Lucis Caelum. Justified because Bahamut, presumably, created both in his own image .

[I Let Gwen Stacy Die](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ILetGwenStacyDie): After he receives a vision of Luna on board a train  (SPOILER) after her death , he breaks down in tears and [puts himself down for not being able to be there for her.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSelfDeprecation) It's quite heartrending to see.

[Immune to Bullets](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImmuneToBullets): If you hold down the Phase button with a Royal Arm equipped, your Armiger will block any bullets fired at you without having to actually phase.

[Impossibly Cool Clothes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpossiblyCoolClothes): Even his casual outfit looks like something you see in the street with a fisherman jacket over it. However those clothes like his friends have their own status boost and are this world's equivalent of fancy leather armor. Also subverted, since in a series that has become downright infamous for this trope it's also possible for Noctis to switch into some surprisingly mundane outfits like a letter jacket or a t-shirt and baseball cap.

[Implied Death Threat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpliedDeathThreat): First Secretary Camelia Claustra gives a subtle hint at one to Noctis during negotiations and, depending on your answer, she will either be impressed with you and compare you to your father or mock you for your perceived inexperience at diplomacy.
QUOTE **Claustra**: My duty is to my citizens. Should any harm befall them, there will be a reckoning for both King and Oracle.
[In-Series Nickname](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InSeriesNickname): Pretty much everyone around his age calls him "Noct".

[It Has Been an Honor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItHasBeenAnHonor):  (SPOILER) As Noctis prepares to end the Starscourge by killing himself, he says his farewell to his close friends. Their body language when they salute to him, as their King, invokes this trope. 
QUOTE **Noctis**: Prompto, Gladio, Ignis… I leave it to you. Walk tall, my friends.

[It's Personal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItsPersonal): At the start of the game, Noctis wants to avenge his homeland's destruction and his father's death. Following the events of Chapter 9,  (SPOILER) nothing less than a horrible and gruesome death for Ardyn will suffice to the point where Noctis attempts to kill him *immediately on sight.*

tropeName: It Sucks to Be the Chosen One
tropeNotes:
[It Sucks to Be the Chosen One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItSucksToBeTheChosenOne):  (SPOILER) Noct goes through untold suffering on his journey, ultimately sacrificing his life fulfilling his destiny.  As the first "Dawn" trailer states:
QUOTE *The father could but hold him and mourn his fate.*
[Jack of All Stats](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JackOfAllStats): Noctis can use all weapon types and magic but his companions have specialties with certain arms to set them apart from him.
[Javelin Thrower](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JavelinThrower): Noctis can throw his spear at enemies when he parries their attack or for certain combos.

tropeName: Jerk with a Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Jerk with a Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold): Definitely has his Jerkass moments, but deeply cares for his friends and subjects.

[Kindhearted Cat Lover](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KindheartedCatLover): [He has a very sweet and cute interaction with a cat he takes care of by providing it with food, which he clearly enjoyed doing.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MI__j-qn-FQ)

[King Incognito](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KingIncognito): He has to move covertly among the general populace and be careful not to draw suspicion to himself or else the Caelum line will end abruptly with him as he has no heirs or descendants himself. Then again, this is made slightly easier with [the false reports that he died](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReportsOfMyDeathWereGreatlyExaggerated) towards the beginning of the game.

[King in the Mountain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KingInTheMountain): Noctis spends 10 years in the spirit realm gathering the power he needs to defeat Ardyn and when he reappears in Eos he is shocked to find an adult Talcott ready to pick him up in a truck.

[Lady and Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LadyAndKnight): Gladio is the Knight to Noctis's King. He acts as Noctis's sword and shield [having sworn to protect him from harm and rid him of his enemies.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeclarationOfProtection)

[Last of His Kind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastOfHisKind): Prior to the start of the game, he becomes the last Lucian heir with his father's death.  (SPOILER) The Lucian line is then extinguished, following Noct's death.

[Leeroy Jenkins](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LeeroyJenkins): While he's normally putting up a facade of being calm and level-headed, he gets awfully confident once his powers kick in. His gang more or less help keep him in line.
QUOTE **Ignis:** Any plan of attack? 
**Noctis:** Plow right through them.

[Let's Get Dangerous!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LetsGetDangerous): He was really laid back at the start of the game since he was just off to get married. When Insomnia fell he says the Empire will wish they had a ceasefire to protect them and proceed storming through a squad of them to get back to Insomnia.
[Lightning Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightningBruiser): He is capable of inflicting serious damage and with his teleportation he is able to move around very quickly.

[Like Father, Like Son](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LikeFatherLikeSon): Invoked. [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) states that Noctis's appearance  (SPOILER) post [Plot-Relevant Age-Up](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlotRelevantAgeUp) was a conscious throwback to his father's .

[Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak): [Armiger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlyingWeapon), which summons weapons known as Royal Arms that will [protect him](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LuckilyMyShieldWillProtectMe) and [attack enemies](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StormOfBlades). It can be followed up by *Armiger Chain*, a move in which he and any active party members in range take up the Royal Arms one by one and rapidly strike the enemy with each weapon in succession. The [Updated Re Release](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UpdatedReRelease) introduces *Armiger Unleashed*, which is unlocked by collecting all 13 Royal Arms and equipping Noctis with the Founder King's Sigil. It allows him to perform combos in Armiger mode by timing Triangle (or Circle) presses, as well as providing him with his own Techniques.

[Living Battery](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LivingBattery): In order to use magic, Noctis's party must be near him because he is the one who grants them the power, similar to his father in *[Kingsglaive](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/KingsglaiveFinalFantasyXV)* (though Regis does not have to be close to the Glaives, showing more advanced control). This is exemplified in Chapter 13 where  (SPOILER) Imperial tech seals his powers and Noctis and his allies are left absolutely defenseless without his ability to summon weapons for them.
[Lonely Rich Kid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LonelyRichKid): *Brotherhood* shows him as being rather isolated at school, and frequently standing around by himself.
[Magic Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicKnight): He's proficient in swordplay, magic and summoning Astrals.

[Mangst](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Mangst): (SPOILER) Luna's death absolutely *devastates* him, and he keeps going on. Gladio mistakes this for [wangst](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Wangst) until Noctis proves himself.

[Manly Facial Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManlyFacialHair): As a youth, he has a [delicate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PrettyBoy), [young](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Bishonen), and [boyish](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Shonen) appearance. Following (SPOILER) his time in the spirit world for 10 years , [his beard is coarser](http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/finalfantasy/images/9/93/Regis_and_Older_Noctis.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160817195146) and more *[John Wick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/JohnWick)*-esque, reminiscent of his father.

[Manly Tears](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManlyTears): After Noctis defeats the demon in Episode 5 of *Brotherhood* he remembers his father’s promise to protect him. Overcome with grief, he collapses on his knees and sobs over the loss of his father. During the mid-credits stinger,  (SPOILER) he also visibly tears up as he struggles to express his gratitude to Gladio, Ignis and Prompto for sticking with him through thick and thin before he allows himself to die to save Eos .
[Master of All](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasterOfAll): Can use any weapon his partners use, practices elemancy and magic only accessible to his bloodline and he can drive.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): It's probably meant to be "light of the night sky" to complement Luna's name. Too bad they [butchered](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GratuitousLatin) the Latin.

[Messianic Archetype](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MessianicArchetype): He fits this trope to a T, and in ways that, [on close inspection](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ut930_vpA6Y), [many other examples of this archetype do not](http://ikkinthekitsune.tumblr.com/post/159061222318/). He's [chosen by the Crystal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChosenOne) to bring an end to the Starscourge (a disease which is very similar in both name and appearance to the aforementioned Geostigma) by fulfilling the Calling of his royal line, seeking the favor of the Astral gods, and using the power of the Crystal. Near the end of the game, (SPOILER) he learns of his true purpose — he must give his life to call forth divine Providence if he is to destroy the [Accursed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiChrist) and end the Scourge. And so, the game ends with [his ritual sacrifice on his throne](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice), after which [he and his dead fiancee's spirits are shown appearing as if at their wedding](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiedHappilyEverAfter). On top of that the fact that he's grown a beard and messy longer hair at the time of his sacrifice means he even [Looks Like Jesus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LooksLikeJesus). He's sometimes referred to by titles like "King of Kings" or "the Son" to make sure no one overlooks the connection. Then you take the *Dawn of the Future* novel into account, and learn that (SPOILER) the [Top God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TopGod), Bahamut, has a face that looks exactly like his under his mask, and that, presumably, Bahamut crafted both him and Somnus in his own image .

tropeName: Miles to Go Before I Sleep
tropeNotes: [Miles to Go Before I Sleep](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MilesToGoBeforeISleep):  (SPOILER) He must spend 10 years in the spirit world to gather enough power to kill Ardyn for good, knowing this will also mean his own death.
[Missing Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MissingMom): His mother Aulea died when he was still an infant, but all that's mentioned of her existence is a single line from Ignis about her death.

[Momma's Boy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MommasBoy): A gender-flipped parent version. He's extremely devoted to his father. He dreads the prospect of becoming king because it would mean his father would have to die first, and when the news of his father's murder reaches him he's devastated.

[Mukokuseki](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Mukokuseki): Averted. While the series has bounced in and out of this trope in the past, Noctis is possibly the most unambiguously East Asian-looking lead yet, with features such as black hair, pale skin, and almond-shaped bluish black eyes with eye folds. It especially stands out when compared to his teammates and even his own father looking completely European. Ironically, while there was a point in time when the setting and characters were supposed to be Japanese-inspired ([Yakuza](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Yakuza) specifically), Noctis's original design looked a lot more European. Interestingly he still averts this trope as an older man, despite looking a lot more like his (clearly white) father; he still retains a lot his East Asian features, with the overall result being that he looks more like a fairly realistic depiction of a mixed ancestry Eurasian man than the "stateless" ambiguity the trope implies.

[Multi-Melee Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MultiMeleeMaster): Noctis can wield a multitude of [swords](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroesPreferSwords), [greatswords](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS), spears, [daggers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeviousDaggers), [shields](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LuckilyMyShieldWillProtectMe). [machines](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheEngineer) and guns. With his [Royal Arms](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AncestralWeapon) he can also wield an axe, a [mace](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CarryABigStick), a [Double Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoubleWeapon), a [Magic Wand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicWand), a [Chainsaw Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChainsawGood), a [shuriken](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FumaShuriken), a [crossbow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AutomaticCrossbows) and a [katana](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KatanasAreJustBetter).

[Muscles Are Meaningless](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MusclesAreMeaningless): His arms are sticks compared to [Gladio's](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicBuild). That said, he can parry the fist of a giant. The game actually [lampshades this](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LampshadeHanging) when visiting Lestallum:
QUOTE **Noctis:** Damn, this place is hot!

QUOTE **Gladiolus:** [Just take your shirt off](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingShirtlessScene).

QUOTE **Noctis:** Like you? [No way](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EveryoneHasStandards).

QUOTE **Gladiolus:** What, too embarrassed to show your scrawny body?

QUOTE **Noctis:** Hey, I got muscle! ...[You just can't see it.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuspiciouslySpecificDenial)

QUOTE **Gladiolus:** [If you say so](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouKeepTellingYourselfThat).

[Mundane Utility](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MundaneUtility): In addition to storing the most powerful weapons in all of Eos, the Armiger is also home to his fishing rod! Yup, he conjures his rod the same way he would any other weapon, [and it's exactly as awesome as it sounds.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MundaneMadeAwesome)

tropeName: My God, What Have I Done?
tropeNotes: [My God, What Have I Done?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyGodWhatHaveIDone): After Noctis  (SPOILER) accidentally attacks Prompto, causing him to fall off the train,  Noctis is clearly distressed. The tone of his voice makes it clear that Noct is beating himself up over what he had done. In *Episode Prompto*, Aranea says that he was so worried about his safety that he couldn't even speak.

tropeName: My Life Flashed Before My Eyes
tropeNotes: [My Life Flashed Before My Eyes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyLifeFlashedBeforeMyEyes): When Bahamut reveals to him what he must do after he got stuck in the spirit world, he begins to realize that his destiny is to  (SPOILER)  die for the sake of everyone.  He starts to think back on the memories he had with everyone and we get to see [flashbacks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlashBack) of his memories with the people who were most precious to him throughout his life.  (SPOILER) In the ending, he also experiences this as he prepares for the spirit of his father to deal him the fatal blow that would send him to the Astral Realm where he can kill Ardyn for good.
[Near-Death Experience](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NearDeathExperience): A Marilith almost killed him when he was but a small child. This is what sends him into the dream realm in the Platinum Demo.
[Never Got to Say Goodbye](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeverGotToSayGoodbye): He never got to tell  (SPOILER) Luna his true feelings for her before Ardyn kills her .

[Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy): One look at him, and one would be pressed to think that he's brooding, moody and aloof. In truth, he's very friendly, down-to-earth and perky. Not without his giant ego, but he doesn't let that get in the way of his friends. That said, he doesn't have a *lot* of friends due to his lineage, as he hates exploiting it. As Prompto learns, all it takes to be his friend is just [be yourself](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeYourself) and *talk to him* — nothing else.

[Nice to the Waiter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceToTheWaiter): As the sole child of the king and heir to the throne, it's fair to say that he has a fairly affluent/upper class lifestyle, but he treats his servants and commoners with decency and respect.

[No Celebrities Were Harmed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoCelebritiesWereHarmed):  (SPOILER) Post-time skip  Noctis bears a strong resemblance to [Keanu Reeves](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/KeanuReeves) in his *[John Wick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/JohnWick)* movies.

[No Hero Discount](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoHeroDiscount): Justified. While Noctis is the Crown Prince of Lucis and king-in-waiting after the death of Regis, no one in the country does him any favors and ask him to do petty jobs for small rewards. The justification though is that most of them don't *know* he's the Crown Prince and presume he's just a civilian, and Noctis prefers it that way since he lets him blend in and avoid suspicion and detection. The main people who know he's the prince are the gang at Hammerhead, and Cid [has no interests in giving the gang a discount](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScrewPolitenessImASenior) since he thinks they should make their own way in the world, and he's told Takka the same for dealing with them. The only other person in on the secret is Dino, who expressly blackmails Noctis into doing errands for him on threat of exposing his identity via the press.

[No Hero to His Valet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoHeroToHisValet): Noctis is a king, a powerful fighter with a direct line to a group of [Physical Gods](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PhysicalGods), but that doesn't stop Ignis, Gladiolus and Prompto from snarking at his expense.

["No. Just… No" Reaction](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoJustNoReaction): Noctis can dismiss Iris’s flirting with him almost word for word when she brings up their time being spent together as almost like a date.

[Nostalgia Heaven](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NostalgiaHeaven): After he [ascends to the afterlife](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendToAHigherPlaneOfExistence) he gets to finally reunite with Luna and enjoy a happy ending with her.

[Not a Morning Person](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotAMorningPerson): He's definitely not the type to get out of bed early. In the novel, when the alarm goes off, he hits snooze, and Ignis has to remind him to wake up. In the demo, he clearly wants to stay in bed more, only getting up because of his friends pestering him. You could say his three hobbies in life are fishing, playing video games, and sleeping.
[Oh, Crap!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OhCrap): He is utterly shocked when he hears that Insomnia is destroyed.
[One-Man Army](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneManArmy): Even alone he climbs his way up a daemon infested MT factory with his ring and later  (SPOILER)  his father's sword .
[Perky Goth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PerkyGoth): Despite his moody demeanor and love of black clothing, he's actually a pretty nice guy.

[Picky Eater](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PickyEater): The first episode of *Brotherhood* shows him disdainfully plucking all the vegetables from his hamburger, putting them on Ignis's plate. Apparently, poor Ignis has been trying to get him to eat his veggies for *years*.

[Plot-Relevant Age-Up](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlotRelevantAgeUp):
    - At the climax of the *Platinum Demo*. (SPOILER) Young Noct is confronted by an Iron Giant, and the odds are definitely not in his favor. Through Carbuncle, he hears his father telling him that he alone controls his dreams. Back in the dreamscape, he proclaims he's not afraid and then transforms into the Noctis we know before proceeding to lay waste to the enemy. - Later on, Noctis gets (SPOILER) stuck in the Crystal for 10 years and comes out looking very unkempt. The very ending of the game makes it clear that he still looks youthful without the beard.

[Pretty Boy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PrettyBoy): Whether as a baby-faced 20 year old with boyish good looks or a rugged mid-aged 30 year old with full [Manly Facial Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManlyFacialHair). He's a *Final Fantasy* protagonist; this was kind of a given. [Aranea](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkActionGirl) [Highwind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DragonKnight) is quick to [lampshade it](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LampshadeHanging).  (SPOILER) He's [grown out of it](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManlyFacialHair) after the [Time Skip](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeSkip). 
QUOTE **Aranea:** Hey, pretty boy!

[Princely Young Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PrincelyYoungMan): He’s a young man fresh out of adolescence and a prince who has been groomed to succeed his father as the future King. Noctis's royal upbringing is said to shine through, as reflected in his body language, poise, and posture in contrast to his team, reflecting his regal status.

[Rank Scales with Asskicking](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RankScalesWithAsskicking): Like his father before him, Noctis is the King of his nation and his people, and is a majorly strong warrior.  (SPOILER) Even with just his father's sword and ring he can hold his own trapped in a maze against a horde of twisted MT's and daemons.
[Raven Hair, Ivory Skin](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RavenHairIvorySkin): Noctis is an extremely good-looking dark-haired youth with fair skin.

[Rebel Prince](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RebelPrince): Noctis is said to have a rebellious attitude, disliking the strict rules of his kingdom and acting as he pleases. This sometimes gets his friends into trouble. His father refers to him as his wayward son as well.

[Red Eyes, Take Warning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedEyesTakeWarning): Nomura said in [this interview](http://gematsu.com/2013/07/nomura-talks-final-fantasy-xv-kingdom-hearts-iii-at-japan-expo) that Noctis’s eyes become red when he uses his warp ability. (SPOILER) They also take on an eldritch purple glow when he summons Astrals.

[The Red Mage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheRedMage): He's the one who crafts the spells the party can equip, and it's suggested most of the team's healing items are actually drinks he enchants with healing magic.

tropeName: Reports of My Death Were Greatly Exaggerated
tropeNotes: [Reports of My Death Were Greatly Exaggerated](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReportsOfMyDeathWereGreatlyExaggerated): He was inaccurately reported to be among the dead during the fall of Insomnia.
[Revenge](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Revenge): Noctis's motivation is this, after his kingdom is invaded by those who seek the power of its crystal.
[Royal Blood](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoyalBlood): A prerequisite, apparently, in order to be able to use the full power of the Ring of the Lucii.

[Sanity Slippage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SanitySlippage): Noctis spends most of the game's main plot under considerable stress. By Chapter 12, he begins audibly losing it after  (SPOILER) Ardyn dupes him into attacking Prompto and knocking him off a speeding train.
[Saving the World](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SavingTheWorld): Fulfills his destiny as per the prophecy  (SPOILER)  but at the cost of his own life.

[Screw Destiny](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScrewDestiny):  (SPOILER)  Starts to realize he can do this in *Dawn of the Future* after getting advice from his father's spirit, and opts do so when he stays his hand after confronting Ardyn instead of killing him as the prophecy demanded, instead averting the entire [Self-Sacrifice Scheme](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SelfSacrificeScheme).

[Sealed Good in a Can](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SealedGoodInACan):  (SPOILER) He spends the ten years between Chapters 13 and 14 inside the Crystal, gathering the power needed to destroy Ardyn once and for all.

[Self-Sacrifice Scheme](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SelfSacrificeScheme): King Regis knew that Noctis would have to give up his life to save the land, and Luna also knew since she was an oracle, and her job was actually to help aid the chosen one in securing enough power in order to complete the task of ridding the world of daemons. Both Regis and Luna never told Noctis about his true fate, leading him to believe that he was actually being groomed to be king over Lucis and that he was supposed to marry Luna and rule honorably. In reality, he was being groomed to die.

[Serendipitous Survival](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SerendipitousSurvival): [The look on his face](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReactionShot) [when Ignis delivers him the news that Insomnia had been attacked is priceless.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigWhat)

[Serious Business](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SeriousBusiness): One quest involves Noctis catching a particular fish because someone challenged him to do it, and his pride as an angler means he can't let it go.

[School Idol](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SchoolIdol): He was very clearly the most popular and admired student in school. Being a member of the Royal Family, having impeccable good looks, and almost certainly the highest net worth in his country certainly helps.

[Sharp-Dressed Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SharpDressedMan): An Adonis in an expensive suit. Noctis was first seen wearing for a deleted scene from *Versus XIII*, and two of his available outfits consist of suits. One is the Royal Raiment, which is available as either a pre-order bonus or purchasable DLC <sup>note </sup>  It has one of the most useful abilities for exploration when you equip the "(No Jacket)" version: Noctis gets the ability to sprint infinitely without using stamina. With the Jacket on, however, it increases his magic power moderately.  The other is the Kingly Raiment, which can also be obtained as a pre-order bonus or  (SPOILER) unlocked during the last chapter of the main story .

[Shell-Shocked Veteran](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShellShockedVeteran): As stated by [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod), his appearance after the timeskip is meant to call the image of one. He also has some residual PTSD issues from the attack that crippled him in childhood.

[Shirtless Scene](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShirtlessScene): [Noctis’s shirt comes apart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ClothingDamage) fighting Niflheim soldiers in the Omen Trailer, [leaving his bare upper body exposed.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j-lMUv-ioD0) Which quickly lapses into semi-[Fan Disservice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FanDisservice) (SPOILER) as you watch him get possessed and kill Luna.

[Single-Target Sexuality](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SingleTargetSexuality): Has only ever had eyes for Luna since he was a child. He's aware but dismissive of Iris's crush on him and doesn't take too kindly to Aranea hitting on him, even in jest.

[The Slacker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheSlacker): Noctis is so laid back and easy going he can come off as lazy sometimes. If he weren’t a Prince, he might just be fishing, playing video games all day, and sleeping.

[Sleepyhead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Sleepyhead): From the trailers, it seems he can fall asleep just about anywhere (in his car, on his throne, leaning on a fence), and has done so in every one of his appearances.
    - [Lampshaded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LampshadeHanging) in the *Platinum Demo* as Carbuncle outright calls him the trope name. Considering the demo takes place in his dreams, they have a point. - The [OVA](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllThereInTheManual) (and a scene in the demo itself) implies, however, that young Noctis wasn't simply asleep during that dream sequence, but *in a coma and on the verge of death.* - *Brotherhood* Episode 2 has him *sleeping through a near-car crash*.
[Sleep Cute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SleepCute):  (SPOILER) With Luna  in the game's ending.
[Slouch of Villainy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SlouchOfVillainy): And he's the *hero.*

[Spoiled Sweet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpoiledSweet): He's the Crown Prince to the Lucian throne and his parental figures Regis and Ignis doting on him all his life, with Gladio even chastising Ignis for constantly spoiling Noctis in the *Brotherhood* anime. Yet, he grew up kind and modest who never acted shallow or flaunted his status, and even prefers to be [casual to everyone](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatsUpKingDude), though he still has streaks of [laziness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrilliantButLazy) and [rebellious behavior](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RebelPrince) because of their pampering.
[Star Power](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StarPower): Noctis's [Astrals](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SummonMagic) are stars.

[Storm of Blades](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StormOfBlades): Noctis's signature ability is the Armiger, when many swords and spears float around him and act as shields, attacking enemies of their own accord.
[Straight Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StraightMan): The developers stated that he was written to serve as one to Prompto's antics.

[Strong Family Resemblance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StrongFamilyResemblance): Not so obvious at the beginning of the game, but  (SPOILER) post-timeskip Noctis greatly resembles a younger version of his father Regis.  With the release of the Episode Ardyn trailer, pre-timeskip Noctis also takes after  (SPOILER) Ardyn's brother Somnus.

[Sword and Sorcerer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SwordAndSorcerer): During the Leviathan fight, he backs up Luna's initial magic blast with [a lot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathByAThousandCuts) of Warp Strikes, as she heals him from the sidelines.

[Sword Beam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SwordBeam): His Royal Cleave Technique fires a massive vertical beam of energy reminiscent of [Squall's Blasting Zone](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVIII).

[Take Up My Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakeUpMySword):
    - Literally takes up his father’s sword in the game in addition to succeeding him as King of Lucis. (SPOILER) Inverted in the ending, as he hands his sword to his father's spirit so the latter can complete his [Heroic Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice). - He also takes up (SPOILER) Luna's trident after the latter's death .

[Tall, Dark, and Handsome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TallDarkAndHandsome): After the timeskip. While he's only 176cm (5'9") and shorter than both Gladiolus and Ignis, everything else checks out, and he carries himself with a dignified air. Also applies in his youth, as an attendant during the Moogle Festival will call him dark and mysterious.

[Teleport Spam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeleportSpam): He can instantly teleport to the location of any weapon he has thrown. Additionally, he has short-range rapid teleport abilities in close-quarters combat, serving as a dodge mechanic exclusive to him.

[Tempting Fate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TemptingFate): One of the last things his father hears him say is "Drautos, he's in your hands now." Titus Drautos is none other than General Glauca, the main villain of *Kingsglaive* and the one who kills Regis.
[Throwing Your Sword Always Works](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThrowingYourSwordAlwaysWorks): Noctis frequently throws one of his weapons in combos, and they always land point end first.

[Time-Passage Beard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimePassageBeard): Noctis comes out of the Crystal with long unruly hair and newfound facial hair to show the ten years that passed. He cleans up most of it but leaves the beard alone.
[Tough Leader Façade](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ToughLeaderFacade): Noct feels he has to look and act serious publicly because of his duty.
[Trademark Favorite Food](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrademarkFavoriteFood): Especially enjoys comfort foods and dishes reminiscent of homecooked meals. One of them is also a cake made by his fiancee.

[Tragic Bromance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TragicBromance): His friendship with Gladio, Ignis, and Prompto is extremely close. During  (SPOILER)  their last campfire together , it's clear how much they all meant to each other. They know that Noct is about to  (SPOILER)  die and are mourning it, but they are grateful that they had so many memories together that they could cherish.  In the alternate ending  (SPOILER) it's averted, as events are changed thanks to Ignis.

[Trash of the Titans](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrashOfTheTitans): As shown in Brotherhood, he never bothered to tidy up his apartment and lived in take-out food until Ignis cleaned up after him and give him decent food.

[Tsundere](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Tsundere):
    - A type 2. Noctis is an easygoing, kind, humble, young man who is loyal to his friends, accepting and non-judgmental to social misfits, caring and protective towards his people, willing to take the blame and punishment in place of others so that they are safe, and has a strong sense of justice and integrity. While he is a very kind, sweet, generous, and gentle guy, he has his grumpy moments and is prone to mood swings, responding in a snappish tone when more polite responses could be used. This can be seen towards his father during their final farewell scene the moment Drautos calls out to Noctis at the stairs. Noctis is also snappy to Prompto when his friend inquires of Noctis’s messages to Luna, and towards Ignis in the *Brotherhood* Ignis episode when the young advisor was giving Noctis a report on the Kingdom and his weakening father, as well as many other moments. - Seems to be a bit of the Type 1 kind towards Luna. Whenever he's asked about his impending marriage, he tries to shrug it off, but anytime Umbra shows up with the notebook he uses to chat with Luna, he glances around to make sure his friends aren't watching too closely, then eagerly snatches it up.

[Turn the Other Cheek](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TurnTheOtherCheek): Ravus is quite mean and condescending towards Noctis, helping to destroy Insomnia, take over Lucis, murder his father, deem him unworthy of his father’s glaive after having stolen it and despite Noctis being its true owner, and attempting to steal the Ring of the Lucii which is Noct’s birthright. Much of it is out of a petty grudge he has against the Caelum family of which Noct is innocent. [Noct has no ill will towards him and even thanks him for all he had done, even though most of his actions we have seen were meant to hurt him.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EasilyForgiven)

[Unskilled, but Strong](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnskilledButStrong): His fighting style pretty much boils down to "wave the weapon in the direction of the enemy", especially compared to the other three when you control them.

[Used to Be More Social](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UsedToBeMoreSocial): According to the “Final Fantasy XV Prologue: Parting Ways”, Noctis was once known to be a lively child until the attack from the Marilith caused him to become more withdrawn. This is due to the implication that he was close to many of the servants who died. This incident forced him to realize that the world was not a safe place. [Him becoming more reclusive is almost certainly out of fear of losing people close to him for his sake.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeverBeHurtAgain)

[Vitriolic Best Buds](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VitriolicBestBuds): Noctis and Gladio may have their differences and do fight every now and then, [but they always remain friends throughout it all no matter what](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildhoodFriends) and have each other's back in battle.

[Vocal Dissonance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VocalDissonance): Oddly enough, his voice in the English version of *Episode Duscae*, provided by Ray Chase, is rather deep and gravelly, if young-sounding, to the point some have compared him to a teenage Batman. It's been almost entirely done away with in the final game where his overall voice is much higher-pitched and more cheerful. [Except](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGadfly) [when dealing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Troll) [with Ardyn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AxCrazy). His growl also tends to come back when he's just really angry in general, such as when he first finds out about the fate of Insomnia and  (SPOILER) when arguing with Gladio on the train after Luna's death.  And it comes back in full after the [Time Skip](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeSkip).

[Vocal Evolution](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VocalEvolution): In *Episode Duscae*, Noctis has a rather prominent deep, gutteral voice voice to the point that players would often confuse him with Gladio. In the final game, his voice is much lighter and youthful, although some of that gruffness comes back after the timeskip.
[Waistcoat of Style](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WaistcoatOfStyle): Wears one as part of the Royal Raiment (No Jacket) outfit.
[Walking Armory](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingArmory): A rare magical example, his weapons being able to appear on a whim.

[Warrior Prince](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WarriorPrince): In his case a very strong requirement. Once Regis kicks the bucket it will be Noctis's responsibility to fight against Niflheim and that includes on the battlefield.
