["Well Done, Son" Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WellDoneSonGuy): Noctis grew up idolizing his father as a role model and saw him as his personal hero, being the most influential person in his life. [Regis’s letter to Luna expressed his thoughts on how proud he was of his son despite his wayward behavior.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SoProudOfYou)

[What's Up, King Dude?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatsUpKingDude): Thanks to many outside the Crown City not knowing who the prince is/what he looks like, commoners have incredibly easy access to Noctis and are ridiculously casual with him (not that he minds; in fact, he prefers it that way). Dino blackmailing him while later talking to him like he’s a best bud, Vyv joking about giving him over to Niflheim, Sania giving him out assignments to do as if he’s a student of hers, and Prompto slapping him on the buttocks whenever he wants to among others. It’s very easy to hear someone snarking at him and his relationship to many people in Lucis is less King/Citizen and more Employee/Employer with him willing to help people out no matter what they offer him.

[When He Smiles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhenHeSmiles):
    - As mentioned above, he's usually straight-faced and a bit moody, but when he does smile… *[damn.](http://66.media.tumblr.com/06e30342df365ffe25d1a5fbb2b19665/tumblr_o3p8ycxnVm1u3o7smo1_540.png)◊* - Especially towards the end, during the campfire scene. It's simultaneously beautiful but also heartbreaking.
[When You Coming Home, Dad?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhenYouComingHomeDad): Suffered from this as a child, according to *Platinum Demo*.

[Wise Beyond Their Years](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WiseBeyondTheirYears): One of the perks of having the Ring of the Lucii is that the collective wisdom and power of previous Kings is passed down to the Ringbearer, [the current one being Noctis](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheWisePrince), making each successor essentially wiser and stronger than the previous one.
[Would Hit a Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WouldHitAGirl): He doesn't hesitate fighting Aranea, one of his parries consists of grabbing her and smashing her face on the pavement.
[You Can't Go Home Again](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouCantGoHomeAgain): At the start of the game, Noct can't return home to Insomnia after his father is killed. At first.

[You Killed My Father](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouKilledMyFather): His father Regis was killed during Insomnia's destruction at the hands of Niflheim and it serves as one of Noctis's motivations to avenge Regis's death.

[Your Days Are Numbered](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YourDaysAreNumbered): Noctis had no idea his days were numbered until  (SPOILER) the very end of his life, while Regis knew when he discovered he was the chosen one and Luna knew as well due to her status as an oracle.  Justified however as they wanted him to live as normal and happy a life as possible before he has to fulfill his destiny.

[Demon Slaying](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemonSlaying): Aranea's unit specialized in daemon slaying before being commissioned as a part of Niflheim's army. Post-time skip, all three characters gained reputations for being master daemon slayers, Cor and Aranea especially.

[Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember): All the characters here will join the party during scripted events throughout the story, save for Aranea who in addition to her story sequence [will randomly show up when fighting daemons at night.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigDamnHeroes)
[Optional Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalPartyMember): Aranea can be glitched into a permanent party member using a very simple trick. This also applies to Cor and Iris.
[A Taste of Power](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ATasteOfPower): Both Cor and Aranea are *far* stronger than the core group when they join up the first time.

[Accidental Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AccidentalHero): Although he is famous for surviving the Trial of Gilgamesh, he actually  (SPOILER)  only survived after he ran away from the trial. That said he was able to cut off Gilgamesh's arm but left his Genji Blade behind with him after doing so .

[Advertised Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdvertisedExtra): Early promotional material suggested that he would be a major supporting character alongside Noctis and his friends. As it is turns out his role in the main game is limited to a brief appearance as a [Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember), and he largely disappears from the plot soon after. Thankfully Episode Gladiolus and the Royal Edition gave him some much needed screentime and characterization.

[Badass Normal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassNormal): Cor is known to be one of Lucis' 3 best fighters and this group includes magically enhanced warriors. The description of his katana reveals that while the katana is quite sharp...that's it; most of Cor's feats are due to his own strength and tactical prowess. Cor is even vastly superior to Noctis and his crew early on in the game; and this is despite Noctis and his party having access to magic and supernatural weaponry. Even if Cor was enhanced by magic, Regis' death and sudden loss of magic didn't stop him as he escaped from the sacking of Insomnia; something the party notes to be impressive.
[Big Damn Heroes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigDamnHeroes): Just as  (SPOILER) Noct and Co. are pinned down by Cerberus, he jumps right in to deal the Daemon a grievous blow .

[Demoted to Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemotedToExtra): He was initially planned to be the fifth permanent party member in the game, joining the crew at a later point in the game. In the final product, he's present for the first few chapters and then is barely seen or heard about. He returns in *Episode Gladiolus*, which reveals more about him such as when he joined the Crownsguard and how he undertook the trial of Gilgamesh.
    - His role is expanded in the [Updated Re Release](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UpdatedReRelease), where he (SPOILER) accompanies Noct and Co. to Insomnia in Chapter 14, even joining the fight against Cerberus .

[Embarrassing Nickname](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EmbarrassingNickname): *Episode Gladiolus* reveals that "The Immortal" is this.  (SPOILER)  He's the only man to survive the trial of Gilgamesh, not because he beat it, but because he fled, losing his blade in the process. Upon his return, he was deemed "Immortal" for surviving but all it does is remind him of his failure .
[Four-Star Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FourStarBadass): He is the head of the Lucian military and a famed fighter.

[Frontline General](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FrontlineGeneral): He holds the rank of Marshal in Lucis's army, and has been shown [fighting with King Regis in the thick of battle](http://gematsu.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/FFXV-ATR-Captures_09-19-15_003.jpg)◊.

[Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember):
    - He joins the party early on in the game as one. - Again in *Episode Gladiolus* where he accompanies Gladio on the the Trial of Gilgamesh. - He will join once more in the *Royal Edition* where he helps the party fight Cerberus if you finish his sidequests in Lucius.

[Hero of Another Story](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroOfAnotherStory): Cor is a [Badass Normal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassNormal) who seems to have been the Gladio to King Regis' Noctis. He has a reputation and lives up to it. When he joins the guys, he can be counted on to pull his weight and more and when he leaves, the guys spend the rest of the chapter wishing he'd come back and talking about how impressive he is. The player doesn't get to see much of Cor, but with nicknames like The Marshal and The Immortal and knowing that he's served King Regis for decades, his character is almost a cruel tease, since the story will likely never be told in full.
[Iaijutsu Practitioner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IaijutsuPractitioner): Cor only draws his katana when he is about to use it, otherwise keeping it in his sheath.

[Katanas Are Just Better](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KatanasAreJustBetter): Cor wields the Kotetsu katana, and is a [Master Swordsman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasterSwordsman) famous throughout the world as "The Immortal". He's notably the only guy on the entire continent to use katana's that's still alive (a former King used one and presumably Cor had a teacher) at the start of the story, which are seen as rare and hard to use weapons made in a far away land. Start of the story because Noctis and Gladio can later acquire some of their own, notably Cor's own former weapon the Genji Blade.
[Living Legend](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LivingLegend): Described as such, due to his military prowess.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Also a [Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag). He isn't the series' [first](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyII) [character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVIII) to have "lion heart" in his name.
[The Mentor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheMentor): He serves as a mentor to the protagonists.
[My Greatest Failure](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyGreatestFailure): Not being able to save Regis from dying during Insomnia's invasion.
[No One Could Survive That!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoOneCouldSurviveThat): He's the only man to ever survive the Trial of Gilgamesh, and he did it when he was a *teenager.*
[Praetorian Guard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PraetorianGuard): His job.
[Red Baron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedBaron): He is famed as "The Immortal" and "The Marshal".

[Sergeant Rock](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SergeantRock): Harsh to Noctis and the others, but an honorable man nonetheless. His essential philosophy is "you may be doing well, but you're only as good as your last battle, so take praise as an excuse to keep trying."
[The Stoic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStoic): What we've seen of him makes him seem fairly unflappable.
[Sword Beam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SwordBeam): Cor's Lion's Roar technique fires one with a draw slash.
[Tag Along Kid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TagAlongKid): He was much younger then the rest of Regis's entourage and quite impetuous at that.
[Taking the Bullet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakingTheBullet): He takes a blast from Cerberus head-on to protect Noct, this of course prevents him from aiding in the boss battles to follow.

[A Taste of Power](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ATasteOfPower): At the point you're likely to get Cor as a guest early on, you're probably a couple hundred in HP. Cor's rocking over three thousand HP, a good indicator of the sheer power difference between a starting party and the commander of the Crownsguard.
[Teen Genius](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeenGenius): Became a soldier at 13 and joined the crownsguard at 15.
[True Companions](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueCompanions): Was part of Regis road trip buddies and if Noctis and Cid's picture is any sign they use to be as close as the party is now.
[Undying Loyalty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UndyingLoyalty): To Noctis and his father.

[Aborted Declaration of Love](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbortedDeclarationOfLove): Before Noctis goes off to on his bachelor party the day before the game begins, Iris tries to confess her feelings for him, but can only bring herself to congratulate him on his upcoming nuptials. The *Royal Edition* adds a new scene to the end of the game where she calls Noctis and says she has to talk to him about something, but wants to do it in person the next time she sees him.
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): She joins Noctis and his buds on occasion as a guest party member, and she packs one mean kick.
[Action Survivor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionSurvivor): She manages to escape the invasion of Insomnia, taking refuge in Lestallum.
[Annoying Younger Sibling](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnnoyingYoungerSibling): At times, when she was a kid.

[Attention Deficit... Ooh, Shiny!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AttentionDeficitOohShiny): When she was little, she wouldn't stop fussing until she finally got to meet Prince Noctis. When she finally *did* arrive at the citadel, she got distracted by... a cat, and chased it all the way out of the citadel and into the city, getting lost in the process. Thankfully, Noct found her and helped her get back to the citadel, and the two have been close friends ever since. This incident is also what finally earned Noct Gladio's respect and friendship.

[Badass Adorable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassAdorable): Comes with being a member of a family that's devoted their lives to guarding the kings of Lucis. Yes, it's the same girl who sews Moogle dolls and even [brings them with her into battle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImprobableWeaponUser).
[Bare-Fisted Monk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BareFistedMonk): Iris for the most part stays out of combat, but when she does get her hands dirty, she uses martial arts to fight.

[Childhood Friend](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildhoodFriend): Of Noctis and Ignis, presumably because she tagged along a lot when Gladio was hanging out with them. Ignis mentions they spend a lot of time bonding over taking care of the prince.
[Combat Medic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatMedic): Falls into this role while she's in the party, given her propensity to sling Potions to anyone who's low on health.

[Developer's Foresight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DevelopersForesight): She has the most integration with the party when she's brought along as a guest, having unique dialogue for when she's in combat, camping at a haven and certain lodging locations, having her own Chocobo around when Noctis rents for the party, joining in for Prompto's photos and even being able to ride the Regalia. While she only really joins the party for all of one chapter, which limits how much she's actually seen fighting alongside them, bringing Iris into the rest of the open world through glitches and such shows all of that is very much intact.
[Disappeared Dad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisappearedDad): As with Gladiolus, her father died during Niflheim's invasion of Lucis.
[Diving Kick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DivingKick): She does one for her Eclipse technique after being tossed up into the air by Gladio.
[The Exile](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheExile): During the attack on Insomnia, she escaped with some of the Crownsguard and took refuge from Niflheim in Lestallum.
[Family Theme Naming](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FamilyThemeNaming): Like her big brother, her name also happens to be the name of a flower.
[Future Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FutureBadass): In the World of Ruin, she's a reputed daemon slayer.
[Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember): Can join Noctis and friends in some missions and will even participate in battles.
[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): *Insanely* skilled in chocobo racing. She's the final opponent at Wiz's racing post.
[Hopeless Suitor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HopelessSuitor): Iris is hopelessly enamored with Noctis, but he's only had eyes for Luna since he was a boy.

[Improbable Weapon User](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImprobableWeaponUser): In addition to her fists, she also has a Link Strike where she clubs enemies with a large [Moogle doll](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GirlsLoveStuffedAnimals).

[Item Caddy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItemCaddy): She has the same Recovery skill as Ignis, which lets her occasionally hand out a free [Healing Potion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HealingPotion) to an injured ally and she can heal Noctis with certain Link Attacks.

tropeName: I Want My Beloved to Be Happy
tropeNotes: [I Want My Beloved to Be Happy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IWantMyBelovedToBeHappy): She has a massive flame for Noctis, but she's also fully aware of his love for Lunafreya; she decides to back off and support them without complaint.
[Kick Chick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KickChick): Iris will use her arms for elaborate grappling enemies but her actual striking attacks are all done with her legs.
[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Iris was a Greek goddess who used rainbows to deliver messages.
[Neck Snap](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeckSnap): Eclipse on an MT enemy will have Iris pull back their head while kneeing them in the back to snap their necks and finish them in one blow.
[Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl): A bit snarky and mischievous, but Iris is a genuinely sweet teenage girl.
[One-Hit Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKill): Her Eclipse technique will destroy any single MT enemy in one go.
[Perky Goth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PerkyGoth): Wears black due to her status as a member of a Lucian noble house, but she's actually quite cheerful and perky.
[Sibling Team](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SiblingTeam): When you use her Eclipse technique on non-Magitek Infantry enemies, Gladio will aid her in the attack by tossing her in the air.

[Support Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SupportPartyMember): Iris has low HP and no basic attacks when she's tagging along with the boys, but she can't be knocked out, has several useful [Link Strikes and Blindside Links](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombinationAttack) and her Eclipse technique is a [One-Hit Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKill) on Magitek Infantry type enemies where she dismantles them with her bare hands.

[Textile Work Is Feminine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TextileWorkIsFeminine): Iris sews Noct a Moogle doll to take with him as a good luck charm; when it gets damaged, you can bring it back to her for her to fix.
[Took a Level in Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInBadass): Post [Time Skip](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeSkip), she's built a reputation as a noted daemon slayer.
[Unlucky Childhood Friend](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnluckyChildhoodFriend): She's pretty obviously in love with Noctis, but he cares for her only as a friend.

[Unrequited Love Lasts Forever](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnrequitedLoveLastsForever): In the Royal Edition, she gives Noct a phone call when he wakes up  (SPOILER) after his ten year sleep in the crystal , and tells him [there's something she needs to tell him in person after everything is done](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LoveConfession). Of course, in the main ending  (SPOILER) Noctis doesn't make it back from Insomnia, and is [Together in Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TogetherInDeath) with Luna at the end...[However, the same is not true for the alternate ending from Episode Ignis](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SubvertedTrope), where Noctis lives while Luna remains dead, yet it's unclear how things might proceed from there .
[Waif-Fu](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WaifFu): Iris grapples MT enemies clad in full armor that must weigh twice as much as her for instant kills.

[Action Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionMom): She adopts Solara in the *Dawn of the Future* novel and raises her in the  (SPOILER)  ten year [Time Skip](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeSkip) . As noted in later entries, Aranea is also still a full-time daemon hunter during this time and Solara follows suit.

[Affably Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AffablyEvil): She only works for Niflheim because they pay her to fight for them, withdrawing from battle once the terms of their contract are completed. Her fight with Noctis and his group also gave the impression she was just toying with them, and her mischievous flirting with him is not something you would expect from an enemy combatant.
[Air Jousting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AirJousting): Aranea rockets around through the air like a torpedo fairly regularly in combat.

[Anti-Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiVillain): She only fights against Noctis and his group because she's paid to, and when her shift is over she quickly withdraws. During said fight, it's implied she was just toying with them and future encounters with her are much more amicable.
[Badass Longcoat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassLongcoat): Her outfit in the *Episode Prompto* DLC, complete with a red [Scarf of Asskicking](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScarfOfAsskicking).

[Badass Normal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassNormal): No superpowers about her,  (SPOILER)  yet in *Dawn of the Future* she single-handedly takes down a Diamond Weapon, which were previously shown only to be matched by the Lucii themselves in the form of the Old Wall.

[The Baroness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBaroness): Starts off leaning in this direction, given her commanding attitude and her observations that Noctis is [a good-looking guy.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Bishounen) Subverted later on when she acts more professionally around Noctis.
[Benevolent Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BenevolentBoss): To her men, who seem to be very fond of her.

[Big Damn Heroes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigDamnHeroes): Occasionally when the party is driving around at night and gets attacked by daemons, Aranea will show up with her dropship and temporarily join up until the daemons are dead.
    - (SPOILER) In Prompto's episode, she shows up as a guest character to help him while in the Magitek facility.
[Blood Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight): She loves a good fight and comes off as rather aggressive initially.

[Breakout Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreakoutCharacter): Despite having a pretty minor role in the game's plot and promotional materials, she left a big impression on fans. *Episode Prompto* gave her a large supporting role, and she was set to have her own DLC epsiode alongside Lunafreya, Ardyn, and Noctis, before it was scrapped and their story arc turned into a novelization. The spin-offs like *Record Keeper* and *Opera Omnia* include her as a playable character, and the latter not only made her the second character to debut in the Global version of the game before Japan (making it a big announcement), but she beat both Ignis and Gladio into the game.

[Combination Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombinationAttack): [She will caress Noctis during a double dragoon link strike attack and warmly compliment him afterwards.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PBqCaWxtJj0)
[Cool Big Sis](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolBigSis): To Prompto in his eponymous DLC, where she takes him under her wing and protects him as he tries to get away from Gralea.
[Consummate Professional](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ConsummateProfessional): She only fights for money.
[Cool Ship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolShip): She flies around in a red dropship, similar in appearance to the ones seen throughout the game.

[Dark Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkActionGirl): Subverted as she isn't as villainous as her bosses despite fighting for the empire, but more akin to being a [mercenary](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiredGuns).
[Dark Is Not Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkIsNotEvil): Despite the dark clothing she wears, she is by far the most heroic of the people of Niflheim.
[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): Makes more than few quips when she joins the party.
[Defeat Means Friendship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefeatMeansFriendship): Following her defeat, she becomes one of Noctis's closest allies.
[Defector from Decadence](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefectorFromDecadence): She cuts ties with Niflheim after all that has happened in Altissia's destruction.

[Demon Slaying](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemonSlaying): She and her unit were originally Daemon hunters for hire before they signed on with Niflheim. After they abandon the Empire, they go back to their old profession. Post-time-skip,  (SPOILER) she forged a legendary reputation as a daemon hunter alongside her right hand men Biggs and Wedge.

[Dude Magnet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DudeMagnet): While nowhere near to the same extent as Cindy, Gladio and Prompto seriously have the hots for her. [Aranea is not touching any of it](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker).
[Dragon Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DragonKnight): She is a more cyberpunk take on the Dragoon job class.

[Establishing Character Moment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EstablishingCharacterMoment): After defeating her she abruptly stops the battle. Noting that it's past her working hours Aranea leaves saying she doesn't get any more money for fighting after hours. This shows that her loyalty to Nifleheim is shaky at best; only extending to how much money they pay her.

[Even Evil Has Standards](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvenEvilHasStandards): She is disgusted with Aldercapt and Ardyn's actions in turning specimens into daemons. She recognizes the Empire was bad before but Ardyn's administration is a step too far for her.

[Friendly Enemy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FriendlyEnemy): She gets some [flirts with Noctis a bit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FoeRomanceSubtext) during their first encounter and she even joins the party temporarily to help them get some mithril ore. She also extends an offer to "train" them again in the future and is never encountered as an enemy again in the story, instead, she spends her time in relief and rescue operations. She also offers some advice and encouragement to Noctis after helping out in Cleigne, telling him not to let anyone tell him how to walk his path in life.

[Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember): Because Ardyn formed a temporary alliance with Noctis's party, Aranea is responsible for accompanying them in Cleigne, supposedly "training" them while raiding a temple for mythril ore. She will also randomly join the party when fighting daemons at night. Her stats as a guest party member are on par with Cor.
    - Aranea can even be made into a *permanent party member* thanks to a very simple and easy glitch! [Just follow these steps.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xzr38Pa5Puc) - And again in *Episode Prompto*.

[Heel–Face Turn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaceTurn): After [the destruction of Altissia](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhamEpisode), she and the rest of the 86th Airborne sever their ties with Niflheim and take off on their own. The next time Noctis and friends run into her, she and her men are running search and rescue operations in Tenebrae. Although Aranea was considering leaving the Empire way before Altissia's destruction; telling Noctis and his friends that Nilfheim's experimentation with daemon research as being her primary reason why she should.

[Helmets Are Hardly Heroic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HelmetsAreHardlyHeroic): Subverted. She is introduced as being on the antagonists' side, but even after she switches sides to assist the party more, she keeps her helmet in battle. On a side note, she's probably really glad to be wearing that helmet during her boss fight, as a successful counter to her diving attack is for Noctis to grab her by the head and slam her facefirst into the ground. Played straight in the *Episode Prompto* DLC, though, her winter outfit doesn't have her wearing any kind of helmet.
[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): She can cook for your party in Comrades! She's fairly proud of her Niflheim cuisine.
[Hidden Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenHeartOfGold): Acts like an Imperial hardass, but in reality, she's a sweet and very friendly woman.
[High-Altitude Battle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HighAltitudeBattle): During her boss fight, doing a Warp-strike on her while she is in mid-air will result in one of these.

[Hired Guns](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiredGuns): Aranea and her unit are on paper officially part of the Niflheim military, but the truth is that they're really [a mercenary force working under contract for Niflheim.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PrivateMilitaryContractors)

[Hotter and Sexier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotterAndSexier): Inversion: her original design in the 2011 *Versus XIII* trailer had quite a bit more fanservice to it, specifically in the form of [Zettai Ryouiki](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ZettaiRyouiki) and even being able to see her underwear while diving. Her appearance in *XV* has her legs fully armored.
[In-Series Nickname](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InSeriesNickname): Her own troops refer to her as "Lady A."

[I Was Just Passing Through](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IWasJustPassingThrough): She may say as much when she joins randomly on the overworld.
QUOTE "I was out taking down some daemons, and just happened to be in the area."

[Jousting Lance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JoustingLance): The Stoss Spear has a distinctly jousting lance appearance to it, fittingly for a noble warrior like Aranea and it goes well with her title the Dragoon (Or *[Dragon Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DragonKnight)* as it translates to in Japanese), as well as her [Air Jousting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AirJousting)-filled fighting style.
[Lady of War](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LadyOfWar): The only prominent female officer in the Empire, and an *excellent* warrior to boot.
[Lightning Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightningBruiser): Her specialty is zipping around mid-air faster than you can keep up, then slamming down with full force *hard.*
[Magitek](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Magitek): Aranea is able to compete with Noctis and his friends' magically enhanced fighting abilities by her magitek enhanced Stoss Spear and Dragon Mail.
[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Her name is a reference to [the species of orb-weaver spider](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orb-weaver_spider).

[Ms. Fanservice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsFanservice): Downplayed in that she isn't as much of one as Cindy, but she is very attractive, something which other characters notice. Her costume emphasises her sexiness and this was even more so in her concept art.

[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag):
    - Her surname is one to [the](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyII) [other](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyIV) [Highwinds](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyV) [of](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII) the franchise, who are all part of the Dragoon class (or the equivalent). - Her special attack—also named "Highwind"—is one to [Fang's Full ATB Skill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyXIII).

[Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl): It might not look it, but she's right up there with Cor in terms of heroics. Following the Altissia incident, she straight-up leaves the empire and begins focusing on search and rescue ops for anyone and everyone caught in the crossfire. Aside from her first meeting where she kind of toyed with and teased Noctis, in all subsequent meetings she is always helpful and friendly to them - if a little rough around the edges.

[Noble Top Enforcer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NobleTopEnforcer): She states she’s just a mercenary fighting for the money, openly expressing her disapproval of Niflheim's practices to Noctis and his friends, absolutely detests Ardyn and eventually leaves the empire for good.

[Older Than They Look](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OlderThanTheyLook): Although she looks like she's in her early 20s Aranea is actually 30 years old. She's also 40 after the [Time Skip](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeSkip).

[Optional Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalBoss):  (SPOILER) In Episode Prompto, she can be challenged in one of the sidequests and then later after completing the game can be challenged in campsites.

[Punch-Clock Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PunchClockVillain): Figuratively and *literally* - in the case of the latter, she won't fight against Noctis past her paycheck. Soon after, she outright leaves the empire to focus on rescue missions and daemon slaying, in the process becoming a good friend of Noctis. Being an Imperial soldier was just a job for her, [one she very much hated and had no plans of putting up with any further.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenHeartOfGold)

[Powers via Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowersViaWeapon): Aranea herself in an ordinary woman without the same magically enhanced strength of the other party members, but her magitek Stoss Spear and Intertia Controller give her the strength comparable to the Lucians.

[Red Baron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedBaron): Due to her mastery of aerial combat, she is referred to as "the Dragoon" by the Imperial Army. Goes even further post-time-skip, when she manages to pick up an even *bigger* reputation as a master daemon slayer alongside Cor. The two have effectively been the main driving force in keeping Lestallum safe even after ten years of complete hell.

[Rocket-Powered Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RocketPoweredWeapon): The Stoss Spear has a magitek engine built into it which can propel Aranea like a rocket which helps facilitate her aerial combat style.

[Sanity Has Advantages](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SanityHasAdvantages): In her case, her completely understandable decision to defect from the insane Niflheim Empire, means that she ends up living, while all of Niflheim goes to hell.

[Sexy Mentor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SexyMentor): She's got quite the fanbase complimenting her on her looks, and halfway into the game, she offers to "train" Noctis and his group some more after they retrieve the mythril ore. Subverted in that *everyone* knows that her mission to "train" Noctis is just more of [Ardyn's bullshit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Troll), but she still [joins and helps them without hesitation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenHeartOfGold) - and her latter offer *does* seem genuine. She eventually does make good on her training offer with Prompto in his DLC; the [Optional Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OptionalBoss) battle against her is even called "Intensive Training".
    - As of the 1.21 update, she can be fought at campsites in the main game under three different Training difficulties. Guess Noct also took her up on her offer!

[Screw This, I'm Outta Here](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScrewThisImOuttaHere): She leaves Niflheim after the destruction of Altissia at the hands of Leviathan and takes her entire unit with her, opting to carry out search and rescue ops.
[The Smurfette Principle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheSmurfettePrinciple): The only permanent female member of the party, though courtesy of a glitch that Square-Enix never bothered to fix.
[Spectacular Spinning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpectacularSpinning): She tends to swing her spear in wide arcs and herself with it quite a bit.

tropeName: This Is as Far as I Go
tropeNotes: [This Is as Far as I Go](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThisIsAsFarAsIGo): After Noctis and his friends reach Lestallum, Aranea says that they are on their own in finding Holly to treat the raw ore and stabilizing the EXINERIS power plant.

[Token Good Teammate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TokenGoodTeammate): In comparison to the rest of the higher-ups in Niflheim, she is this, being disgusted by the actions of the Empire. Her presence in Prompto's photos is also indicative of the bond she has with the group.

[Universally Beloved Leader](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UniversallyBelovedLeader): All the soldiers under her command absolutely adore her and are unquestionably loyal to *just* her. When she defects from the Empire, she takes the entirety of the 86th with her without any fuss or muss. Following the Starscourge, even the Lucians began to revere her as a hero.

[Villainesses Want Heroes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VillainessesWantHeroes): Subverted: her calling Noct a "pretty boy" during their fight looks like this, but she turns out to be a heroic person, and she does not display any kind of romantic interest at all in her subsequent interactions with Noct.

[Wake-Up Call Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WakeUpCallBoss): While there have been a few good battles in early parts of the game, the fight against Aranea serves as the first *real* challenge of the game. You'll be scrambling to keep up with her and consuming more than a fair share of Potions.

[Disc-One Nuke](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiscOneNuke): He's the most powerful guest party member in *Comrades*, always 10 levels higher with impressive stats. When you see him in the party list, your chances of victory go up considerably. He's especially useful for newbies, as he can easily carry you through most early quests.
[Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinalBoss): He's *technically* this for *Comrades.* He's the absolute last challenge the Glaives can face against in the game's final update.

[Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember): Like all other characters on this page. Unlike the rest however, who are at least scripted into the game, Kenny's appearance is entirely random.

[Hero of Another Story](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroOfAnotherStory): The hero of his own titular story, *[Episode Kenny!](https://imgur.com/jrxMJTq)* Too bad there's actually no such thing, as it was announced on [April Fools' Day](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AprilFoolsDay).
[Improbable Weapon User](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImprobableWeaponUser): He wields a pair of deadly fish as his weapons. [Even has his own Fishy Armiger!](https://youtu.be/3My9FkS29xg?t=1m)
[Large Ham](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeHam): Not in mannerisms, but certainly in action!
[Lethal Joke Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LethalJokeCharacter): It's *Kenny Crow*, yet he's also the single strongest AI party member in the game.
[Lightning Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightningBruiser): His fish have the Daggers moveset, making him a very fast attacker.

[No Sense of Personal Space](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoSenseOfPersonalSpace): Poor, poor Noct. He'll be avoiding Jetty's soda for the rest of his life now.
QUOTE *"[Thanks for the mouthful.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker)"*
[Rule of Funny](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RuleOfFunny): Basically the entire reason he exists.

[The Voiceless](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheVoiceless): Aside from his famous catchphrase heard of the radio, Kenny doesn't say a word. Or even grunt. [He is completely silent in battle.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BewareTheQuietOnes)
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): Just as capable in combat as Noctis, which leads to her taking the lead several times - despite having suggested they team up herself.
[Back-to-Back Badasses](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BackToBackBadasses): Several of her attacks involve teaming up with Noctis dual-style - even complete with hand-drawn cutins.
[Color Contrast](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColorContrast): With Noctis, having the white to compare and contrast with his black.
[Cool Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolSword): Wields a hefty rapier in combat imbued with holy power. After completing the event, Noctis can acquire her sword.

[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): Has *quite* the sharp tongue when it comes down to it, [which results in some good back and forth between her and Noctis](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SnarkToSnarkCombat).
[Expy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Expy): Of **Stella** Nox Fleuret, the scrapped female protagonist of Versus XIII before it was revamped into XV.
[Fashionable Asymmetry](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FashionableAsymmetry): Has armor on only her right arm, the same one that holds her [Royal Rapier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoyalRapier).

[Foil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Foil): Her personality and mannerisms are *very* similar to Noct's, albeit swapping his introversion for extroversion and [black](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkIsNotEvil) for [white](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightIsGood). Also, throughout the whole DLC, Sarah wields a single [Royal Rapier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoyalRapier) compared to Noctis' own [Multi-Melee Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MultiMeleeMaster)-style.
[Friend to All Children](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FriendToAllChildren): Has a soft spot for kids, and quickly endears herself to the Hiso Aliens.

[Hero of Another Story](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroOfAnotherStory): Is the main heroine of *Terra Wars*. Her meeting with Noctis is essentially two [lead heroes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroProtagonist) being taken out of their respective stories by an [force home to neither series](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OutsideContextProblem) and to solve a problem in order to go home.

[Hot-Blooded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotBlooded): She's reckless to a point where her survival skills are...lacking, almost to [Leeroy Jenkins](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LeeroyJenkins) territory. Her constantly rushing into danger exasperates [Noct](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EveryoneHasStandards).

tropeName: Kicking Ass in All Her Finery
tropeNotes: [Kicking Ass in All Her Finery](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KickingAssInAllHerFinery): Her wearing a sophisticated and fashionable dress does NOT stop her from mowing down anything in her way.

[Kick Chick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KickChick): Delivers a [Roundhouse Kick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoundhouseKick) * to the Engine Blade* when doing one of her [Link Strikes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombinationAttack) with Noct.
[Lady of War](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LadyOfWar): She is elegant and graceful in combat.

[Light Is Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightIsGood): Has the looks, powers, and fighting style that can lead one to easily mistake her for [The Paladin](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThePaladin) and is just as heroic and kind as [Noctis](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHero).
[Master Swordsman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasterSwordsman): As shown, she knows how to use her rapier with the upmost efficiency.
[Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl): Despite her rashness, she's extremely easy to get along with.
[Only One Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OnlyOneName): She goes only by Sarah.
[Omniglot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Omniglot): Completely understands the local [Conlang](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ConLang) without any trouble.

[Platonic Life-Partners](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlatonicLifePartners): She and Noct get over their initial bickering very quick to become really fast friends, albeit still keeping all the snarky dialogue that began their relationship in the first place.

[Plucky Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PluckyGirl): Very upbeat and positive, always remaining level-headed and cheerful despite their strange situation - in contrast to Noct who is *very* lost and [freaking out over the aliens.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LittleGreenMen)
[Royal Rapier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoyalRapier): Though her weapon is called "Sarah's Shortsword," it is actually one of these, and is imbued with holy power (meaning that it is light elemental).

[Silk Hiding Steel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SilkHidingSteel): Easily stands on an equal footing with [Noctis](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasterOfAll) without dropping an single ounce of her grace and finesse.
[Simple, yet Opulent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SimpleYetOpulent): Her choice of clothing most certainly reflects this.

[Teeth-Clenched Teamwork](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeethClenchedTeamwork): Her first fight alongside Noctis has them arguing, getting in each others way, and generally failing to cooperate. Trying for a [Combination Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombinationAttack) during that fight has them literally tripping over each other. Fortunately they start getting along soon after.

[Absolute Xenophobe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbsoluteXenophobe): As a result of being walled off from the rest of the world and the ongoing war with Niflheim, many Insomnian citizens are considerably wary if not contemptuous of outsiders from other territories and those deemed as foreigners, even if those foreigners are loyal members of the Kingsglaive. This attitude comes back to bite the Kingdom of Lucis when King Regis' decision to relinquish outside territories to Niflheim rule for a peace treaty leads to a full on revolt by much of the Kingsglaive forces.

[Citadel City](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CitadelCity): Insomnia is one of these, using magical walls sustained by the Throne of royal family to hold off the assault of the Niflheim Empire for decades, and maintaining stability and peace in the capital city while the Lucian territories get annexed.

[Dark Is Not Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkIsNotEvil): All of the royal family members and occupations closely tied to it wear black uniforms.  (SPOILER) That being said, the color is based on what the founder wore and he wasn't exactly the best of people.
[Doomed Hometown](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoomedHometown): Insomnia is the capital city of Lucis.

[Fantasy Counterpart Culture](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FantasyCounterpartCulture): [Hajime Tabata](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) called Lucis "friendly" compared to the administration of Japan's prime minister Shinzō Abe, but wouldn't make a direct comparison. Insomnia itself is based on Shinjuku, Tokyo and modern Japanese culture. Lucis' combat force, the Kingsglaive, also has great allusions to Ninjas/Shinobi in terms of covert battle tactics and supernatural control over the elements that were commonly ascribed to ninjas.
[The Good Kingdom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGoodKingdom): Of the quintessential fantasy variety, albeit more modern.

[The Grim Reaper](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGrimReaper): Lucis's patron deity, if the kingdom's [emblem](http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/finalfantasy/images/0/07/Lucis-Emblem.png/revision/latest?cb=20160416031105) and [Color Motif](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColorMotif) of black are any indication. In an early trailer for *Versus XIII*, a stone carving of the Reaper is holding Etro's portrait.
[Ironic Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IronicName): Lucis means light, but the color of Lucian nobility and royalty is black. For Tenebrae it's the exact opposite.
[Magical Society](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicalSociety): Lucis's society revolves around magic, contrasting Niflheim's machine-based society.
[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Lucis means "light" in Latin.

[Monument of Humiliation and Defeat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MonumentOfHumiliationAndDefeat): During the 10-year [Time Skip](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeSkip) in *XV*,  (SPOILER) Ardyn  moves into Insomnia.
[Power Crystal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerCrystal): It powers the entire kingdom and has a profound influence on its advanced technology.

[Royals Who Actually Do Something](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoyalsWhoActuallyDoSomething): The Caelum dynasty is filled with one [Warrior Prince](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WarriorPrince) (and princess) after another. Being a fighter seems to be part of the job.
[Shifting Sand Land](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShiftingSandLand): Leide is a desert region.
[Standard Sci-Fi Army](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StandardSciFiArmy): Just about every category available is used by Lucis.

[We ARE Struggling Together](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeAreStrugglingTogether): The Kingdom of Lucis has a ton of issues that prevents it from effectively fighting against the Niflheim Empire Army. On top of being outgunned and out-manned as well as the outskirt territories being left to rot to Daemons outside the Insomnia walls, there's a lot of [Interservice Rivalry](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InterserviceRivalry), where the Lucis Army, which is composed of locals, dislikes the Kingsglaive, the elite forces and specialized soldiers, which is composed of refugees. Many of the Kingsglaive in turn dislike the army for the fact that the Kingsglaive are the ones serving on the front lines while they guard a peaceful city behind a magical barrier. The homes of the Kingsglaive members are outside of Insomnia, so the minute Regis agrees to relinquish those territories to Niflheim, most of the Glaive turn traitor and help to dismantle the kingdom.

[13 Is Unlucky](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThirteenIsUnlucky): He is the 113th king of Lucis, and has the dubious honor of allowing Niflheim to conquer Lucis at the end of his rule, along with dying during the invasion of Insomnia and burdening his son with the prophecy of the Astrals,  (SPOILER) which ultimately leads to Noctis's own demise and the end of the Lucis royal bloodline . It's subverted, however, in that his decisions were actually the best course of action he could take in the long run,  (SPOILER) resulting in the annihilation of Eos's greater threat .

[Appeal to Force](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AppealToForce): Ardyn might as well have just put a gun to Regis's head and told him to sign the treaty, lest Niflheim return in the future and take Insomnia by force. Regis realizes that eventually Lucis would be overwhelmed by the sheer military might of Niflheim and would have to agree to the treaty—no matter how suspicious it was—in order to save his Kingdom and people.

tropeName: Ascend to a Higher Plane of Existence
tropeNotes: [Ascend to a Higher Plane of Existence](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendToAHigherPlaneOfExistence): He joins the ranks of the previous kings of Lucis upon his death, and is the one to vouch for Nyx when he asks for their help.

[Barrier Maiden](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BarrierMaiden): Male example; [his life-force is what powers the shield around Lucis](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CastFromHitPoints). And as the "Dawn" trailers show, it has clearly taken its toll on him.
[Benevolent Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BenevolentBoss): By the standards of royalty, the Kingsglaive and his council members are loyal to him.
[Big Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigGood): He's the ruler of Lucis.

[Bodyguard Betrayal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BodyguardBetrayal): The Crownsguard are reassigned to protect the people, and the Kingsglaive the King and Citadel, following a peace treaty offered by Niflheim. Most of the latter betray Regis, and its leader Titus Drautos ends up assassinating him.

[The Chains of Commanding](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheChainsOfCommanding): In *Kingsglaive*, he is stuck with the [choice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SadisticChoice) [of](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MortonsFork) continuing to fight Niflheim at the expense of his remaining life-force and his soldiers' lives, or accepting peace at the cost of surrendering nearly his entire kingdom and abandoning his people to Niflheim's rule. He's screwed either way; Niflheim had zero intention of honoring the peace treaty.
[Classy Cane](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ClassyCane): Owns a gold-tipped one that he uses as a crutch, given his accelerated aging and waning powers.

[Comes Great Responsibility](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ComesGreatResponsibility):
    - In the 2013 trailer, he advises a young Noctis to be careful with his words, as even an offhand comment can have dramatic, unforeseen consequences when it comes out of a king's mouth—for example, calling a dish bad because he doesn't like it could result in the cook's firing. See [A Father to His Men](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AFatherToHisMen). - In Episode 3 of *Brotherhood* he chastises Noctis for endangering others with his recklessness, which a king should not do. Granted, Noct was actually taking the blame for someone else, but Regis didn't know that.

[Comic-Book Fantasy Casting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ComicBookFantasyCasting): His finalized likeness is based off British actor Jon Campling, though he's voiced by [Sean Bean](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/SeanBean) in the movie and Jim Pirri in the game. The flashback in *Kingsglaive*'s prologue shows that his appearance in his prime [resembles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InkSuitActor) that of the movie's English voice actor, Sean Bean.
[Cool Old Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolOldGuy): Noctis considers him as such and profoundly idolizes him.
[Declaration of Protection](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeclarationOfProtection): He solemnly promises to protect Noctis, after a demon sent by Niflheim nearly kills him.

[Dented Iron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DentedIron): The reason Regis is using a cane and wearing a brace come *Kingsglaive* is purely due to the strain of keeping up the magical barrier (as Ignis surmises during Episode 4 of *Brotherhood*). The man who used to be a badass [Master Swordsman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasterSwordsman) can now barely walk.

[Died Standing Up](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiedStandingUp): Subverted; after Glauca runs him through with his sword, Regis spends his last breath trying to keep his composure and becomes motionless. His corpse keeps standing up for a few seconds before Glauca mercilessly shoves it to the floor.
[Dies Wide Open](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiesWideOpen): His eyes remain open after his death.
[Drives Like Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DrivesLikeCrazy): According to Cid, Regis was a *terrible* driver. [Like Father, Like Son](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LikeFatherLikeSon).

[Dying Moment of Awesome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DyingMomentOfAwesome): In the second half of *Kingsglaive*, Regis faces off against Glauca while telling Nyx and Luna to flee, and he ends up getting stabbed by Glauca. He was played by the [Chronically Killed Actor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChronicallyKilledActor) [Sean Bean](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/SeanBean), after all.

[A Father to His Men](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AFatherToHisMen): In addition to being a pretty great dad to Noctis, he also cares deeply for his people and his staff in particular. As the 2013 trailer reveals, despite his household cook perhaps not being the best, he wants to make sure the cook isn't fired over one bad dish.
[Fingore](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Fingore): His fingers are cut off by Glauca, causing him to lose the Ring of the Lucii.
[Flying Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlyingWeapon): He wields the same Armiger powers as Noctis, after all.

[Forced to Watch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForcedToWatch): After Clarus gets [Impaled with Extreme Prejudice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpaledWithExtremePrejudice) courtesy of Glauca, all Regis can do is to [say his name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SayMyName).

[Good Is Not Soft](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodIsNotSoft): [Played With](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayedWith). In general, he's a very kind man and loving father and just about everyone idolizes him, especially Noct. That said, he pulls no punches in meting out punishment when Noctis falls out of line. It's a [Justified Trope](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JustifiedTrope) of course, because as the heir to Lucis, Noctis has to be properly groomed and made to develop a strong discipline, and for his part, Noctis fully understands and accepts it.
[Good Parents](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodParents): A strict but very loving father. Noctis only has good things to say about him.

[Hero Antagonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroAntagonist): He's [The Heavy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeavy) in *Episode Ardyn*, being the main obstacle Ardyn must clear before he can finally deal with his brother Somnus.
[Heroic BSoD](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicBSOD): He goes through a minor one when Clarus is killed.
[Heroic Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice): He covers for Nyx and Luna's escape before making his last stand with Glauca at the cost of his own life.

[Impaled with Extreme Prejudice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpaledWithExtremePrejudice): Glauca runs him through from behind with his sword, in a manner eerily similar to [Sephiroth's murder of Aerith in](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag) *[Final Fantasy VII](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII).*
[In-Series Nickname](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InSeriesNickname): His closest friends call him "Reggie" in private. [Except Cid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GrumpyOldMan); he's not one for formalities.

[I Was Quite a Looker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IWasQuiteALooker): Though not terrible-looking for an old man, he was [strappingly handsome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TallDarkAndHandsome) in his physical prime, as seen during the opening act of *Kingsglaive*.

[Kansas City Shuffle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KansasCityShuffle): Regis received a vision of an apocalyptic future where Niflheim destroys Lucis and the world is plunged into darkness and chaos from the crystal. Cid Sophiar lampshades that Regis knew Niflheim was trying to con him and was simply trying to make do with what he had. Regis believed that he could take the Emperor of Niflheim into his custody if necessary and sent his glaives out to rescue Luna who they had abducted. What he did not count on was that this was part of their plan all along, using Luna as bait in a trap, to lure and kill off the glaives loyal to him during the rescue mission to weaken his defenses, kill him and his councilors, as well as steal the Lucian Crystal. He was also not aware of the traitors within the Kingsglaive.
[Last Stand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastStand): He makes a final stand against Glauca in *Kingsglaive*, but it doesn't work out and he is killed.

[Living Battery](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LivingBattery): He's the source of the magic used by the Kingsglaive and his own bodyguards. Unlike with Noctis however, they don't need to be near him to use it.

[Living with the Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LivingWithTheVillain): As he and Noct share their goodbyes, the pair can be seen warmly reassuring each other that they will be all right. Unbeknownst to the pair, standing nearby is Regis's own assassin in the not so distant future, Titus Drautos/Glauca, who had been living in Insomnia at the Palace listening to their secrets, overhearing their plans, and working to bring down the Kingdom of Lucis for over a decade.

[Manly Facial Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManlyFacialHair): Wore a neatly trimmed beard in his prime, and was a [Master Swordsman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasterSwordsman) to boot. He still proves capable of holding his own during battles, even with his advanced age.
[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Regis, Lucis and Caelum are Latin for "king", "light" and "sky", respectively.
[Mentor Occupational Hazard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MentorOccupationalHazard): He taught his son how to become a good king before he is slain by Glauca.
[Mirror Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MirrorBoss): In *Episode Ardyn*, he is fought as a boss using the Royal Arms,  (SPOILER) just like Ardyn Lucis Caelum .
[My Greatest Failure](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MyGreatestFailure): His failure to protect Ravus and Luna from Niflheim.

[Narrator All Along](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NarratorAllAlong):  (SPOILER) He's the narrator of the ["Where Are They Now?" Epilogue](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhereAreTheyNowEpilogue) of the *Dawn of the Future* novel .

[Not So Above It All](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotSoAboveItAll): Regis is one of the [Big Goods](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigGood) of the game and one of the most idyllic figures of royalty. He also once carved 'Property of Mr. Hammerproof Thickskull' into one of Cid's hammers.

[Obi-Wan Moment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObiWanMoment): Pulls one on Nyx and Luna after the trio barely escapes from Glauca. He puts a barrier between himself and the two, and makes a final stand against the incoming Niflheim general, determined to make sure Luna is escorted to safety. Bonus points for actually getting killed and [Ascending to a Higher Plane of Existence](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendingToAHigherPlaneOfExistence) afterwards.
QUOTE *[To Luna]* "I know your mother would wish the same as me: that you and Noctis live happily. All those years captive because I failed you. *Not again*. Locked doors will seal your fate no longer."
[Offing the Offspring](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OffingTheOffspring): A non-malevolent example.  (SPOILER) His armoured spirit deals the final blow to Noctis, helping him fulfill his destiny.
[Oh, Crap!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OhCrap): In the second half of *Kingsglaive*, Regis is utterly shocked when he realizes that Niflheim's peace treaty is a trap and when Clarus is killed by Glauca.

[Papa Wolf](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PapaWolf): Do *not* hurt his family.
    - Further reinforced in *Kingsglaive*; knowing full well that the peace treaty will fall through, he sends Noct and his companions away from Insomnia. - It's not just limited to his family, but extends to Luna as well. At the start of *Kingsglaive*, he drags her along for dear life to keep her out of Niflheim's hands. Later on, her safety is part of the reason for his [Heroic Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice) and he has her know it before he dies.

[Passive-Aggressive Kombat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PassiveAggressiveKombat): His verbal exchange with Aldercapt right before Niflheim's invasion of Insomnia is less of a casual conversation on how to apply justice to theft and more of a duel of words where one is probing the other's intention.

[Poor Communication Kills](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PoorCommunicationKills): If he had told the truth to his glaives of his true plans and motivations for what he was doing, the greater threat to the world that was the Starscourge, most of them likely wouldn't have turned on him the way they did, thinking he was a selfish, uncaring ruler selling out their lands to Niflheim and sacrificing them just to save his own son's neck.

[Posthumous Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PosthumousCharacter): By the time of *Final Fantasy XV*, Regis is dead thanks to Glauca. The main cast fondly remembers his time with him and his wise words of advice.
[Promoted to Playable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PromotedToPlayable): He's the main playable character in *[A King's Tale: Final Fantasy XV](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/AKingsTaleFinalFantasyXV)*.

[Rank Scales with Asskicking](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RankScalesWithAsskicking): He is the ruler of a nation, and a powerful [fighter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoyalsWhoActuallyDoSomething) in his own right.

[Rapid Aging](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RapidAging): Due to the strain of maintaining the magical barrier via the kingdom's [Power Crystal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerCrystal), he has aged rapidly into a gray-haired elderly man despite being 50 years old.
[Reasonable Authority Figure](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReasonableAuthorityFigure): He has a reasonable judgment befitting of a king.
[Say My Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SayMyName): Regis yells Clarus's name when the latter gets killed by Glauca.
[Sharp-Dressed Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SharpDressedMan): His suits are perhaps the sharpest in the entire game.
[Shock and Awe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShockAndAwe): He seems to have an affinity for lightning magic, using it liberally against the Niflheim forces attacking Insomnia with flair.

tropeName: Too Good for This Sinful Earth
tropeNotes: [Too Good for This Sinful Earth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TooGoodForThisSinfulEarth): He has the values of a mature man: wise, courageous, loyal, a loving father to his son and a devoted leader to his people. His last act alive was pulling off a [heroic sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice) so that Luna and Nyx could escape.

[Unwitting Instigator of Doom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnwittingInstigatorOfDoom): His one notable action in *Kingsglaive* is to accept a peace treaty from Niflheim, thus leading to the destruction of Insomnia and the kingdom's fall. Subverted in that [he knew Lucis was going to fall to the Niflheim Empire no matter what he did](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MortonsFork).
[Unwitting Pawn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnwittingPawn): With his son absent, it only takes a peace treaty from Niflheim for him to seal the fate of the kingdom in the Empire's favor.

[Vehicular Sabotage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VehicularSabotage): Regis sends Noctis off on a trip to Altissia, humorously reminding his son to be mindful of his manners around Luna. In reality, the marriage was simply a cover up; Regis never intended for Noctis to go to Altissia to marry. He sabotaged the Regalia to have it break down right outside Insomnia, arranging for Cid Sophiar to look after the King-to-be, although he declined Cid’s request to meet him in person. Regis had this all elaborately set up to have Noctis away from the Crown City in order to protect him from Niflheim’s inevitable invasion, though he regretted not being able to be honest with his son.

[Weak, but Skilled](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeakButSkilled): He's the penultimate boss of *Episode Ardyn*, and he more than shows that [Rank Scales with Asskicking](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RankScalesWithAsskicking), being this compared to Ardyn. In fact, in the novelized version of the events, Ardyn himself suggested that, had he not been the [Humanoid Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumanoidAbomination) he is, Regis could've easily won.

[What the Hell, Hero?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellHero): Flat-out gets called out on this by Nyx, for putting his own son's wellbeing ahead of everyone else's, even sacrificing his own soldiers and citizens for it. In fact, most of the Kingsglaive betray him over this. To his credit, if they knew *why* he took such actions for his son, and exactly *what* the real threat was, they wouldn't be complaining so much.  (SPOILER) Until its revealed the real threat is meant to unleash the starscourge and kill most of them, making them even more justified.  [If he had been more communicative about his motives](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PoorCommunicationKills) though, it is unlikely they would have decided to betray him.

[Younger Than They Look](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YoungerThanTheyLook): He is 50 years old, but has [aged well beyond that](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RapidAging) due to the strain of maintaining the magical barrier around Lucis. Funnily enough, his physical model, Jon Campling, was 49 at the time of filming.

[You Shall Not Pass!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouShallNotPass): Regis puts up a forcefield around himself and Glauca to allow Luna and Nyx to escape unharmed. Unfortunately for Regis, he is killed in the process.

[Advertised Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdvertisedExtra): He is hinted to be one of the important characters in the 2013 trailer as his face <sup>note </sup>  while the man shown in the lineup is unnamed, he's the most likely candidate as his portrait in the official guide is based on this unnamed character.  before being redesigned was also shown with the rest of the cast lineup and he appears alongside Regis in promotional posters. In the end, aside from his role in Kingsglaive, he's barely mentioned [in-game.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisappearedDad)
[The Cameo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCameo): Has a short, quick voice cameo in *Episode Ardyn.*
[Childhood Friends](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildhoodFriends): He's been friends with Regis ever since they were young.
[Forgotten Fallen Friend](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForgottenFallenFriend): In a very weird way. He's only mentioned once in the game, but never by name, after his untimely demise in *Kingsglaive.*

[Impaled with Extreme Prejudice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpaledWithExtremePrejudice): He valiantly fights one last time alongside his King despite being offered the chance to leave. [To Regis's horror](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OhCrap), Glauca literally nails Clarus to the wall with his own sword, killing him painfully.
[Like Father, Like Son](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LikeFatherLikeSon): The relationship between Clarus and Regis seems to mirror the friendship his son Gladiolus has with Regis's son, Noctis.
[Number Two](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NumberTwo): The novel makes it clear that he also serves as this to Regis.
[Red Baron](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedBaron): As the personal bodyguard of the king, he is known as "the King's Shield".

[Strong Family Resemblance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StrongFamilyResemblance): Not so much on his current design, but his [first design before the rework](https://i.redd.it/hmdatmh652h71.jpg)◊ makes it easy to see where Gladiolus got his looks.

[Undying Loyalty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UndyingLoyalty): Regis offers him the chance to flee as Glauca prepares to attack them. However, Clarus insists on staying, stating that if Regis falls, so will Lucis.
[Mission Control](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MissionControl): Is the primary quest-giver in Comrades.
[Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl): While a bit serious, she's regardless very kind and somewhat motherly.
[The Reliable One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheReliableOne): Cor's most trusted officer. Anything he tasks her with, she gets done. Whether it's combat, support, intelligence, and cooking!
[Team Chef](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamChef): Not as *spectacular* as Ignis, but she is the team's primary cook in Comrades.
[Team Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamMom): Takes up this role in *Comrades*. She also takes to raising Talcott alongside Dustin.
[The Generic Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGenericGuy): He's a Crownsguard dude with glasses. That's *literally* as deep as his characterization goes.
[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): Is supposedly one of the strongest warriors in the Crownsguard, but he never actually showcases it.

[Sharp-Dressed Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SharpDressedMan): Is impeccably dressed, sporting a [Waistcoat of Style](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WaistcoatOfStyle). Fittingly, he's the player character's clothier in Comrades.
[Character Catchphrase](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterCatchphrase): The above quote, which also serves as the Kingsglaive's [Faction Motto](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FactionMotto).

[Cool Car](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolCar): Gets around in a gorgeous Audi R8. Subverted in that it's not actually *his* car, but Noctis's. He was borrowing it while Noctis took the King's Regalia for his road trip.
[Demoted to Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemotedToExtra): While he is one of the more important characters in *Kingsglaive*, he only appears in the game's prologue in *XV*.
[Don't Call Me "Sir"](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DontCallMeSir): At one point he gets tired of Nyx referring to him as "Sir" and would rather have a man-to-man talk with the latter.
[Fashionable Asymmetry](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FashionableAsymmetry): Wears a cloak that only goes over half his back. It's hard to describe.
[Fighting for a Homeland](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FightingForAHomeland): His and most of the Kingsglaive's motivation.

[Fights Like a Normal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FightsLikeANormal): Despite having access to the king's magical power as a member of the Kingsglaive, Drautos never uses it to fight his battles. He even chastises Nyx for overly depending on it, especially since King Regis's life force is a finite resource.

[Four-Star Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FourStarBadass): He's very well respected by the Kingsglaive, with Nyx taking Drautos's criticism in stride because he's right, and conveniently bails Nyx out when the latter is in a pinch.
[Good Scars, Evil Scars](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodScarsEvilScars): Sports several scars across his face, implying he is a veteran who has seen and fought many battles.
[Ink-Suit Actor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InkSuitActor): His likeness is based on his English voice actor in *Kingsglaive*, Adrian Bouchet.
[Large and in Charge](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeAndInCharge): He's at least half a foot taller than the next tallest Glaive, namely his pupil Nyx.
[Mentor Archetype](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MentorArchetype): Drautos is quick to chastise Nyx for being short-sighted, and the latter takes it in stride because he still looks up to Drautos.
[Walking Spoiler](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingSpoiler): Drautos only appears in the first scene of the game. *Kingsglaive* gives him a more important role.

[You're Nothing Without Your Phlebotinum](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YoureNothingWithoutYourPhlebotinum): When Nyx declares that he follows his own strength, Drautos points out that this strength is reliant on the king, and that Nyx is "[nothing without the king](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Foreshadowing)". He is ultimately dead-wrong, as it turns out Nyx is plenty impressive without it.

[The Ace](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAce): If one shotting a Behemoth didn't tip you off, this guy is the top of the cream in handling Regis's borrowed magic. Not only does he fend off treacherous glaives with relative ease, he even goes toe to toe with the mighty General [Glauca](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeavy) and eventually defeats him.

[Badass Boast](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBoast): Several times in the movie.
QUOTE  *(To the past Kings of Lucis demanding his life in exchange for using the Power of the Kings)* "You guys drive a hard bargain. *([Beat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Beat))* Where do I sign?"

QUOTE "I don't know if you've heard it, but I'm the hero around here."

[Body Horror](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BodyHorror): Towards the end of the film, his body starts to get riddled with [Volcanic Veins](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VolcanicVeins) as a sign of the Lucii's power eating away at him. By the end of the fight, most of his body is burnt and he has lived through two spontaneous combustions, only to die anyway due to the pact with the Lucii.

[Brought Down to Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BroughtDownToBadass): As soon as King Regis dies, all members of the Kingsglaive lose their connection to his magic. Nyx doesn't let that hinder his mission to protect Luna, fending off several attacks as they make their way through the city. It takes getting shot by Lazarus, as well as Glauca trying to strike him and Luna as he's injured, for him to cross the [Godzilla Threshold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GodzillaThreshold) and use the Ring of the Lucii to regain his power.

[The Cameo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCameo): Nyx makes a particularly grisly cameo appearance before the [Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinalBoss) of *XV* as detailed below in [Creepy Souvenir](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CreepySouvenir).

[Chronic Hero Syndrome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChronicHeroSyndrome): Hence his [In-Series Nickname](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InSeriesNickname). It seems Nyx constantly feels like he has to save others, which he shows from the start by saving Pelna and Libertus despite receiving orders to withdraw. Nyx claims he does this because he failed to save his sister in the past, and it clearly still haunts him.
[Comic-Book Fantasy Casting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ComicBookFantasyCasting): His likeness is based off French model Johan Akan, though Nyx is played by different voice actors.

[Creepy Souvenir](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CreepySouvenir): In a twisted take on the trope, his ultimate fate is *becoming* the creepy souvenir.  (SPOILER) After initiating the Starscourge, Ardyn Izunia chained his corpse above the throne in Insomnia, alongside Lunafreya, King Regis and Emperor Aldercapt.
[Dark Is Not Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkIsNotEvil): He is named after a night goddess and is clad in an all black uniform, yet is as loyal and honorable as they come.
[Deadpan Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadpanSnarker): While not an overt case, Nyx regardless tends to have at least one clever quip for any given situation.

[Defeating the Undefeatable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefeatingTheUndefeatable): Takes down Niflheim's extremely powerful and dangerous [Imperial General](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeavy) in single combat, along with Niflheim's most powerful creations, the Diamond Weapons, at the cost of his own life.

[Determinator](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Determinator): His primary character trait. From rescuing injured comrades to protecting Luna, once Nyx focuses his mind on a task, nothing will stop him from carrying it out. He doesn't even mind giving up his own life, so long as Luna escapes and the royal bloodline survives.

tropeName: Did You Just Flip Off Cthulhu?
tropeNotes:
[Did You Just Flip Off Cthulhu?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DidYouJustFlipOffCthulhu): He outright mocks the past kings of Lucis sealed within the Ring of the Lucii for their inaction towards the sacking of Insomnia. Interestingly, his defiance and belief in carving a future impress them enough to grant Nyx their power until dawn.
QUOTE "To hell with your power. I'm not here for it. I only came to tell you: you are *no* kings."

[Disappointed by the Motive](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisappointedByTheMotive): Combined with [Disappointed in You](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisappointedInYou) and [Broken Pedestal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrokenPedestal). Nyx is clearly saddened by Drautos, a man he looked up to as a strong leader and mentor, being as childishly naive as he is, revealing he betrayed Lucis because [Niflheim](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheEmpire) apparently promised him back his homeland, which they themselves had stolen in the first place. Nyx outright shakes his head pityingly and corrects Drautos, informing him he has been duped.
QUOTE "I don't see much of a future on the other side of that promise."

[Doomed by Canon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoomedByCanon): He is notably absent from *Final Fantasy XV*, which takes place during/after the events of *Kingsglaive*. It is evident that [he won't survive](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeroDies), thanks to him using the Ring of the Lucii to battle Glauca; the Power of Kings lasts only until dawn, killing him afterwards.  (SPOILER)  In a rather twisted, well, twist, Nyx does, in fact, appear in the game, though as an illusory corpse and one of Ardyn's sick "trophies" chained up above the throne.

[Dying Moment of Awesome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DyingMomentOfAwesome): A more prolonged death than most, but Nyx goes out like a hero during the movie's final act; he makes a pact with the past kings of Lucis at the cost of his life to stall off Glauca and Niflheim's forces. He then spends the rest of his screentime engaging the general in a fierce duel to the death, all while summoning the statues of the Old Wall to deal with the Diamond Weapons, before finally defeating Glauca and the Niflheim invasion force right before dawn arrives, fulfilling his contract. Avenging King Regis, Queen Sylva and Clarus in the process along with Crowe and all the other loyalist glaives who were murdered at Glauca's behest, among others. He dies content with the knowledge that he has allowed Lucis to send out a glimmer of hope that will eventually defeat Niflheim and restore the kingdom. Little does he know his actions and sacrifice lead to the entire world being saved.
[Empowered Badass Normal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EmpoweredBadassNormal): The Ring of the Lucii rejects Ravus and Lazarus violently, but temporarily bestows Nyx with its power until dawn.

[Establishing Character Moment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EstablishingCharacterMoment): During the opening battle in *Kingsglaive*, Nyx makes his first appearance killing a monster to rescue his allies and orders them to regroup with the other soldiers.

[Et Tu, Brute?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EtTuBrute): His reaction to his many treasonous fellow glaives and when he learns of Drautos's intentions to reclaim his hometown even if it means betraying Lucis.
[Face Death with Dignity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FaceDeathWithDignity): After spending the last of his strength using the Ring of the Lucii, he waits for the sunrise and is content about his death.
["Facing the Bullets" One-Liner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FacingTheBulletsOneLiner): Before Nyx delivers the final attack to Glauca, he quips "Looks like I'm gonna owe him big."

[Forced to Watch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForcedToWatch): Nyx is forced to watch Regis getting [Impaled with Extreme Prejudice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpaledWithExtremePrejudice) at the hands of Glauca.
[Gender-Blender Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GenderBlenderName): Nyx is a name of a goddess and [Ulric isn't very feminine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrFanservice).

[A Good Way to Die](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AGoodWayToDie): At the end of *Kingsglaive*, after Nyx holds off Glauca long enough for Luna to escape with the Ring of the Lucii, he dies content, knowing he has paved the way for a safer future that his mother and sister would have wanted.
