    - Throughout most of *[Kingsglaive](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/KingsglaiveFinalFantasyXV)*, she is nearly killed many times by monsters, enemy soldiers, and other random debris and explosions from being in the middle of a massive war, and still manages to put up a stoic and professional demeanor. - After concluding her meeting with Camelia in Altissia, several Imperial magitek troopers rush in and surround her, holding her at gunpoint. From the moment they enter she doesn't look at them or even acknowledge their presence — she simply sits in thought for a moment, then stands and walks out of the room with her eyes forward, pushing the barrels of their guns out of her way. - In the main game, she stares down Leviathan and pulls a [What the Hell, Hero?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellHero) on it when it initially resists the idea of the covenant. Even as Leviathan sprays her and lashes out at her to make her fall and damage the platform she's on, she gets back up and doesn't lose her resolve. During the confrontation she summons the power of the Kings of Lucis to aid Noctis in combating Leviathan, summons Titan to defend him when he runs out of steam, and then shields Noct with her own body as the two Astrals fight, *and* she does all this while (SPOILER) bleeding out from Ardyn stabbing her in the gut.

[Never Be Hurt Again](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeverBeHurtAgain): Whatever [skills or reputation she's gained over the years](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookaLevelinBadass), the mooks holding her at gunpoint aren't quite as eager to attack her as the one in her flashback. It is also possible that this is due to her brother—who presumably still cares for her—working for the Empire.

[Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl): Said to care for everyone. Best exemplified in Episode 2 of *Brotherhood*; once she learns that Prompto rescued and took care of one of her puppies, she has Gentiana look him up and personally writes a letter to thank him. Unfortunately, she mistakes Prompto for one of Noctis's friends (she had lent the puppy to him) — *fortunately*, that mistake is what drives Prompto to change and actually befriend Noctis.

[Not Afraid to Die](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotAfraidToDie): Says this several times in *[Kingsglaive](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/KingsglaiveFinalFantasyXV)*; what she fears most is being unable to do anything despite having power.

tropeName: Not Too Dead to Save the Day
tropeNotes: [Not Too Dead to Save the Day](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotTooDeadToSaveTheDay):  (SPOILER)  An additional cutscene in the Royal Edition has her spirit and Gentiana assisting the party by using all the summons at once to destroy the shield of Insomnia and the monsters nearby.

[Odd Friendship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OddFriendship): Due to her status as the Oracle, [and her disposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl), absolutely *everyone* adores her, leading to a few instances of this:
    - She's a childhood friend of Noctis, who as a kid was often moody and quiet. Nowadays, he's a warrior-prince-slacker who loves fishing and video games. His bros often snark that she's too good for him. - Her closest friend is Gentiana, a *divine being*. It's hilarious at how nonplussed Noctis is when he mentions that fact since he's casually known her as a child himself, while the others can only stand in amazement.

[Ojou](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Ojou): Like Stella before her, Luna comes from a very prestigious family (of [Royal Blood](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoyalBlood), in fact), and is usually shown as quite fancy and has known Noct for a long time. Her classiness doesn't seem to help her much during the invasion of Insomnia, alas.
[Passive-Aggressive Kombat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PassiveAggressiveKombat): In response to Leviathan's callousness, Luna basically says that a merciless god is not worth worshiping.

[Powers via Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowersViaWeapon): The oracle's bloodline grants them the ability to commune with the Gods and heal the sick, but they cannot actually do these things without their [Ancestral Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AncestralWeapon) the Trident of the Oracle.
[Proper Lady](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ProperLady): As befitting one born into royalty.

[Secretly Dying](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SecretlyDying): She says her flesh was starting to fail her and in a private scene with Ravus he warns her that if she keeps performing her duties as Oracle, she will die however it appears she successfully kept this a secret from the public as well as from Regis and Noctis.

[Sexy Slit Dress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SexySlitDress): The side of her dress [tears](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionDressRip) all the way up to her hip as she faces off against Leviathan, showing that she [has nice legs](http://pre13.deviantart.net/b8b0/th/pre/f/2016/237/1/e/lunafrena_versus_leviathane_iv_by_stellaearrente-dafa0wa.jpg)◊.

[Shut Up, Hannibal!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShutUpHannibal): It's right there in her quote; in response to Leviathan's rant against mankind, Luna rips into Leviathan *something good*, telling the Astral that *she* should be the one submitting to the King, not the other way around.
[Silk Hiding Steel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SilkHidingSteel): She's a prim and proper lady, but she's courageous and unafraid to use her wiles and head into the fray directly to do what she must.
[Ship Tease](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShipTease): Downplayed, but seemingly present in her time with [Nyx Ulric](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BodyguardCrush) in Kingsglaive.
[Stellar Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StellarName): Not quite literally Stella anymore, but "Luna" is still Latin for the moon.
[Summon Magic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SummonMagic): Titan heeds Luna's call to create dams of earth to protect Noctis and the city when  (SPOILER)  combating Leviathan .

[Super-Strength](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperStrength): It's said that Oracles are by far physically stronger than ordinary humans. While Luna's not a straight-up fighter like Aranea, she does display a few traits of this, such as essentially tanking Leviathan's attacks with little damage, and even managing to heal Noctis after  (SPOILER) Ardyn gutted her, though this ultimately ends up killing her.

[Talented Princess, Regular Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TalentedPrincessRegularGuy): Prompto and Gladio lampshade that Noctis and Luna could have become this trope, if he had stopped working out and let himself go, making jovial comments like "She could have done better" or "What does she see in him?"
[Together in Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TogetherInDeath):  (SPOILER) Reunites with Noctis in the afterlife .

tropeName: Too Good for This Sinful Earth
tropeNotes: [Too Good for This Sinful Earth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TooGoodForThisSinfulEarth): She's easily the purest soul in the game, wanting nothing more than to help people, even the likes of [Ardyn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad).  (SPOILER) So of course he's the one who ends up killing her just because he could, and because it helps him in his plan to turn the entire world into an absolute nightmare.

[Took a Level in Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInBadass): In *[Kingsglaive](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/KingsglaiveFinalFantasyXV)*, she doesn't have her trident and thus had no magic. While she pulled her weight as best as she could, she still had to rely primarily on Nyx. In the main game, not only is she capable of enough magic to blast back a goddess trying to eat her, but she also  (SPOILER)  gives Noctis the power up he needs to take on Leviathan, despite suffering from a fatal wound.  Taken even further in *Dawn of the Future* when she  (SPOILER) is revived with Ardyn's powerset , though the novel also establishes that she was already more than capable of kicking her fair share of ass thanks a lifetime of combat training — she simply never found a need or opportunity to fight due to her main role as a healer.

[Tough Leader Façade](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ToughLeaderFacade): While talking with Camelia, Luna is quiet and subdued because she knows how destructive Leviathan might be. She shows nothing of this to the soldiers who come to threaten her minutes later, or to Altissa's panicked populace.
QUOTE **Gentiana:** *(reassuring Luna)* It was not the Oracle who assuaged [Regis and Noctis's] fears. But the girl... she holds the true power.
[Tragic Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TragicHero): Luna knows that she must  (SPOILER)  die for the light to return. She fights anyway.

[Unflinching Walk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnflinchingWalk): After the MT's enter her room in Altissia in order to intimidate her, Luna brushes aside their gun barrels and does this to head to the altar to complete the Covenant anyway.

[White Magic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhiteMagic): Luna's magic is divine in origin, granted only to a single woman of her bloodline at one time; upon the Oracle's death her successor will go through a ceremony to become the new Oracle and gain their powers. These powers are typically used for healing and cleansing the Starscourge and communing with the Gods, although she does have magic defined for combat as seen with her scuffle with Leviathan.

[You Are Worth Hell](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouAreWorthHell): Luna puts herself through a lot of hardship, thinking only of her duty to support Noctis and does everything she can to help him  (SPOILER) even at the cost of her own life.

[You Can't Fight Fate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouCantFightFate):  (SPOILER) Although her death is desperate and painful , Luna is able to take some comfort in the fact that in the long run, the darkness will be defeated.
[You See, I'm Dying](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouSeeImDying):  (SPOILER)  Luna’s body was failing and wasn’t going to last much longer.  Ravus was aware of this and expressed his concern for her.

[Art Shift](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArtShift): In the original *Versus XIII* concept, Gentiana had a slightly different design — her outfit was slightly more leaned towards an Eastern aesthetic (her current dress is a mix of Japanese and Middle European), her leggings didn't have enormous heels and only instead bared her toes and heels, she carried around a [giant sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS) and she wore red-framed glasses, though she still kept her eyes closed.

[Ascended Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedExtra): In the original concept for *Versus XIII*, Gentiana's role was that of a mediator between Tenebrae and Niflheim, as well as being Stella's bodyguard and attendant. In *XV*, she got something of a [godly promotion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Pun).

[Beware the Nice Ones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BewareTheNiceOnes): Don't be fooled by her seemingly delicate appearance and demeanor.  (SPOILER) She turns out to be a [goddess in human form](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GodInHumanForm) who manages to effortlessly defeat two of the most powerful and dangerous characters in the plot: the immortal [Big Bad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad) Ardyn (though his defeat is temporary) and the resident [Physical God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PhysicalGod) Ifrit .
[The Comically Serious](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheComicallySerious): She uses her mysterious power to appear and disappear at will to photobomb Prompto every so often.
[Curb-Stomp Battle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CurbStompBattle): Calling her encounters with Ardyn and Ifrit "fights" would be generous at best...to *them*.
[Eyes Always Shut](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EyesAlwaysShut): She rarely opens her eyes, to help illustrate she's not quite human. She only opens them when she has something *very* important to say.
[Funny Background Event](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FunnyBackgroundEvent): She occasionally pops up in Prompto's photos without the guys even noticing it.

[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): She's an enigmatic and ancient deity, but she's also [Not So Above It All](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotSoAboveItAll). She's a little bit of a [gadfly](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGadfly), frequently photobombing Prompto's shots, openly [ships](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShipperOnDeck) Noctis and Luna, and is [one hell of a good cook](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamChef). She used to be cold, fitting her theme, but evidently humanity has rubbed off on her.
[Hime Cut](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HimeCut): As befitting of a noble retainer.
[An Ice Person](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnIcePerson): She's the human form of  (SPOILER) Shiva, the astral of ice
[Kiss of Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KissOfDeath): Plants it on  (SPOILER)  Ifrit.
[Lady-In-Waiting](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LadyInWaiting): To Luna.

[Light Feminine and Dark Feminine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightFeminineAndDarkFeminine): Downplayed.The dark feminine to Luna's light feminine. Luna is [an all loving heroine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllLovingHeroine), wears white, is kind, has angelic beauty and glows with a heavenly aura. Gentiana wears dark colors, is mysterious and somewhat aloof, and her beauty looks like something you'd expect from a [Lady of Black Magic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LadyOfBlackMagic) to contrast with Luna's [White Magician Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhiteMagicianGirl) look.  (SPOILER) Fittingly, Gentiana's dominion over ice magic (and role as the human form of a death goddess) actually *does* make her effectively the truest Black Mage of the setting.
[Me's a Crowd](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MesACrowd):  (SPOILER)  As Shiva , she can make many duplicates of herself.
[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Her name is a reference to the [species of flower](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gentiana).

[Ms. Fanservice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsFanservice): She would normally avert this trope, given that she wears a very conservative outfit that covers her entire body (save for her cleavage). With that said, her  (SPOILER) true form as Shiva (one of the biggest fanservice providers in the series) on the other hand features the most revealing outfit for Shiva to date .
[Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl): While a bit cryptic, she's very kind and sweet. She even has a slightly mischievous side to her, as she seems to love photobombing Prompto's snapshots.
[Off Hand Backhand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OffHandBackhand): Gentiana does this to  (SPOILER)  Ardyn in the form of an [Indirect Kiss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IndirectKiss) flash freezing him .

[Offscreen Teleportation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OffscreenTeleportation): She does this, spooking the party, at one point, there is even an achievement for getting a photograph of her when the party never knew she was there.
[One-Hit KO](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKO): Quite fond of these. As noted above, she tends to decimate her foes before a fight *can even start*.

[Physical God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PhysicalGod):  (SPOILER) She's Shiva, one of the Astrals, and, all things considered, one of their [Token Good Teammates](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TokenGoodTeammate) .

[Running Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RunningGag): Prompto's (and by extension the entire group's) increasingly flabbergasted banter on how she keeps showing up in their photos without them noticing before. It gets to a point where Prompto actually readies himself for it, and *still* gets surprised.

[Shipper on Deck](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShipperOnDeck): She's pleased to see the Oracle and the future King to have already grown as such close friends on the very day they meet. She's also very happy for Luna when she receives her wedding dress.

[Shut Up, Hannibal!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShutUpHannibal): On his way to Niflheim's capital, Noctis gets taunted yet again by Ardyn, only for Gentiana to step in and put a finger on the latter's lip as a sign to shut it.  (SPOILER) Said touch freezes Ardyn instantly, and Noctis later shatters the body.

[Team Chef](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamChef): She randomly shows up in *Comrades* to cook for your party. And out of all the godly, divine things one can expect, she makes you a... traditional Japanese lunchbox!
[Walking Spoiler](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingSpoiler): It's hard talking about Gentiana, especially when bringing up the biggest twist regarding her.

tropeName: What the Hell Is That Accent?
tropeNotes: [What the Hell Is That Accent?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellIsThatAccent): She has a very gentle and lovely voice, but her accent is notably out of place in Eos, where the common accents are either usually Northern-American or Received Pronunciation, with the occasional Cockney and [Deep South](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeepSouth). She's a Messenger of the Gods, and as the Astrals speak a *very* alien language perhaps this makes sense.

[When She Smiles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhenSheSmiles): She's usually very serious, but when she does smile she's quite lovely. [Happens now and again in Prompto's photos](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FunnyBackgroundEvent).

[Yamato Nadeshiko](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YamatoNadeshiko): Invokes the image of the proper Japanese lady, especially in terms of her overall appearance, outfit, wisdom, and quiet dedication to Lunafreya.
[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): *Sylva* is derived from the Latin name Sylvia ("from the forest"), and *Via* is Latin for "method" or "manner".
[Missing Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MissingMom): She was killed in the Niflheim invasion of Fenestala Manor, the ancestral home of the Oracle.
[Strong Family Resemblance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StrongFamilyResemblance): It's pretty clear where Luna and Ravus got their looks from.
[Taking the Bullet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakingTheBullet): She takes a Magitek trooper's flamethrower head-on to protect Ravus.
[We Hardly Knew Ye](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeHardlyKnewYe): She appears onscreen for all of one minute and speaks all of one word before she is murdered by Glauca.

[Adventurer Archaeologist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AdventurerArchaeologist): Despite being the Oracle, she very much preferred archaeology and exploring. She was endlessly curious about ancient civilizations that came before them.

[Ambiguous Situation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguousSituation): How much she knew about  (SPOILER)  Ardyn's true fate — and whether she truly betrayed him — are left intentionally vague. Her actions in the animated prologue present her as confused by Somnus declaring himself king and dying to protect Ardyn; meanwhile in *Episode Ardyn*, an illusion of her revealed info Ardyn was never privy to (informing Somnus of the Gods' decision to make Ardyn king) and apologizing for her mistake. Compounding the issue further: at the end of the DLC, Bahamut words things in a way that makes her out to be manipulative and evil, but the version of her used to torment Ardyn when he resists fate speaks in unison with Bahamut, implying that Bahamut is deceiving Ardyn into believing she was plotting against him all along and using her image to twist the knife.  Regardless of which is true, Ardyn has crossed so far over the [Despair Event Horizon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DespairEventHorizon) he doesn't care anymore.

[Beneath the Mask](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeneathTheMask): To the people, she always came off as stoic and composed. In front of Ardyn however, she showed off her more adventurous and dorky side. She never minced words with him and loved exploring and archaeology.
[Childhood Friends](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildhoodFriends): She's known Ardyn and Somnus since they were little, but it was always Ardyn she loved.
[Gold and White Are Divine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoldAndWhiteAreDivine): Like Lunafreya and Sylva, her primary color motif is gold and white.

[Heroic Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSacrifice): She jumped in front of Ardyn to save him from Somnus's killing blow, [dying in his arms](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiedInYourArmsTonight). Unfortunately, it was a [Senseless Sacrifice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SenselessSacrifice) as Somnus still ultimately got what he wanted.

[Identical Grandson](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IdenticalGrandson): Her descendant Lunafreya is the spitting image of her.  (SPOILER) It's this resemblance that gives Ardyn the idea to have Luna and Noct (Somnus's descendant) betrothed—so that he could make Noct experience the same pain he did. Given the revelation at the end of *Episode Ardyn*, it's also why he hits her in anger when she offers him solace .
[The Lost Lenore](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLostLenore): Her  (SPOILER) death at Somnus's hands is a major driving force behind Ardyn's revenge .

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Aera is the Japanese transliteration of *Eir*, the Norse goddess of healing; appropriate, given her role as Oracle, while *mirus* is Latin for "wonderful".
[The Narrator](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheNarrator): Of *Episode Ardyn* and its prologue.

[Together in Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TogetherInDeath):  (SPOILER) The second title screen for *Episode Ardyn*, and part of the finale of *Dawn of the Future*, suggests Ardyn and Aera reunite, and spend their afterlife together.

[Unwitting Instigator of Doom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnwittingInstigatorOfDoom): [By her own admission](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItsAllMyFault), her  (SPOILER) revealing to Somnus of Ardyn being the chosen king led to Somnus's betrayal, her death and Ardyn's descent into villainy. [Of course this was in a hallucination Ardyn had](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnreliableNarrator), and the ambiguity of the situation leaves it unclear if it was true or that Somnus and Aera both knew that Ardyn was fated to become a sacrifice .
[Alliterative Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AlliterativeName): Pronunciation-wise.
[Berserk Button](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BerserkButton): Do *not* ask him where he got the name "Hammerhead" from.

[Brutal Honesty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrutalHonesty): He has no problem speaking exactly what’s on his mind unfiltered to people and within seconds of meeting him, bluntly expressed his low opinion of Noctis to his face, even though he had only just met him. It helps that he was friends with [Noctis's father, Regis](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGoodKing), when they were young, close enough to call him the nickname "Reggie" instead of using formalities.
[Deep South](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeepSouth): In the English version, Cid sports an American Southern accent.
[Intergenerational Friendship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IntergenerationalFriendship): Was close friends with Regis, who was 27 years his junior.
[The Gunslinger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGunslinger): When Cid fought alongside Regis, he favored firearms as his weapon of choice.
[Legacy Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LegacyCharacter): Cid is now a grandfather.
[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): His name is basically Spanish and Greek for "[Master of Wisdom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MentorArchetype)".

[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag):
    - He's not the first Cid to [have a Southern accent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII). - His deceased son — Cindy's father — was named Mid, after two characters who were grandsons of [their](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyV) [respective](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyIVTheAfterYears) *Final Fantasies*' Cids.
[Recurring Element](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RecurringElement). He's the Cid of Cid game, carrying on the trend of there being a mechanic named CID in each Final Fantasy entry.
[Retired Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RetiredBadass): He fought in the wars against Niflheim in his youth, alongside Regis, Cor and Clarus in fact.
[Southern-Fried Genius](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SouthernFriedGenius): He's a blacksmith and a mechanic, who sports a Southern accent.
[The Nicknamer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheNicknamer): Calls Regis "Reggie".

[Ultimate Blacksmith](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UltimateBlacksmith): After retiring and leaving the garage to Cindy, he takes up upgrading Noctis's mechanical weapons and machines to stave off boredom; it's through this that you get the [Ultima Blade](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InfinityPlusOneSword).

[We Used to Be Friends](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeUsedToBeFriends): Cid considers Regis a friend now, but there was a time when Cid and Regis had a disagreement and became estranged from one another. While they did patch things up later, Cid never saw Regis again in person, which he regrets upon hearing of Regis' death. While the reason why they argued is unknown, Cid hints that it was due to Regis not confiding with his friends about his problems.

[Action Survivor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionSurvivor): Talcott implies that she's *at least* this in the World of Ruin, if not a full-fledged fighter in her own right, but that she often asks for help from other Hunters on her bigger assignments.

[Badass Adorable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassAdorable): She is the Head Mechanic of Hammerhead, being very skilled at fixing cars — and later, implied to have some [Action Survivor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionSurvivor) chops — and looks quite cute as well.

[Buxom Beauty Standard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BuxomBeautyStandard): She has a busty figure that is constantly emphasized by the fact her jacket is only partially zipped up, which seems to be why she's a [Dude Magnet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DudeMagnet).

[Clueless Dude Magnet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CluelessDudeMagnet): She seems to be entirely clueless that she has men pinning after her, seemingly not even understanding when they blatantly flirt with her.
[The Cutie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCutie): Despite her sexy appearance, she has a sweet, upbneat, and innocent personality.
[Deep South](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeepSouth): As with her grandfather, she sports an American Southern accent in the English version.

[Dub Name Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DubNameChange): While her name is Cidney in the Japanese version (to better keep in line with her being this game's Cid), English-speaking versions changed it to Cindy for what was initially thought to be "[reasons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LostInTranslation)". In reality, it's due to the fact that there's an *actual* Cid in the game, and the localization staff apparently thought "Cidney" was just this side of *too* [punny](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PunnyName) for a major member of the supporting cast.
[Dude Magnet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DudeMagnet): Guys often have the hots for her, especially Prompto and Gladius, who flirt with her many times.
[Genki Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GenkiGirl): She has a constant upbeat and enthusiastic demeanour.
[Goggles Do Nothing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GogglesDoNothing): She has a pair of googles hanging at her chest, and although she's a mechanic, she never makes use of it.

tropeName: Hair of Gold, Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Hair of Gold, Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HairOfGoldHeartOfGold): She has blond hair and is a quite friendly mechanic.

[Married to the Job](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MarriedToTheJob): Post [Time Skip](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeSkip), she remains a mechanic, and according to Talcott turned down all of Prompto's attempts at flirting.

[Maybe Ever After](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MaybeEverAfter): In the Royal Edition, Noctis can ask Prompto if things ever worked out between him and Cindy, and Prompto only replies "I won't kiss and tell".
[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Her surname is Latin for "golden".

[Ms. Fanservice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsFanservice): Her work uniform exposes her toned stomach, being a bikini and a small, partially zipped jacket. Cutscenes grace her with some very [gracious camera angles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MaleGaze), which [Gladiolus and Prompto clearly appreciate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EatingTheEyeCandy).
[Nice Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGirl): She always has a friendly and positive attitude, especially in comparison to her [grumpier granddad.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GrumpyOldMan)
[Nom de Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NomDeMom): Her surname, Aurum, was her mother's maiden name.

[Oblivious to Love](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObliviousToLove): "Oblivious To Flirting" more like. She keeps misinterpreting the guys' (blatant) attempts to hit on her for something... innocent, much to their chagrin.

[Older Than She Looks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OlderThanSheLooks): A [downplayed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownplayedTrope) example, but it's interesting that at 26, she's, in fact, older than guys like Ignis and the grizzled Gladiolus.
[Raised by Grandparents](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RaisedByGrandparents): Both her parents were killed by Daemons when she was a child, leaving Cid to raise her.
[Sexy Whatever Outfit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SexyWhateverOutfit): Her coveralls [don't cover her at all](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Stripperific).
[Signature Headgear](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SignatureHeadgear): She's always wearing a red cap with yellow outlines and a "Hammerhead" logo.
[Southern-Fried Genius](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SouthernFriedGenius): She's a mechanic with a Southern accent, just like her grandfather.

[Stripperiffic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Stripperiffic): Her [work uniform](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChainmailBikini) includes a bikini with matching thong, a cut-off jacket, an oversized belt draped over short shorts, thigh-high stockings and stripper boots.
[Wrench Wench](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WrenchWench): She's an ace mechanic, complete with [messy hair and motor-grease stains](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnkemptBeauty).

[Implied Death Threat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpliedDeathThreat): She gives a subtle hint at one to Noctis during negotiations and, depending on your answer, she will either be impressed with you and compare you to your father or mock you for your perceived inexperience at diplomacy.

[Iron Lady](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IronLady): She's not afraid to take a hard stance in her negotiations with Noctis, even telling Noctis that if her people come to harm, then the King and the Oracle *will* pay for it.

tropeName: Jerk with a Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Jerk with a Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold): Despite being cold and reminding Noctis she could simply hand Luna over to Niflheim, she shows concern for Luna while they're in in private. Likewise, after the events at Altissia, she credits Noctis and Luna for saving her city and people over the radio.

[No Historical Figures Were Harmed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoHistoricalFiguresWereHarmed): She bears a startling resemblance to [Margaret Thatcher](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/UsefulNotes/MargaretThatcher), Hillary Clinton, and Angela Merkel. Given that all three are considered [Iron Lady](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IronLady) leaders of their own nations (Thatcher was the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, Clinton was the Secretary of State and first female to run for President of the United States on a major party ticket, and Angela Merkel is, as of 2017, the current Chancellor of Germany and *de facto* leader of the European Union), this resemblance allows for Claustra to be more easily believed as a strong, powerful leader for the player.

[The Needs of the Many](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheNeedsOfTheMany): A core concern of her negotiations with Noctis. While she's willing to allow the rite to happen for the sake of the [The Prophecy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheProphecy), her duty is to Altissia first and allowing the rite would mean drawing Niflheim's ire towards them. The player can gain her trust by recognizing this and showing empathy for her position.

[Reasonable Authority Figure](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReasonableAuthorityFigure): Even though Noctis is essentially a ruler-in-exile and doesn't have any political leverage against her, Claustra is still happily willing to hear him out and help Noct and Luna summon Leviathan.

[Action Survivor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionSurvivor): They not only survive Ardyn's train attack, but also Shiva's blizzard at that! Post-time-skip, they have become practically legendary hunters alongside Aranea and Cor.
[Badass Driver](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassDriver): More like badass *train driver*. They're the only ones capable of running the train after Aranea evacuated all the civilians.
[Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy): Much like their boss, they're both very friendly and helpful.

tropeName: Not What I Signed Up For
tropeNotes: [Not What I Signed Up For](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotWhatISignedUpFor): Biggs says as much when explaining why he and Wedge left the Imperial Army after everything in Altissia goes to hell.
[The Quiet One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheQuietOne)/[Terse Talker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TerseTalker): Wedge tends to give one or two-word answers in contrast to Biggs, who's far more talkative.

[Those Two Guys](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThoseTwoGuys): It wouldn't be a *Final Fantasy* game without Biggs and Wedge, eternal [Heterosexual Life-Partners](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeterosexualLifePartners).
[Undying Loyalty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UndyingLoyalty): Towards Aranea.

[Aerith and Bob](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AerithAndBob): In a game full of fantastical names like "Noctis" and "Gladiolus", and where even NPCs tend to have rather "out there" names, a guy who's just called "*Dave*" of all things stands out for being incredibly mundane.

[Big Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigGood):  (SPOILER) He's the one who rallies the Hunters together to Lestallum to help keep the citizens and refugees safe from Ardyn and the daemons. He can be heard on the radio during chapter 13 offering asylum to anyone escaping Niflheim, Tenebrae, and Accordio.

[Due to the Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DueToTheDead): The reason he hunts down tracks down dog tags is because they tend to be the only remains of deceased hunters and he gives them to their families so they can pay their respects.
[Family Business](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FamilyBusiness): The previous leader of the Hunters was his mother.
[Hunter of Monsters](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HunterOfMonsters): He leads the Hunters, an organization of bounty hunters who track and kill monsters and daemons.

[You Are Not Ready](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouAreNotReady): Done to himself. Like his mother, he became the leader of the Hunters. However, he suffered from self doubt and, at the advice of his estranged aunt, decided he wasn't ready to lead the Hunters yet.
[Brooklyn Rage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrooklynRage): Subverted. He has a very heavy city accent, but he doesn't act angry or violent at any point.
[The Casanova](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCasanova): He's seen hitting on Coctura, the chef of Galdin Quay, at one point.

[Killed Offscreen](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffscreen):  (SPOILER)  Implied. Players can find his clothes lying around his usual spot in chapter 14, which would mean he was turned into a daemon at some point.

tropeName: Jerk with a Heart of Gold
tropeNotes: [Jerk with a Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold): He's decidedly shady when first met, basically blackmailing Noctis and his friends into finding him rare stones. But he has honorable intentions, as he wants to make accessories that'll help protect people from daemons at night. He's also genuinely remorseful that the attack on Insomnia meant that he could keep his promise to arrange a boat to Altissa for the group.

[Shame If Something Happened](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShameIfSomethingHappened): When Noctis first meets him, he makes a not-so-thinly veiled threat that he would expose Noctis to the press if he didn't find the stones he wanted.

[Absent-Minded Professor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbsentMindedProfessor): She's rather motivated about her work, to the point where it leaves her a little oblivious to her surroundings. Case in point, she never actually realizes that she is sending the heir to the Lucian throne out on her research projects, and when Noctis brings up that he has "royal stuff" that would get in the way of his being a scientist, she thinks he means he is an actor in the royal theater.
[Black and Nerdy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackAndNerdy): A black professor who's obsessed with researching frogs and animal life.

[Ignored Expert](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IgnoredExpert): She was one of the few people to notice the nights getting longer and tried to look into it while the rest of the world wasn't concerned until the sun was rising *three hours late.* Furthermore, her belief that changes in animal behavior was the key to discovering the reason for the days getting shorter had merit  (SPOILER) since it's later revealed that daemons are people and animals infected with parasites that drink sunlight.

[Big Fun](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigFun): He's more than happy to give the protagonists honest pay for their work, and gives them fair warning if one of his requests is particularly dangerous. Likewise, when he figures out Noct is the prince of Lucis, he decides to act as a [Secret-Keeper](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SecretKeeper).

[Fat Bastard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FatBastard): Averted. Despite the group originally finding him somewhat sketchy, he turns out to be an honest and reasonable person. He always warns the group about the increasing difficulty of his requests and offers them more money for their trouble. And although he deduces that it's Noctis he's working with, he never tries to betray him for his own profit.

[Formerly Fit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FormerlyFit): Used to be skinny as a rail back when he was a journalist. Traveling with a hunter who was able to cook a lot of delicious dishes clearly had a big influence on him.
[Geek Physiques](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GeekPhysiques): He's a sweaty, obese man with a neckbeard.
[Going for the Big Scoop](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoingForTheBigScoop): In his youth as a journalist,

[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): Although he's a bit pushy and manipulative when it comes to getting Noctis to work for him, he's a very reasonable boss who knows his stuff when it comes to journalism and uses his media connections and reach to help the citizens of Lucis in times of crisis.

[Intrepid Reporter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IntrepidReporter): Was this in his youth and although he often hands tasks to those working under him while he works on the overhead, he's also just as likely to work on finding new stories by himself.

[No Celebrities Were Harmed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoCelebritiesWereHarmed): He bears an *uncanny* resemblance to [Jorge Garcia](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/JorgeGarcia), who plays Hurley on *[Lost](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Series/LOST)*.

[Non-Idle Rich](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonIdleRich): He's the highest paying NPC in the game, but despite his wealth, he still does plenty of the leg work for his magazine himself and uses his connections and public platform to support the kingdom of Lucis and it's citizens when things start going south.
[Secret-Keeper](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SecretKeeper): When he figures out Noct's true identity, he decides not to sell him out for personal gain.
[Cool Old Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolOldGuy): An older fella who makes a living raising chocobos. Can one *get* any cooler than that?
[Friend to All Living Things](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FriendToAllLivingThings): Like Noct, Wiz loves all animals, though obviously he definitely loves his chocobos that little bit more.

[Eating Pet Food](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EatingPetFood): His speciality when it comes to cooking is dishes that use the same kinds of greens that Chocobos usually munch on. While Prompto and Noctis react oddly to the idea, Ignis reminds them that those greens are perfectly fit for human consumption and the dishes Wiz makes out of them tend to be delicious.
[Manly Facial Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManlyFacialHair): He's got an impressive beard, but is otherwise a [teddy-bear of a man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy).
[Nice Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceGuy): It really shows in how much love and care he gives his birds.
[Team Chef](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamChef): Not to the same (obsessive!) extent as Ignis, but Wiz does experiment with a few new recipes throughout the game.

[Virtuous Vegetarianism](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VirtuousVegetarianism): A downplayed example. Wiz is a kind, generous old Chocobo breeder and while his cafe does have a few dishes that include meat, there are just as many vegetarian options.
[Childhood Friends](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildhoodFriends): With Cindy, whom she sees as a little sister.
[Damsel in Distress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DamselInDistress): During the Assassin's Festival, she's captured by Loqi when Niflheim invades Lestallum.

tropeName: Why Did It Have to Be Snakes?
tropeNotes: [Why Did It Have to Be Snakes?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhyDidItHaveToBeSnakes): She is extremely terrified of Daemons, to the point where hearing the very word makes her back act up.
[Wrench Wench](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WrenchWench): She works at the power plant, and is never seen wearing anything other than her protective gear.
[Fishing Minigame](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FishingMinigame): His quests consist of these.

[Ambiguously Related](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguouslyRelated): Seeker of the Sun naming conventions dictate that Y'jhimei hails from the Y, or Jaguar, tribe of miqo'te, the same tribe as [Y'shtola Rhul](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Characters/FinalFantasyXIVScionsOfTheSeventhDawn), one of the main heroines of *Final Fantasy XIV*. Given that Seeker tribes are structured around a single or at most handful of breeding males with exclusive mating rights, it is very possible that Y'jhimei is one of Y'shtola's many sisters.
[Cat Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CatGirl): Miqo'te are possessed of long cat-like ears and fluffy tails. As a member of the Seekers of the Sun subrace, Y'jhimei also has slitted pupils like a cat.
[Genki Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GenkiGirl): She is very perky.

[Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember): *[Sort of.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Subversion)* She follows the bros around for a bit, and even heals them in battle, but she herself doesn't actively participate in combat, possess any offensive abilities, or even occupy the guest slot.
[Fiery Redhead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FieryRedhead): Has deep red hair and spunk to spare.

[Nice Job Breaking It, Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceJobBreakingItHero): Why exactly are she and the Ixal beastmen on Eos? She accidentally brought them and herself over with an Allagan teleporter. Oops!
[Original Generation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OriginalGeneration): Y'jhimei is an original character created specifically for the *FFXIV* crossover event.
[Spell Book](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpellBook): As an Arcanist, Y'jhimei uses a magic tome as her weapon of choice.

[Unexplained Accent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnexplainedAccent): Quite an unusual case - in the English version, her American accent matches the majority of the cast of *Final Fantasy XV*... but is instead completely at odds with her home world of *Final Fantasy XIV*, where all characters speak with British or other European accents and American accents are non-exisent. In reality, this will be due to the voice acting for both games being handled by completely different teams, with XIV handled in the UK and XV in the US.

[Unusually Uninteresting Sight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnusuallyUninterestingSight): Her cat-girl appearance only momentarily gives the bros pause, but they write it off fairly quickly. If anything, her fatass Chocobo was far more curious to Noct and Ignis.

[White Mage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhiteMage): In *FFXIV*, the Arcanist is a DPS class that gains access to the healing spell Physick early on and can later become the healer job Scholar. This is reflected in Y'jhimei's fighting style, which is focused on healing her allies in combat.

[Wrong Context Magic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WrongContextMagic): Since she’s from another world, her magic runs on a completely different set of rules from how it works in Eos. The fact that she can cast magic at all is eyebrow-raising to the party, and Prompto is blown away when she mentions that she’s only a novice.

[0% Approval Rating](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ZeroPercentApprovalRating): Niflheim is extremely unpopular with the countries they've conquered. From the look of things though, they manage to convince Ravus that Lucis was responsible for his mother's death, and the citizens of Lucis that they're there to liberate them and bring equality to the people. They even allow Accordo to "retain" its own government and Tenebrae some autonomy, though by the time *Kingsglaive* happens, all of Tenebrae is conquered and Queen Sylva is murdered; in return, they only "ask" for their forces to be allowed entry and freedom of movement in cities (which is constantly abused) and set up some road blocks to find the group. They do impose crushing taxes on their "citizens" which ostensibly goes toward their military machine.

[Animal Motifs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimalMotifs): [Niflheim's emblem](http://dengekionline.com/elem/000/001/400/1400936/11-12_cs1w1_640x405.jpg)◊ features two dragons—one gold, one black—facing each other.
[The Empire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheEmpire): Of the quintessential expansionist variety.
[Faceless Mooks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FacelessMooks): The Former All-Purpose Model Magitek troops wear armored helmets that cover their faces.

[Fantasy Counterpart Culture](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FantasyCounterpartCulture): Niflheim greatly resembles [Imperial Germany](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/UsefulNotes/ImperialGermany), with its strong army, militaristic tendencies and technology level. Bonus points for the emperor's chief official being titled "chancellor".

[Grim Up North](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GrimUpNorth): Or rather, "Grim Up *West*"; the land that makes up the Empire's core was a vast desert before their  (SPOILER) slaying of Shiva , turning nearly the entire continent into an Arctic wasteland. It's jarring to say the least, in that there is *literally* a paper-thin border where the land is evenly split between a desert and an icy hell.
[Kill the God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KillTheGod): They are gunning for Astrals as part of Ardyn's plan.

[Light Is Not Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightIsNotGood): Niflheim higher-ups tend to wear white with red and gold, especially Aldercapt himself. Notably in *Kingsglaive*, Aldercapt's council is wearing predominantly white with white cloaks for emphasis.

[Magic Versus Science](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicVersusScience): [Downplayed Trope](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DownplayedTrope). The Kingdom of Lucis' use of [their king's magic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LivingBattery) is played against the Empire of Niflheim's [Magitek](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Magitek).

[Magitek](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Magitek): The bread and butter of their armed forces. Magitek is later revealed to be powered by siphoning miasma from daemons and in order to fuel the Imperial war machine, specimens must regularly be collected by skilled daemon hunters like Aranea.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Niflheim means "mist world" in Old Norse; in [Norse Mythology](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Myth/NorseMythology), Niflheim was [The Underworld](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheUnderworld).

[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag): The name of the Empire is one to Nibelheim from *[Final Fantasy VII](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII)*. The Magitek, overall makeup and look of the Empire also resembles Gestahl's Empire from *[Final Fantasy VI](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVI)*.
[Standard Sci-Fi Army](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StandardSciFiArmy): In addition to their Magitek armor, most of their foot soldiers are made up of androids.
[Take Over the World](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakeOverTheWorld): With the conquest of Insomnia, Niflheim has accomplished this.

[Unwitting Pawn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnwittingPawn): The *entire* Empire was nothing more than a tool for Ardyn to play with in his plan. They were simply the most powerful military force at the time, so he slowly corrupted it from within and used it for his own ends.

[What Measure Is a Mook?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatMeasureIsAMook): Ardyn reveals that the Magitek troops are  (SPOILER)  mix of human, daemons and machines  who are still at their infant stage when they are being cut down by the heroes. He doesn't question that the Empire are throwing them in a war and are the source of their problem but he just wanted to harass Noctis however he could.
[Zerg Rush](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ZergRush): Their army's *modus operandi*.
[0% Approval Rating](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ZeroPercentApprovalRating): Pretty much the entire world's reaction to his [policies](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakeOverTheWorld), to no one's surprise.
[Ax-Crazy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AxCrazy):  (SPOILER) He's completely insane by the point the party encounters him.  Also counts as [Driven to Madness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DrivenToMadness).

[Back from the Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BackFromTheDead): With his dying breath, Aldercapt asserts that he'll rise again as the ruler of the world. Whether he can actually revive himself remains to be seen, but as he was a raving monster at that point, it seems unlikely.
[The Bad Guy Wins](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBadGuyWins): *Kingsglaive* shows how he invaded Lucis, destroyed Insomnia and stole the Lucian Crystal.

[Big Bad Wannabe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBadWannabe): He drives the plot of *[Kingsglaive: Final Fantasy XV](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/KingsglaiveFinalFantasyXV)* for the most part, sending infiltrators and feigning a peace treaty to bring down Lucis. By *XV*, however, it's made apparent that his plans, while beneficial to his empire's expansion, are all orchestrated by the real antagonist, Ardyn Izunia, who easily takes advantage of all the resources given to him.
[Big Red Devil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigRedDevil): When he's become  (SPOILER) the daemon Foras  he has this sort of look.
[Blade Below the Shoulder](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BladeBelowTheShoulder): As a  (SPOILER) daemon , he has a pair of sharp spikes coming from each arm which he uses to attack.
[Body Horror](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BodyHorror): Gets turned into  (SPOILER) one of the daemons, a rambling freak of nature,  by the [Starscourge](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MysticalPlague).

[The Chessmaster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheChessmaster): Aldercapt sets up the peace treaty signing to attack Insomnia, orders the deaths of Regis and Noctis and successfully steals the Lucian Crystal.

[Cold Ham](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColdHam): Stern, yet fond of heavy-handed speeches, Aldercapt devours just as much scenery as [the suaver and eccentric Ardyn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeHam) in every appearance he makes. And that's not even getting started with his verbal spar against Regis during the treaty-signing ceremony.
QUOTE **Aldercapt:** A curious old law I still permit in the Outlands. A thief who escapes his captor can no longer be held to account for his crime. 
**Regis:** A warning to the victim? Never show weakness, lest you forgo the hand of Justice. 
**Aldercapt:** Oh no, good king. *Far* from it. It is a warning to the hand of Justice itself: *never to loose its grip*. 
*[Explosions are heard outside of the Citadel, signaling the start of hostilities]*

[Demoted to Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemotedToExtra): While an important antagonist in *Kingsglaive*, Aldercapt is hardly present in the game proper, with the focus being on Ardyn. Also counts in a meta-sense; in the original concept for *Versus XIII*, Aldercapt *was* the planned [Big Bad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad) while Ardyn was primarily [The Dragon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheDragon).

[Determinator](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Determinator): Aldercapt doesn't let anything slow down his pursuit of world domination.  (SPOILER) Even after becoming Foras, he seems to embrace being a daemon, attacking Noctis directly for the Ring of the Lucii with his newfound power. And if his last words are anything to go by, somehow he expects to bounce back from both his own death and the destruction of Niflheim.
[Diabolical Mastermind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiabolicalMastermind): He orchestrated the peace treaty signing as a means to invade Lucis and gain absolute power.
[The Emperor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheEmperor): A combination of the ruthless supremacist, military dictator and conqueror varieties.

[Even Evil Has Loved Ones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvenEvilHasLovedOnes): A tyrannical despot responsible for the deaths of many he may be, but he has enough of a heart  (SPOILER) to ensure that his granddaughter is safe and sound .

[Evil Counterpart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilCounterpart): To Regis, both being rulers of their respective countries; while Regis is a popular ruler of his country who wants to bring peace, Aldercapt is an emperor bent on world conquest.
[Evil Laugh](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilLaugh): Normally he's pretty restrained, but he'll chuckle  (SPOILER) while fighting Noctis as Foras, hinting at his true identity .
[Evil Old Folks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilOldFolks): Very much so; it was his orders to kill Regis and Noctis that led to the murder of Luna's mother Sylva.
[Evil Sounds Deep](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilSoundsDeep): His Japanese voice is deep and gravelly.

[Freudian Excuse](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FreudianExcuse): It's mentioned in the loading screens that Iedolas Aldercapt was once [The Good King](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGoodKing) and beloved by his people, but was greatly affected by the Lucis-Niflheim War, which turned him into the power-hungry despot we see.  (SPOILER) *The Dawn of the Future* further reveals that his wife died in childbirth and his only son was killed in the war, which left him vulnerable to [Ardyn's](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilChancellor) manipulations.

[Generic Doomsday Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GenericDoomsdayVillain): Averted; although we never really find out exactly *why* he's so hellbent on taking over the world in the game, the [official guide](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllThereInTheManual) reveals that the goal of the Aldercapt dynasty is to recreate the ancient Solheim Empire under their rule.
[Implacable Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImplacableMan): During chapter 13 where he  (SPOILER) stalks Noctis throughout the level as the daemon Foras .

[Ink-Suit Actor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InkSuitActor): David Gant provides the English voice acting, 3D model and motion capture for Aldercapt in *[Kingsglaive](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/KingsglaiveFinalFantasyXV)*.

[Killed Offscreen](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffscreen): Ardyn takes over during the main game and the emperor is never seen again, with his capital completely deserted.  (SPOILER) You do, however, find his clothes lying on his throne, and you encounter him as a daemon not too long after. To drive it home further, Ardyn keeps a fake copy of his desecrated body alongside Regis, Nyx and Luna in the Citadel just to taunt Noctis's party in the final chapter.

[Last Words](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastWords):
    - As (SPOILER) Foras , he has these, but given the context, that (SPOILER) he's in his capital that has been slaughtered by daemons, implying likewise to the rest of the empire , it comes across as more pathetic than anything. QUOTE **Aldercapt:** (SPOILER) The empire shall span... all the lands... By the Crystal's light... we shall flourish... I shall arise... as ruler... of the world! - As revealed in (SPOILER) *The Dawn of the Future*, as a human: QUOTE " (SPOILER) Sol...heim... The sun of Solheim will rise again... "
[Light Is Not Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightIsNotGood): His outfit resembles a Pope in white and gold, but has a much more villainous nature. He's even referred to in-game as "His Radiance".

[Manipulative Bastard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManipulativeBastard): Aldercapt's manipulativeness is evident in the game and *[Kingsglaive](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/KingsglaiveFinalFantasyXV)*. For example, he launches the assault on Tenebrae that results in Queen Sylva's murder. He also organizes a peace treaty signing between Niflheim and Lucis so he can steal the Lucian Crystal and have his forces attack Insomnia.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Iedolas is derived from the Latin word *idola* ("idols", as in [objects that are worshipped as embodiments of gods](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cult_image)), which in turn comes from the Greek *eidolon* ("phantoms"), befitting his eerie quality and white clothing, as well as the game's overall theme of death.

[Mercy Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MercyKill): Noctis sees putting him down as this. Despite all the horrible things Emperor Aldercapt has done to him, Noctis doesn't think he deserves to wander around as  (SPOILER) an insane daemon.

[Nerves of Steel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NervesOfSteel): Though he loosens up when pretending to be amicable with Regis on the day preceding the treaty-signing, Aldercapt is an overall unflappable character. Not even having dozens of swords leveled at him or watching Insomnia get sacked so much as changes his frown.

[Not Quite Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotQuiteDead): Aldercapt appears to have been [Killed Offscreen](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffscreen) at some point, with Ardyn taking over his role.  (SPOILER) The party encounters him as the daemon Foras, still quite 'alive' in a sense, near the end of Chapter 13. In the newly released patch 1.06, it shows him with the "vanishing sickness", completely consumed by his greed for the ring; he scoffs at Ravus' speech, calling himself the "one true King" because he has the crystal. Interestingly, he also asserts that he will rise again as he dies.
[One-Winged Angel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneWingedAngel): He transforms into  (SPOILER) a daemon known as Foras  sometime before the party arrives in his dungeon.
[Obviously Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObviouslyEvil): Aldercapt has a deep voice, an aged face, gray eyes and hair, and has red and white robes.

[Orcus on His Throne](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OrcusOnHisThrone): Of sorts; he's still somewhat politically active, though more often than not he's content to leave the frontline stuff and day-to-day administration of his empire to his [Number Two](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NumberTwo), Ardyn.
[Passive Aggressive Combat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PassiveAggressiveCombat): Engages in a small verbal spar with Regis on how to deal with "thieves" as they're about to sign the peace treaty.
[Recurring Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RecurringBoss): Aldercapt is encountered twice  (SPOILER) as Foras in Chapter XIII: once by Noctis alone, and later by the party.
[Unwitting Pawn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnwittingPawn): Ardyn has him wrapped around his finger. The heroes don't even meet him.  (SPOILER) As a human, anyway.

[Villain Decay](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VillainDecay): In *Kingsglaive*, the Emperor comes across as a cunning and genuinely dangerous foe. By the time we see him in the regular game, his manipulation of daemons and resulting infection by the Starscourge has left him a frail and delusional shell obsessed with the Crystal and Ring of the Lucii even before he actually transforms into a daemon himself.
[Villain Teleportation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VillainTeleportation): In his boss fight he can vanish and reappear in a cloud of black smoke.

[Violence is the Only Option](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ViolenceIsTheOnlyOption): The peace treaty with Lucis over the last crystal ends with Aldercapt pulling a handgun on Regis and triggering a full invasion of the kingdom.
[Voice of the Legion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VoiceOfTheLegion): As  (SPOILER) Foras , when he speaks it sounds like a number of people speaking at once.
[White Hair, Black Heart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhiteHairBlackHeart): Aldercapt has white hair and is a tyrannical expansionist who shamelessly backstabs and ravages Lucis.
[Winged Humanoid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WingedHumanoid): Again, as  (SPOILER) Foras.
[BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS): The only weapon he wields is a massive broadsword, and it's enough for him to rack up a large bodycount in the movie.
[Broken Faceplate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrokenFaceplate): Half his helmet gets destroyed during his fight with Nyx, indicating that his armor's regnerative abilities have reached their limit.

[Broken Pedestal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrokenPedestal): All of the respect Nyx Ulric has for Drautos is shattered once the latter's true identity is revealed. When asked why he would still serve Niflheim even after the atrocities they committed, Drautos answers that he'd do anything to regain freedom for his hometown, even if it meant betraying Lucis. It's from this moment that Nyx realizes that Drautos is the short-sighted one, not him.
[Co-Dragons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoDragons): To Aldercapt, alongside Ardyn; he heads Niflheim's military side, while Ardyn deals with the political side.

[Contrasting Sequel Antagonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ContrastingSequelAntagonist): Glauca/Drautos's overall design, along with his backstory of his homeland being invaded by [The Empire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheEmpire), him becoming one of said Empire's highest generals and [murdering the heroes' king](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheKingslayer), parallel [Judge Gabranth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyXII). However, unlike Gabranth — who at least [has a moral code](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvenEvilHasStandards) and eventually turns to the heroes' side — Glauca possesses no redeeming qualities whatsoever and remains a villain to the very end.

[Demoted to Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemotedToExtra): Or more specifically, Moved To A Movie. Shortly after *XV* was revealed in 2013, Glauca was planned to be a major antagonist in the game. Instead, his role while major, was entirely relegated to *Kingsglaive* and he's nowhere to be seen in *XV* except for flashbacks. There is absolutely no mention of Glauca in the game proper, and since Ravus has taken the rank of High Commander, it is assumed Drautos perished during his final battle with Nyx.
[Due to the Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DueToTheDead): Stands in silence after he kills Regis, incidentally allowing Nyx and Luna to escape the Citadel.
[Evil Sounds Deep](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilSoundsDeep): A side-effect of donning his helmet. Once it's broken, his voice returns to normal.

[Faux Affably Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FauxAffablyEvil): He keeps an austere, honor-bound attitude with a sleight of politeness, something that contrasts with the atrocities he remorselessly pulls over the course of the story.

[Fighting for a Homeland](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FightingForAHomeland): Even after he's revealed to be Drautos, he still insists to Nyx that his main motivation for fighting is for his hometown; Lucis and Niflheim can burn for all he cares, staying true to his own catchphrase.
QUOTE "Lucis. Niflheim. It isn't who we fight for that matters, only what. We fight for our homes. That is where our allegiance lies."

[Fights Like a Normal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FightsLikeANormal): While undercover as a member of the Kingsglaive, it stands to reason that Drautos fought without using his [Power Armor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerArmor). The fact that he managed to be promoted to [Commander](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoleInCharge) in spite of this speaks volumes of his combat prowess.

[Four-Star Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FourStarBadass): He's not the supreme commander of the Imperial army for nothing; he's significantly stronger than every opponent he comes across, and none of them ever last long enough to inflict significant damage on him.

[Gold Makes Everything Shiny](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoldMakesEverythingShiny): In the E3 2013 trailer he [wears a golden suit of armor](http://img5.fotos-hochladen.net/uploads/vlcsnap201407f4lqx93gy2.png)◊, though this is ultimately scrapped altogether for the version we know in *Kingsglaive*.
[The Heavy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeavy): Of *Kingsglaive*. Aldercapt and Ardyn drive the conflict, but Glauca poses the greatest physical threat to the heroes.

[Hero Killer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroKiller): Regis makes a point of telling Clarus that there's literally no escape once the former senses Glauca's arrival into the fray. Glauca slays both of them not long after and indirectly causes Nyx's demise at the end of the movie.

[Hypocrite](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Hypocrite): Drautos holds a grudge against King Regis for betraying the Kingsglaive and their hometowns, all while fighting on behalf of the same empire that conquered his home in the first place. It becomes even more hypocritical when you consider that he betrays the Kingsglaive members loyal to the king. It seems that betrayal is only bad when Drautos doesn't benefit from it.

[Implacable Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImplacableMan): Seriously, the amount of punishment he takes throughout the movie is *absurd* <sup>note </sup>  He gets blasted silly several times by Regis and Nyx, gets run over by a car twice, falls from a great height without his jet boots, and even takes a stories-tall sword swing head on , and he's been thwarted several times in his attempts to complete his objectives. Yet through all this, not *once* does he falter.

[Instant Armor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InstantArmor): He can cover himself with his [Power Armor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerArmor) when he's in a pinch, which is exactly what he does when Libertus tries to run him over while he's still posing as the Kingsglaive commander everyone knew up until [The Reveal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheReveal). This is implied to be one of the suit's many abilities.

[In the Back](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InTheBack): As a [Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag) to Sephiroth murdering Aerith in *[Final Fantasy VII](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII)*, Glauca knocks Regis into facing away from him, then brutally runs the king through from the back, with Glauca still facing the opposite way.

[The Kingslayer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheKingslayer): He attempts to kill Regis and Noctis during the prologue as part of Niflheim's surprise attack on Tenebrae, and murders Queen Sylva along the way. Twelve years later, he comes back to try and slay Regis once again. This time, he succeeds.

[Knight of Cerebus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KnightOfCerebus): Aldercapt and Ardyn are a serious threat to Lucis, but are hammy enough to bring some levity to their scenes. Glauca is an entirely different beast; not only is he devoid of any quirky traits but once he shows up and starts fighting, the body count rises exponentially.
[Large and in Charge](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeAndInCharge): He is the supreme commander of Niflheim's military and is a large muscular figure.
[Lightning Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightningBruiser): Due to how his armor functions, he's *insanely* fast, hits hard and takes extreme punishment while still being able to recover quickly.

[Long Game](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LongGame): Given he's infiltrated Lucis and was the commander of the Kingsglaive since some time after the assassination attempt on Tenebrae, he had about twelve years to prepare for the weakening of Lucis's defenses, instead of immediately trying to kill Regis, still at his prime.

[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): Glauca is derived from *Glaucus*, a Greek name meaning "grayish-blue" or "bluish-green", and "[glimmering](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightIsNotGood)".

[Mole in Charge](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoleInCharge): Successfully infiltrates and is promoted to Commander of Lucis's elite Kingsglaive, masterminding the weakening of the kingdom's defenses along the way.
[One-Hit Polykill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitPolykill): Swiftly takes out four members of the Lucian High Council in one strike, while lunging at Regis and Clarus.

[Pedestrian Crushes Car](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PedestrianCrushesCar): Libertus tries to run him over while Drautos is unarmoured, but the general activates his armor and predictably flips the car with ease. Later, Glauca attempts to intercept Libertus and Luna by *standing in front of them and stopping their Audi right in its tracks*; this is less successful, as they drag him along for quite a distance before the statue of the Mystic knocks him away from the car.

[Power Armor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerArmor): His armor suit bolsters his physical abilities beyond what is humanly possible, allowing him to leap across great distances and lunge quickly at his opponents. It also has built-in jet boots that cushion his landings following a long-distance jump. Because it's forged with Niflheim's state-of-the-art liquid metal technology, not only it's incredibly resilient, but also capable of regenerating itself, as demonstrated when Regis unsuccessfully tries to fry Glauca with lightning.
[Rage Helm](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RageHelm): His helmet is shaped to resemble a snarling demon, adding to his intimidating stature.

["The Reason You Suck" Speech](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheReasonYouSuckSpeech): He gives a poignant one to Regis during their battle before killing him:
QUOTE "Behold the king of Lucis, who hoarded tranquility within his precious walls. Where is your tranquility now, King? [Here is your peace, by steel's swift descent!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PreMortemOneLiner)"
[Secret Identity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SecretIdentity): Of Drautos, commander of the Kingsglaive.

[Something Only They Would Say](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SomethingOnlyTheyWouldSay): Glauca's recitation of the Kingsglaive's [Faction Motto](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FactionMotto) "For hearth and home" over the radio clues Libertus in to the fact that the treacherous glaives are being led by a familiar face.
[Tin Tyrant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TinTyrant): Square Enix definitely went ballistic with this one; Glauca dons a heavy suit of magitek armor, one that's very detailed and ornate.
[Tron Lines](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TronLines): Parts of the joints between his armor plating glow magenta whenever he uses his [Power Armor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerArmor)'s abilities.

[Uncertain Doom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UncertainDoom): The last we see of him is being defeated by a stab to the chest, courtesy of Nyx, though he was still breathing by the time the scene pans out. Within the game, Ravus is promoted to Supreme Commander, meaning Glauca either died or is left unaccounted for following Insomnia's sacking.  (SPOILER) Noctis and co. do, however, retrieve Nyx's kukris from a Daemon in the Insomnia Ruins ten years later, implying Glauca became one.

[Villain Has a Point](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VillainHasAPoint): [Played With](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayedWith), then subverted. As Drautos, he points out to Nyx that his strength relies on the king and that he is nothing without him. He is proven right when Regis is killed later on; Nyx is unable to defeat Glauca without relying on the Ring of the Lucii, which [ultimately kills him](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerAtAPrice). However, you have to take into account that A. Drautos himself was using [Power Armor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerArmor), rather than just relying on his own abilities and B. He had a Niflheim fleet and Daemons helping him out. Drautos chewed Nyx out for relying on outside forces, but Drautos himself is no different.
[Villain Respect](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VillainRespect): He bows and raises his sword in salute to Regis before fighting him.
[Would Hit a Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WouldHitAGirl): Queen Sylva is a victim of this, tragically.
[Would Hurt a Child](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WouldHurtAChild): He was sent to Tenebrae to assassinate both Regis and his son Noctis, in order to end the Caelum dynasty.

[Aesop Amnesia](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AesopAmnesia): Even as Ravus watched  (SPOILER) his sister die  because of her power, he didn't realize that all Eosian magic comes with a price. A subversion of the trope occurs later; Ravus explicitly doesn't want anything to do with the ring that mutilated him.

[An Arm and a Leg](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnArmAndALeg): He loses his left arm after being burned by the Ring of the Lucii. While he gets an artificial one made of Magitek, it still reminds him of the humiliation he suffered, and has to accept that Noctis will become the True King, even if Ravus thinks the latter is unworthy.
[Artificial Limbs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArtificialLimbs): He has a metal Magitek arm made to replace the one he lost.  (SPOILER) Ardyn infects him with the Starscourge using the arm as a catalyst.

[Back-to-Back Badasses](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BackToBackBadasses): Despite his dislike for anyone willingly serving Lucian royalty, he and Ignis make for quite the badass team and fight shoulder-to-shoulder for a short while.
[BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS): As a boss he can do a [Blasting Zone](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVIII) esque attack.

[Big Brother Instinct](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBrotherInstinct): He genuinely loves his sister, and is devastated by the fact that Luna's duty as an Oracle is taking its toll on her body, with him only able but to encourage her to see her mission through.

[Came Back Wrong](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CameBackWrong): Originally [Killed Offscreen](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffscreen) in Gralea,  (SPOILER) Ardyn finds it in good taste to infect his corpse with the Starscourge by using his Magitek infused prosthesis, turning Ravus into a daemon begging to be killed and siccing him on Noctis's party as a "stroll down memory lane".

[Char Clone](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharClone): Blond-haired, lost a parent to the villains, joins aforementioned villains' side to further his own goals, holds a high position in their military, and has a sister on the heroes' side? Check times 5. note  He *had* a hood/mask covering his face in [early material](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatCouldHaveBeen), but it was dropped in the final product. Bonus points for [two](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/YuuichiNakamura) [of](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/TrevorDevall) his voice actors [having](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActorAllusion) [previously](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/MobileSuitGundam00) [played](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Anime/MobileSuitGundamSeedDestiny) Char Clones.
[Combat Tentacles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatTentacles): In his  (SPOILER) daemon form,  many of his special attacks are done through shadowy tentacles.

[Cool Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolSword): He wields a saber named Alba Leonis in battle. The [Flavor Text](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlavorText) reveals that it was personally bestowed on him by Aldercapt.

[Demoted to Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemotedToExtra): In the original *Versus XIII* concept, he was initially planned to be a *major* antagonist, seen confronting Noctis in the Crystal Chamber in the earliest trailers. Likewise, *Kingsglaive* also kind of hyped him up to have a major role down the road. But come the game proper, his overall role is small,  (SPOILER) and ultimately suffers a terrible [Killed Offscreen](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffscreen) fate . It took until *Episode Ignis* for him to get some needed screentime and characterization.
[Elemental Punch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ElementalPunch): His magitek arm can be super charged with electricity for his Last Rites technique.

[Even Evil Has Loved Ones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvenEvilHasLovedOnes): His only true soft spot is for Luna. Even with direct orders to capture her he refuses to even entertain the idea, instead hiding Luna from Imperial capture while she is in Lucis forging Covenants with Titan and Ramuh. When her work becomes too dangerous, he provides her and Gentiana an escort back to Tenebrae.

[Eye Colour Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EyeColourChange): In *Kingsglaive*, both of Ravus' eyes are grey/blue, but when he is encountered in *XV*, his left eye has turned a dark purple.  (SPOILER) This is likely a side-effect of the magitek prosthetic that replaced his left arm, given the reveal that magitek is powered by daemons.
[Face–Heel Turn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FaceHeelTurn): After Tenebrae fell, he ended up joining Niflheim as an army officer.
[Fallen Princess](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FallenPrincess): Male example; much like Luna, he lost his royal status upon Tenebrae's annexation into Niflheim.

[Foil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Foil): To Noctis, both being princes who lost their homes and family to Niflheim. While Noct fights against the Empire, Ravus serves them; Noct hates Niflheim for invading his homeland, while Ravus hates Lucis for abandoning Tenebrae.
[Forced to Watch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForcedToWatch): He is forced to watch Glauca run his mother through with his sword during the opening of *Kingsglaive*.
[Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember): Of *Episode Ignis*.

[Heel–Face Door-Slam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaceDoorSlam):  (SPOILER) Patch 1.06 Chapter 13 Verse 2 shows his death: Ravus finally comes around to trusting his sister's judgement that Noct is the True King, and [betrays the Empire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaceTurn). He survives the attack from Aldercapt's daemons and miraculously seems to encounter Noct. He returns Noct's father's sword and professes his newfound belief in him, only for "Noct" to turn out to be Ardyn, who uses the sword to slice off Ravus's arm and murder him. Even death isn't enough to grant him peace, as Ardyn later resurrects him as a daemon to find the heroes.

[Hot-Blooded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotBlooded): Despite his militaristic stoicism, Ravus is extremely emotional and impulsive. Nearly everything he does throughout the saga is done on impulse: Blaming Regis for Tenebrae's fall, snatching the Ring and losing his arm in the process, taking his rage out on poor Ignis for Luna's death, and even his [Heel–Face Turn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeelFaceTurn) against the Emperor and Ardyn.

[Humble Pie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumblePie): Ravus believed because of his Oracle lineage he would be be eligible to wield the power of the Ring of the Lucii and become the King of Light from prophecy. Of course, losing his arm after it rejected him leaves him in a perilous position where he must watch Luna sacrifice herself to aid Noctis in becoming the True King.
[I Cannot Self-Terminate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ICannotSelfTerminate): The last we ever see of him,  (SPOILER) he has mutated into a grotesque daemon and is begging to be killed .

[Killed Offscreen](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffscreen): Initially. He's sentenced to death by the Empire after  (SPOILER) Leviathan goes berserk and wrecks the city of Altissia. Noctis later finds his body in the ruins of Zegnautus Keep in Gralea, his metal arm still clutching King Regis's sword. Of course, this is discounting Ardyn cruelly bringing his corpse back to life as a daemon.  But after Patch 1.06, Chapter 13 Verse 2 reveals that  (SPOILER) he is killed by Ardyn.
